loans.name: Kosal

texts.en:
Mr. Kosal L. and his wife, Sokheang Kan married in 1982. They have five children: two sons and three daughters. Two of their children were employing weaving scarves in the village and other three children stay at home. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Kosal has been raising ducks in a farm near the house for three years. His wife has been employed planting small trees for three years too.

Mr. Kosal is requesting a loan in the amount of $250 to purchase baby pigs and ducks for raising.

loans.use: To purchase baby pigs and ducks for raising

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort T. sells footwear. She is married to a commercial driver who sells used clothing and has four children. Business is going very well she wishes to increase sales but she is running out of stock. She is asking for an additional capital to buy more footwear to sell.

loans.use: To buy more footwear to sell.

loans.name: Hafizan's Group

texts.en:
Hafizan B. is a widow of T. H.. She lives in a small city named Arifwala in Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house. She is a mother of five children. She has three sons: Hassan, who is in the 3rd standard grade, Rashid Ali who completed eight grades of education and started a flower business, and Kashif, who also completed eight grades of education and is a salesman. Hafizan’s two daughters are Sania, who is 17-years-old and is in the 10th standard grade, and Bushra, who is 15 years old and in the 6th standard grade. Hafizan is a housewife. She applied for this loan for her son’s flower business.

She has been joined in her group by a few more members. Nazia B. wants a loan for her utensils' business. Kaneez B. wants a loan for her wheat business. Rukhsana B. wants a loan for her plastic bottles business. Haleeman B. wants a loan for her medical clinic.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dao Thi L., aged 38, joined TYM Fund in 2003. Her family’s main business is to buy and sell coals and other necessities. Mrs. L. has invested all the loans from TYM Fund into her coal business, and thus it has been lucrative. The customer service Mrs. L. provides is excellent, drawing an increasing number of customers. For example, Mrs. L. used the loan to purchase automobile to transport coals when her customers demand. In addition to her coal business, Mrs. L. opens a retail store in her neighborhood, offering a diverse range of goods and necessities. She has three children, all of whom are still in school. In the next loan level, Mrs. L. wishes to borrow 19.000.000 VND ($ 1,125.00) to invest into her retail store. Her family’s monthly income is 8.000.000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đào Thị Liên 38 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2003, nghề nghiệp chủ yếu của gia đình chị là kinh doanh và buôn bán, hiện tại gia đình chị đang kinh doanh than đốt và cửa hàng tạp hóa, vay vốn của Quỹ chị đều đầu tư vào hoạt động kinh doanh, công việc kinh doanh than đốt của gia đình chị rất phát triển, gia đình chị cung cấp dịch vụ rất tốt nên khách hàng đông, nhà chị đã đầu tư tiền mua ô tô khi khách hàng mua than của gia đình chị có nhu cầu vận chuyển thì gia đình chị có thể đáp ứng ngay được, ngoài bán than gia chị còn đầu tư một cửa hàng tạp hóa với nhiều mặt hàng đáp ứng được nhu cầu tại địa phương, chị có 3 con hiện các con chị đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vào hoạt động kinh doanh bán hàng tạp hóa.

Thu nhập bình quân.8.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Investin business

loans.name: Los Morochucos Group

texts.es:
The Morochucos community bank is a group of partners from a number of towns, such as Chanquil, and Papachacra. All of the partners work in the cheese industry in Cóndorccocha, where cars stop on their way to the south of Ayacucho.

Lidia H. has a cheese business, selling approximately 200 cheeses each day. Lidia also buys cereals and fruits to sell in Ayacucho. Lidia wants to strengthen her already successful business so that she can earn enough for her children to continue studying and become professionals. Lidia's dream is to purchase land and move her family to the city of Ayacucho to give her children better opportunities. At the Community Bank Lidia learned to save, to love herself, and to value herself as a person.

Sonia Alarcón sells cheese every day. She also sells shoes and clothing, as well as notebooks during the school year. Sonia wants to improve her grocery store so that she can help her children continue their education. Sonia would like them to become professionals, as she herself never had the opportunity to finish school. She thinks that life holds many surprises, but Sonia knows that with her savings she and her son can get ahead. Sonia used to think that only men attended school, but now she’s seen that women can also work hard and come out on top.

Bertha C. owns two small stores. She also sells cheese and buys cereals. Bertha would like to improve her store so that she can send her children to school so that they become professionals. Bertha wants to save to secure her business. She says, “Sometimes luck doesn’t last long in a business. At the community bank I learned to save, to love myself and to value myself as a person. I also take out loans without people speaking badly of me”.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal los Morochucos, es una alianza D. socias D. distintos lugares, como Chanquil, Papachacra entre otros, que se dedican al negocio D. Queso en lugar denominado Cóndorccocha, este lugar es un paradero D. carros que van con destino al sur D. Ayacucho como Cangallo Huancapi, Vilcashuaman, Quirobamba, Huancasancos, Puquio.

Lidia H., tiene un negocio D. Queso, venD. a diario aproximadamente 200 quesos. También realiza L. compra D. cereales y lleva para Ayacucho y trae frutas para vender. Lidia, quiere mejorar su trabajo hasta este momento le va bien pero quiere seguir capitalizándose un poquito mas y hacer estudiar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales, quiere ir a L. ciudad D. Ayacucho para darles mejores oportunidades a sus hijos. Lidia, quiere ahorrar para comprar un terreno en Ayacucho, ese es su sueño. En el bancomunal Lidia a aprendido a ahorrar, a quererse y valorarse como persona.

Sonia Alarcón, venD. quesos todos los días. También venD. zapatos y ropas, en época escolar venD. cuadernos Sonia, quiere mejorar su tiendita D. abarrotes, ayudar a hacer estudiar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales ya que elL. no tuvo oportunidad D. estudiar. Piensa que L. vida da muchas sorpresas, pero sabe que con sus ahorros pueD. salir adelante junto a su hijo. Sonia, antes pensaba que solo los varones estudiaban pero ahora ha visto que las mujeres también pueden trabajar y salir adelante.

Bertha C., tiene dos bodegas. También venD. queso y compra cereales. Bertha, quiere mejorar su tienda, hasta este momento le va bien pero quiere hacer estudiar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales. Quiere ahorrar para tener bien seguro su negocio, elL. dice: “Talvez L. suerte D. su tienda no le dure mucho tiempo. En el bancomunal he aprendido a ahorrar, a quererme y valorarme como persona, también recibo préstamos sin que L. gente hable mal D. mí”.

loans.use: The partners need different loan amounts. Some need 400 soles, some 100 soles. Together they are asking for a total of 3,200 soles in loans to the Community Bank.

loans.name: Maria Salomé

texts.es:
Doña Maria lives in the neighborhood of Villa Reconciliación. She is single, 43 years old and has 4 children: two married and two younger who attend secondary school. She sells fried foods in the afternoons from her house everyday. She began 5 years ago with her first loan that she requested from AFODENIC and with time she has moved ahead and has been able to invest in her business. With the requested loan she will invest in the purchase of commodities for making her foods, since where Doña Maria lives is a busy street and she takes advantage of that location to sell more and to offer her rich dishes. The next step of Doña Maria will be to invest in the physical location of her business in order to be able to offer better service to the clients that visit it.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, es soltera y tiene 43 años de edad y cuatros hijos, dos casados y dos jóvenes que están cursando la secundaria. Ella vende fritanga por las tardes en su casa todos los días, ella inició hace cinco años con un primer crédito que le brindo AFODENIC y a través del tiempo ha salido adelante y ha podido invertir en su negocio, con la solicitud que esta haciendo es para invertir en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus comidas, ya que donde Doña Maria vive es una calle principal y aprovecha esa ubicación para vender más y ofrecer sus ricos platos de comidas. El siguiente paso de Doña Maria será invertir en el local de su negocio para así poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a los clientes que la visitan.

loans.use: To buy materials for making fried foods for sale.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier M. trabaja como costurero, confecciona chamarras para varones. Este  joven soltero destina sus ingresos en su educación y apoya a sus padres en la manutención de sus hermano menores. Actualmente vive en la casa sus padres ubicada en la zona Villa Juliana (una ladera de la  Ciudad de El Alto). 

El crédito será invertido para su traslado a otra casa donde pagará un anticrético (especie de renta de un lugar por un período de tiempo determinado) ya que su domicilio actual resulta muy pequeña para toda su familia, de esa forma podrá tener con mayor comodidad y un taller de costura más grande.
 
Es su segundo crédito con IMPRO, su buen comportamiento de pago le permite acceder a otro  préstamo.
texts.en:
Javier M. works as a tailor, making mens jackets. This single youth uses his income for his education and he supports his parents in the maintenance of his younger brother. At present he lives in his parents house located in the Villa Juliana zone (a suburb of the City of El Alto).

The loan will be invested in moving to another house where he will pay an 'anticrético' (a type of rent for a place for a specific time period) since his current residence turns out to be very small for all of his family. In that way he will be able to have greater comfort and a larger tailor shop.

This is his second loan with IMPRO. His good payment history allows us to agree to another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To move to a larger house with a larger area for his tailor shop.

loans.name: Vukosava

texts.en:
Vukosava is 59 years old, is married, and lives in Bukovica, a village near Doboj in Bosnia. Her husband earns 400KM/month (roughly equivalent to $260USD). It is not enough to support her family, so Vukosava grows vegetables and raises cows and chickens, and sells the products at the local market.
The growing cost of food is making it difficult for Vukosava to feed her animals. She is requesting a 1000KM loan from Women for Women International to purchase feed for her cattle and chickens, so they can survive the winter.

loans.use: To buy food for her cattle and chicken, so that they survive the winter.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Chojchoni”  ubicado en el Sector Chojchoni del distrito de Copani, Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 25 años y es madre de 4 hijos pequeños que dependen de ella, es casada, su esposo se dedica al trabajo de Albañilería en Bolivia. Isabel con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  decidió invertir en la compra y venta de habas. Ella trabaja 5 años con el Banco.
En la actualidad se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y continua con su negocio de venta de habas que trae de Bolivia.

Con este préstamo de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles comprara 04 sacos de habas secas, dicho crédito será pagado en 4 cuotas.

Su gran deseo  es terminar de construir su casa para poder vivir tranquilamente con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Isabel is a founding partner of the Banco Comunal “Chojchoni,” located in the Chojchoni sector in the Copani district of the Yunguyo-Puno province. She is 25 years old and the mother of 4 small, dependent children. She is married and her husband works as a mason in Bolivia. With the first loan of S/. 300.00 that she received, Isabel invested in a business buying and selling beans. She has been working with the bank for five years.

Currently, she breeds small animals and continues to buy and sell beans that she brings from Bolivia.

With this loan of S/. 700.00, she will buy 4 sacks of dried beans. This loan will be repaid in 4 installments.

Her dream is to finish building her house so she can live peacefully with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dried beans

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.fr: N. Yvonne s’est marié avec ASSIMANOU Charles. Ils ont 4 enfants – 16, 6, 4, et 1, tous scolarisés. Elle est née le 13 juin 1966.  Dame N. a commencé avec les beignets d’ignames frites. Actuellement elle est en vente de vivres – riz, tomates, sardines, mais, boissons, et sucreries. Elle achète ses produits au Marché Dantokpa. Ses revenus aide le foyer, et elle veut continuer avec cette activité pour acheter plus d’approvisionnement.
texts.en:
Yvonne N. is married to Charles Assimanou. They have four children, aged 16, 6, 4, and 1, and all school-aged children are in school. Yvonne was born on June 13, 1966. Mrs. N. began selling "beignets d’ignames" (fried yams) and currently sells other food items – rice, tomatoes, sardines, corn, drinks and sweets. She buys these products at the market in Dantokpa. Her income helps her household and she would like to continue this business by buying more supply.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Dunia

texts.es: Dunia tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo Santos D. 53 años y su sobrina Cintia D. 10, que está a su cuidado, ellos viven en su casa propia desD. hace ya 30 años. La producción D. artesanías es el negocio al que se dedica Dunia desD. hace 25 años, ella confecciona caretas D. yeso que se colocan en masas para postres con forma D. bebés conocidos popularmente como “Tantawawas” o “panes D. bebé” que se venden mayormente en el mes D. noviembre, en la época D. “Todos los Santos”, mes donD. las personas acuden a los cementerios para visitar las tumbas D. sus amigos o familiares, pero Dunia produce las caretas durante todo el año, ya que obtiene pedidos D. muchos lugares. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo y también hace participar a su sobrina en el pintado D. caretas, porque tiene mucho arte al realizarlo. Lamentablemente en algunos casos, por la fragilidad D. las caretas, estas llegan a romperse, ocasionando una pérdida en la producción D. Dunia, pero ella ha aprendido a afrontar las pérdidas con mucho más trabajo y ganas D. progresar. Atraída por las oportunidades que brinda Microfinanzas Prisma decidió sacar un préstamo, empezando con este primer ciclo, para mejorar su negocio. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más cantidad D. insumos para realizar su caretas, además D. colorantes y pinturas para el acabado final.
texts.en:
Dunia is 49 years old and lives with her husband Santos, 53 and her niece Cinita, 10, whom she is responsible for. They have lived in their own home for the past 30 years. For the past 25 years Dunia has worked in the craft business. She makes masks out of plaster molds that she fills with sweet dough. These are in the shape of babies known locally as “Tantawawas” o “panes D. bebé” (baby breads). These are normally sold in the month of November during time of “Todos los Santos” (All Saints), when people go to cemeteries to visit the graves of their friends and family. Dunia makes them year round since she receives orders from many places. She really likes her job and she works together with her husband. Sometimes her niece helps paint the masks because it is a lot of painting. Unfortunately, due to the fragility of the masks, some of them break during the process and that is a loss in Dunia’s production. She has learned to overcome these losses with more work and desires to get ahead. Attracted by the opportunities available with Microfinanzas Prisma, she decided to apply for a loan in order to improve her business. With this money she will buy more supplies to make her masks, including dye and paint for the finished product.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for mask making

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda M. is a 57-year-old fish vendor from Talibon Bohol. Everyday she sells the fish that her husband catches. She has been a fish vendor for four years now. Linda wants to work hard with her business in order to send her two children to school. Aside from the fish that she sells, Linda has a seaweed farm and she delivers the produce to her trusted buyers. She and her husband grow seaweed because they earn much from it.

Linda is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional boats for her business. She believes that her loan will help her catch more fish to sell. Then, Linda and her husband will earn more to support their children.

CEVI helps Linda sustain her fish business. Through credit assistance, trainings, and insurance services, more and more clients can expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy additional boats for her fish selling business

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina A. is a resident of Punta Sulong, Baliangao, Misaims Occidental, 56 years old and married to Mr. Artemio A., a fisherman. They were blessed with three children; two of her children already have a job. They have a small Sari-Sari (convenience) store at their residence. She started her small business from their own capital. Her husband also manages their fish cage.

Paglaum conducted an orientation at their Barangay (township); she attended the orientation and she was interested. She joined the training and become a member. She was recognized on October 15, 2004 under Micro-finance Program of Paglaum and took advantage of the credit services offered by the program. Her 1st loan was Php 3,000 and was used as additional capital for their Sari-Sari Store.

She is thankful that she became a member of Paglaum for it can help those who are need, especially in terms of finances. Thus, thru Paglaum she learned how to save money out of their income. According to Mrs. Celestina, the product that she was most interested in with Paglaum is their insurance benefit because it is tested and proven.

Celestina is now on her 8th loan and her present loan amounts to Php 5,000 which will be used for additional purchase of canned goods, assorted bath & laundry soap, shampoos, noodles, and many other items. Her hopes and aspirations in life are just to expand and develop her business and have a decent living for the family.

loans.use: Additinal grocery supplies such as canned goods, milk, etc.

loans.name: Himkat

texts.ru: Клиент Негматов Хикмат 65 летий мужчина, проживающий в районе Абдурахмони Джоми.Имеет среднее образования, женат, имеет 5-рых детей.Клиент занимается животноыодством  более 10 лет на полученные деньги хочет купить пару молодых телят.От продажи скотом, клиент будет иметь прибль, что поможет ему, в дольнейшем заниматься животноводством и увеличивать своё хозяйство.
texts.en:
Client Hikmat N. is a 65 year old man living in the Abdurahman Jami district. He has a high school education, is married, and has five children. He has raised livestock for over 10 years and would like use the loan received to buy a pair of young calves. The income earned from sale of livestock will aid in his future animal husbandry work and help him to expand his land holding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock purchase

loans.name: Rose Aline

texts.fr: La dame Rose Aline B. est âgée de 37 ans, mariés et mère de 2 enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité de vente de crème et de glace, activité dont elle a l’expérience et qui est très rentable en cette période de chaleur. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari pour la prise en charge de leur famille.
texts.en:
Rose Aline B., age 37, is a lady who is married and the mother of two. She's requesting this loan to bolster her business selling cream and ice, a business in which she has experience and which is very profitable in this period of hot weather. Her objective is to support her husband to provide for their family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make sell cream and ice

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina has been a fish vendor for 21 years already in the public market in Cauayan City.  Her husband Rodrigo assists her in managing the business.  They have two children: Jennica - 14 years old, a high school student and Jero Israel - 7 years old, an elementary school student.  Her income of 2,500 Philippine Pesos (about US $51) a week is being used for the needs of their family and the education of their children.  She wants a loan of 10,000 pesos from the lenders.  The loan will be of great help in her business and also for her family.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah M. is married with four dependents and has received an education through primary school. Since 2005 Dinah has sold a variety of goods including sandals, bags, clothing and minerals at Cape Coast behind the Oguaa Hall. Her husband is employed as a Coca Cola distributor.

Dinah uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses and sometimes pays the children's school fees. She will use the loan to purchase more footwear, bags and clothing for resale and with her newly gained profits, she plans to reinvest in her enterprise with the ultimate goal of opening another branch of her business.

loans.use: To purchase more footwear, bags and clothing to sell

loans.name: Seema Gul

texts.en: Seema Gul is a daughter of A. A.. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan, with a large family. Seema Gul wants to take out a loan for her husband's fruit and vegetable shop. Seema Gul's husband wants to improve his business and enlarge it. So she requested an individual loan of 30000 Afghani. She is happy that there is this nice process that can solve the entrepreneurs’ problems.

loans.use: For expanding business

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia manages a small hog-raising business that serves as her source of income. She wants to improve her business in order to earn more profit. Thus, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva lenders in the amount of PHP10,000 to support her hog-raising business. This business is a big help in supporting the education of her children, who are still studying. Her husband, Johnny James, also works hard to overcome the difficulties of life. The couple and their children live in the rural village of Lamo Dupax del Norte in the Nueva Vizcaya province. 

Aside from hog raising, the couple also buys and sells processed food like tocino, a sweet pork breakfast dish, and longanisa, a sweet sausage. The couple really works very hard for the welfare of their family and to sustain their daily needs. They don't take things for granted and do what they can do every day without complaining. Nelia always bears in mind her motto in life, “If there is a will, there is always a way."

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Ganga Devi

texts.en: Ganga Devi M. is engaged in the business of weaving wool sweaters, caps, gloves, socks, bags, and other such wool items.  To illustrate, she accepts orders for dresses from her customers, and then she makes them according to their demands.  She has been in this line of work for the past 6 years, but she also works for the government.  Now, she is seeking a loan in the amount of $275 (20,000 NPR) in order to buy wool for her business operations.  She notes that she has one daughter, and that she got married one year ago.

loans.use: To purchase additional wool for her weaving business

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Señora Alicia is 31 years old and is married with two children. She lives in the small town of Yarinacocha, a suburb of the city of Pucallpa. Alicia is a beauty consultant and also dedicates herself to the sale of beauty products. Her husband works as an accountant. 

Alicia has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about three years and belongs to the communal bank "Los Manguitos" (“The Little Mangoes”). With her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) from Manuela Ramos, Alicia invested in her first few beauty products. She was pleased to be able to contribute financially to her household.

Alicia is currently requesting a loan of 1,100 soles, which she will use to invest in more beauty products and also in soft drinks, in order to diversify her business venture.

Alicia is pleased to be able to receive loans from Manuela Ramos. She also appreciates the educational sessions given by the organization's loan officers at her communal bank's monthly meetings.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products to sell and soft drinks to sell, also

loans.name: Rahma

texts.en:
Rahma is a member of the Mlandege borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 26 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 10 and 4 years.

Rahma started her own Tailoring  business 4 years ago,she worka 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 600,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Rahma first loan from BRAC_Tanzania she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more material.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Rahma hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more materila

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thavy T., 41, and her husband, Mr. Sopheap Theng, 41, were married in 1988 and have two children: one son who attends school and one daughter who assists her mother in the business. The family lives along National Road Number One about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Thavy has been selling cucumber pickles and fruit for eight years. She buys them from her village and other nearby villages, and resells them at the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for three years and also assists in his wife’s business. But, his motorbike is old and breaks down and he decided to sell it.

Hence Thavy is applying for a loan of $1,200 in order to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to continue his motor taxi business. She will use a part of her loan to purchase one more shop for her daughter to sell cucumber pickles.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike for her husband's business and to set up another shop

loans.name: Elba

texts.en: Elba C. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 52 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Elba owns and operates a business running a food stall, selling rice and other food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Elba joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Elba is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a fishing net for her husband's fishing activity. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a fishing net for her husband's fishing business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Hog raising is the main source of income for Rosita A., a 53 year-old woman from the Philippines. Rosita is very diligent in her business, and she is thankful that her family is in good condition, through the guidance of our Lord Almighty. Her husband Amado is in the farming business, and they are blessed with three children who have all been married.

Rosita wants to continue her hog raising business, and she would like a loan of 5,000 PHP from KIVA lenders. She plans to use the loan to purchase feed, which will support the growth of her hogs. As a result, she can minimize her expenses in going to the market. She would be grateful if her loan request is granted.

Rosita and her husband are striving hard to earn more profits so they can save money for their future, and improve their way of living.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed

loans.name: Muji

texts.en:
Muji is 35 years old and married with five children. She sells shoes and has been in the business for the past ten years. She uses part of her profit for the family upkeep.

Muji hopes for the loan of N40,000 to purchase more shoes to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Mujidat

texts.en:
Mujidat loves cooking and that is why she sells cooked foods by hawking the food from one market to another within her community in Lagos, Nigeria.

Mujidat is married with three children. She is 30 years old and is a focused hard-worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers.

Mujidat hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: El señor Francisco José, tiene  31 años de edad, es casado. Francisco tiene un negocio de brindar el servicio de taxi. dio inicio a su negocio hace  13 años con muy poca clientela  por lo que poco a poco fue aumentando debido que cada pasajero le daba su número telefónico y así el servicio es mucho más eficiente, ya que tenia la necesidad de buscar un medio para sustentar a su familia. El crédito será invertido en la compra de repuestos para su automóvil. Su sueño con respecto al negocio es mejorar cada día como persona y además tener otro taxi.
texts.en:
Señor Francisco José is 31 years old and is married. Francisco has a business providing taxi service. He started this business 13 years ago, as he had the need to look for a means through which he could support his family. He began with a very small clientele, and little by little it has increased because each passenger gave him their telephone number, and so his business became much more efficient. This loan will be invested in the purchase of spare parts for his automobile. His dream with respect to the business is to improve every day as a person, and also to have another taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed is a 30-year-old married man. He has owned a barber shop in his town since 2004 and has eighteen years of experience in this field.

Today, Majed is asking to borrow $1,200 to renovate his shop and to add new decor in order to attract more clients and increase his income.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and add new decor

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es: María Concepción S. M. de 28 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, vive junto a sus padres y su pequeña hija de dos años de edad. María posee un comedor en una de las zonas más concurridas del lugar en el que vive, en el comedor realiza desayunos y almuerzos, los cuales los comercializa a muy buenos precios. Debido a que no cuenta con una competencia directa, María tiene muchos clientes, los cuales la prefieren por ser una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo la cual prepara alimentos deliciosos. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos, ya que desea aumentar sus ventas de manera que todo esto pueda beneficiar a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
María Concepción S. M., 28, lives in the department of Usulután with her parents and two-year-old daughter. María has an eatery in one of the busiest areas of her neighborhood in which she serves breakfasts and lunches at affordable prices. Since she has no direct competition, María has many customers who prefer to patronize her establishment because she is very dedicated to her work and prepares delicious meals. She is asking for financing to buy ingredients needed in her meal preparations. She hopes to increase her sales to benefit her child.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for meal preparation.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en: Ziad is 44 years old and lives with his wife and eight children. He is an entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs, including sweets, soft drinks, and juice, in a grocery store that he owns. Ziad needs a loan of US$2,000 to be able to increase the stock of goods in his store. He is ready to work hard and make sacrifices to become an even more successful entrepreneur. Both Ziad's perseverance and clear vision will help him succeed in his small business.

loans.use: Increase the stock of goods in his store

loans.name: Rommel

texts.es:
Rommel G. Q. es casado y tiene 33 años de edad.  Su única hija se llama Nayali y tiene 8 años.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Yagui Grande en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.  Son 38 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.
Romel es agricultor y esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingresos para su familia.  Cultiva el maíz y papas y los vende los días jueves de feria.  Solicita el crédito para comprar los insumos agrícolas y semillas.  Sacó un préstamo antes también para la agricultura.  Su meta es mejorar la posición económica de la familia y la de la comunidad.  Su reto es llegar a tener una mejor administración en la agricultura para la superación de la familia.
La familia es unida y muy colaboradores en todo y en la comunidad, lo tradicional es el carnaval.  Finalmente, le gusta trabajar en el campo.
texts.en:
Rommel G. Q. is 33 and married. His only daughter, Nayali, is eight. He is a member of the Yagui Grande communal bank in the San Miguel region in the Bolívar province. There are 38 members in all. Most of them work in agriculture and raise small animals. Romel is a farmer, and this activity is the primary source of income for his family. He grows corn and potatoes, and he sells them on Thursdays on fair day. He is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies and seeds. He took out a loan previously, which was also for agriculture. His goal is to improve the economic position of his family and the community. His challenge is to better administer his agricultural business in order for the family to succeed. The family is united and very collaborative in everything and in the community. Their tradition is the carnival. Finally, he likes to work in the field.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies and seeds

loans.name: Sandra Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Carolina S. C., tiene 33 años y vive con su esposo en el Barrio Sacuanjoche,  el esposo trabaja como Artesano y apoya en los gastos familiares, ellos tienen 3 hijos y estudian la escuela secundaria.
Dentro de los planes de la familia está el mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia, ella se dedica a la costura desde hace 4 años y dentro de los principales problemas que ha tenido están la falta de financiamiento que ha obtenido de los bancos debido a sus pocas posibilidades económicas, pero con el apoyo económico de su esposo de su liquidación del último trabajo que tenía el señor, logro poner su pequeño taller de costura, pero ahora ella necesita de una inversión más alta de capital para la compra de materia prima y una máquina de coser que le facilitara y le brindara rapidez para realizar las ordenes de trabajo con esto ella lograra captar más clientes y obtener mejores ingresos que beneficien sus condiciones sociales.
texts.en:
Señora Sandra Carolina S. C., 33, lives with her husband in the Sacuanjoche neighborhood. Her husband provides for the family expenses by his work as an artisan. They have 3 children in secondary school. As part of the family plans to improve their living situation, she has been sewing for 4 years, and one of the main problems she has had has been the lack of financing because of her limited economic potential. With help from the completion of the last work that her husband had, she was able to start her small sewing shop, but now she needs a greater investment of capital to buy raw materials and a sewing machine that will make her work easier and quicker, so she will be able to fulfill her work orders. Thus she will be able to gain additional clients and increase her income, improving their social condition.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and a sewing machine

loans.name: Juanita Damaris

texts.es: La señora Juanita Damaris D. es una clienta con 2 años de experiencia con esta institución, donde se le ha financiado para la compra de ganado. En este caso esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de 4 novillos con el objetivo de generar ingresos al final del periodo de invierno y por ende mejorar la economía familiar.
texts.en:
Señora Juanita Damaris D. is a client with two years of experience with this institution, where she has been financed for the purchase of livestock. In this case, she is applying for a loan for the purchase of four young bulls, with the goal of generating income at the end of the rainy season and therefore improving the family economy.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bulls for pasturing

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 46 year old married man with two children in school.  He was employed in an animal farm before he started operating his retail shop five years ago.  He sells foodstuff, household items,  and clothes.  He is also a contractor who hopes to start his own construction firm in the future.  Being the breadwinner, he has to work hard to meet his family’s needs so he has requested a loan of Kes.40,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to his shop's inventory and increase his income.

loans.use: To add more stock

loans.name: Mirella Marianela

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nueva Ciudad Alfaro se reúne en la bella tierra de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí rodeada de los más bellos paisajes y playas de la región, este cantón se caracteriza por que en el habitan muchos artesanos dedicados a la fabricación de una variedad de artesanía en paja toquilla y tagua.

Una de las socias de este banco es la señora Mirella desde hace 3 ciclos viene trabajando con la fundación, ella es madre de de dos hijos, está casada desde hace 14 años, su ocupación es comerciante y lo hace de una manera informal, lleva ya 12 años dedicada a vender productos de belleza y ropa para damas, caballeros y niños la venta es por catálogo ella se encarga de ofrecerle a sus clientas y una vez realizado el pedido se encarga de entregarles en el domicilio.

Desde que esta con este negocio la señora Mirella no ha querido dejarlo, cuenta que es una manera de salir adelante ayudando al esposo en el hogar económicamente, se siente bien trabajando y la fundación Espoir le brinda la ayuda la oportunidad para que su negocio crezca cada día más, con este nuevo crédito nuestra socia podrá invertir en los productos de belleza como Avon, Yanbal y Esika y otra parte del crédito lo invertirá en ropa.

El sueño de nuestra socia es poder compararse un carro eso le facilitaría su negocio, y así podría extenderse a otros lugares para obtener mas clientes.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Ciudad Alfaro” (New City of Alfaro) communal bank meets in the beautiful Montecristi land, Manabí province, surrounded by the most beautiful scenery and beaches of the region. This canton is noted for the many resident artisans that manufacture a variety of crafts out of toquilla palm fronds (from which the mis-named ‘Panama’ hats are made) and tagua (tagua nut, sometimes known as ‘vegetable ivory’). One of the group members is Mirella who, for the last three loan cycles, has been collaborating with the foundation. She has been married for 14 years and has two children. She is an informal merchant and has sold beauty products and clothing for the entire family; her sales are catalogue based. She takes orders from her customers and then delivers the goods to their homes; she has been in this line of work for 12 years. Ever since Mirella started this business she hasn’t wanted to give it up; she tells us that it is a way for her to get ahead in life and help her husband meet household expenses. She is happy to work and Fundación Espoir provides the opportunity for her business to grow more each day. She will use this new funding in part to buy more Avon, Yanbal and Esika beauty products and partly to buy clothing. Her dream is to be able to buy a car to facilitate her work so that she can go to other areas to secure more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Wilfredo's Group

texts.en:
Wilfredo G. is 51 years old and from the city of Rizal Santiago. He is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Wilfredo G.'s group.

Wilfredo is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing vehicle repairs to local community members. Wilfredo has been engaged in his business for over 26 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Wilfredo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. As with his previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI which he has successfully repaid, this new loan of 10,000 PHP will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the ninth loan Wilfredo has taken out from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Alba Gladys

texts.es:
La señora  Alba O. es socia del Banco Comunal Damas Responsables,  ella vive en la ciudad de Cuenca capital de la  provincia del Azuay  situada en la parte meridional de la Cordillera andina ecuatoriana; es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia en el Ecuador y se caracteriza por mantener la tranquilidad y hermosura de una ciudad antigua. Su centro histórico fue declarado Patrimonio de la Humanidad por la Unesco en el año 1999.

Alba de 34 años  comparte su vida con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 12 y 4 años, su primer hijo estudia en un colegio de la localidad  y el pequeño pasa en casa con ella, su   esposo trabaja como  carpintero  y tapicero  en una fábrica y en sus tiempos libres se dedica a su pequeño taller de tapiceria y carpintería que mantiene en la casa que viven que es de propiedad de su padre y que les prestó  hasta que consigan construir su vivienda propia.  Nuestra socia trabaja junto con su esposo por contrato a partir de las 14H00 en adelante porque en la mañana se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. 

Lleva seis años trabajando con la  fundación gracias a la invitación que le hizo la  presidenta de su banco comunal desde entonces se ha beneficiado de los  créditos que le han permitido comprar materiales para su negocio y ahora comprará esponja,  tela, clavos, madera  para realizar sus trabajos de tapicería.

Su sueño es tener buena  salud para seguir apoyando a su esposo para de esta manera salir adelante con su negocio
texts.en:
Alba O., 34, is a member of the “Damas Responsables” (Responsible Ladies) communal bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca, Azuay province capital, located in the southern Ecuadorean Andes. It is Ecuador’s third most important city notable for its tranquility and old city charm. Its historic city center was declared Patrimony of Humanity by Unesco in 1999. Alba shares her life with her husband and two children who are 12 and 4 years of age. Her oldest son is enrolled in a local school and her youngest stays home with her; her husband works as a carpenter and upholsterer in a factory and in his spare time works in a small carpentry and upholstery shop he has at home. They live in a house that belongs to her husband’s father; he lends it to them until they can manage to build their own house. Alba works with her husband from 2pm on because she spends mornings doing her household chores. She has been collaborating with the foundation for six years thanks to being invited to join by the communal bank president; since then she has benefited from loans that have allowed her to buy materials and supplies for her business. With this current funding she will buy foam, fabric, nails and wood for her upholstery jobs. Her dream is to stay healthy so that she can continue to support her husband and get ahead in their business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, nails, wood, imitation leather, thread, etc.

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en:
Mr. Chinda D. and his wife, Mrs.Thida Rous (pictured together), live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1991 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Three of the children attend school and other two are still young. 

Chinda and his wife have been selling flowers and bananas for more than twelve years. They buy bananas and flowers from villagers and transport them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. Chinda wants to expand the house where he lives in order for it to be larger for family members to stay. So, he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to use for the project.

loans.use: To expand the house where he lives.

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en: Mr. Panha V. is a 28-year-old single man. He was selected as the leader of a group loan by the four group members who are located I. Preak Anchanh village, Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use it to support different purposes. Mr. Panha V. is a cake seller who earns a small income to improve his living. He decided to ask for a loan to buy cake supplies to support his business. Aside from being a cake seller, he is also a chef for wedding ceremonies.

loans.use: To buy cake supplies

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a citizen of the city of Multan in Pakistan. She owns a small two-room house in an area named Qadir Abad and has lived with her family for over fifteen years.

Nasreen operates a business selling clothes. She also has sewing skills and offers her clients sewing services for a reasonable charge. The quality, well-stitched clothes attract her more customers.

She travels to Faisalabad (famous for its textiles) and Lahore (famous for new designs and fashion) to purchase clothes. She has applied for a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan) for her business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk to minimize the cost of travel and increase the variety of clothes for sale. Nasreen Bibi is hopeful about the future of her business—that she will earn good profit from it and also increase her customers.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a printer, mobile phones, USB memory sticks

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en: Caridad A. is from Barangay Lantap, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 59 years old and is married with five adult children. Caridad owns and operates a business raising and fattening pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP when she sells a raised animal. In 2008, Caridad joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Caridad is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Nirmala

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Nirmala B..  She is married and has four children, aged 11, 7, 6 and 2.  In 2010, she established her business.  Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and will use her most recent loan to increase the inventory in her store.  In the future, Nirmala plans to continue and increase her grocery business.  She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page     

Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: increase the inventory in her shop

loans.name: Elvia Rocio

texts.es:
Elvia de 42 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes),  su esposo es comerciante informal y tienen tres hijas.  

Desde que la operaron del útero comenzó a trabajar vendiendo cosméticos, desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes, cremas , desodorantes, ropa,  trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 13h00pm para la tener en la tarde tiempo para sus hijas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y ser directora Yambal.
texts.en:
Elvia is 42 years old and lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil. She sells products from Yambal (a company that allows entreprenuerial women to become independent sellers). Her husband is an informal trader and they have three daughters. After she had an operation on her uterus, she began selling cosmetics. She works from very early in the day, offering products to neighbors and friends. She sells perfumes, creams, deodorants and clothing and works from 9:00 am until 1:00 pm so that she has time in the afternoons for her daughters. With this loan she would like to buy Yambal products such as perfumes, creams, and deodorants. In the future she want to finish building her house and to become a director in Yambal.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perfumes, ropa, cremas

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela C. is 54 years old and has three children whose ages range from 19 to 28 years old. She is married to Romeo C., a farmer. Adela and her family live in a municipality called the North Peninsula of Antique which is Pandan. The place is rich in natural resources. Pandan is surrounded by verdant mountains and blue ocean that sparkles during the daytime.

Adela has been practicing her knowledge of dealing with different people by operating a sari-sari (variety) store for the past three years. This has been her business and her source of income. The profit she has made has helped her husband a lot to augment the family income. Her previous loan from ASHI supported her business and her husband's farming ventures. Since she was able to repay her previous loan, she is now qualified to apply for another loan of a higher amount to support her business. Now, she plans to utilize this loan and her future loans in the same business until it grows. She wishes that someday she could set up a mini-grocery store in their village where she can provide her customers with convenient purchases.

Adela's aspiration is that all her children will graduate from college with degrees and have a good life. This is the reason why she wants her business to succeed. Through business success, Adela hopes to build her own dream house. Her loan from Kiva through ASHI is a very important factor that could lead her towards fulfillment of her dreams.

loans.use: To provide additional working capital

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Hun H., 34, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. H. and her husband sell groceries, earning an income of USD 8 per day.  H. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a plot of land in a business area in the village to start up a grocery business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a plot of land in the business area of the village

loans.name: Jhona

texts.en: Jhona S. is from the village of Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old. Jhona is single. To make a living, Jhona owns and operates a transportation service. Jhona has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Jhona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jhona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jhona is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the second loan taken out by Jhona from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Josefa Ivania

texts.es: La Sra. Josefa Ivania E. S.  ella es Trabajadora activa del Colegio  público CERMA desempeñándose como Maestra de educación primaria tiene  treinta años de trabajar para el ministerio de educación es casada actualmente tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  seis créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Mrs Josefa Ivania E. S. works as an elementary school teacher at CERMA school.  She has been working for the Ministry of Education for 30 years.  She is married and has a school-age son.  She has had six loans from CEPRODEL and each one has been used for purchasing construction materials and improving her house.  She has greatly benefited from the CEPRODEL loans because they have enabled her to improve the living conditions of herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase of building materials: sand, cement, quarry stone, surveyor's compass, etc.

loans.name: Margine Del Socorro

texts.es:
Margine es madre de dos hijos, casada, y de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa de dama, caballeros, ropa interior, cosméticos y zapatos.
Iniciando este negocio hace varios años, con ayuda económica de su esposo producto de su trabajo como transportista. 
Con ayuda de Afodenic atreves de los financiamiento logro comprar una vitrina para tener más visión para su negocio. Lo que está motivada para lograr crecer en inventario. Con este nuevo préstamo podrá comprar más mercadería en ropa, zapatos, tintes, pinturas, adornos con la venida de navidad.
Como planes es poder formar una tienda con más vitrinas y productos para mejorar las ventas.
texts.en:
Margine is the mother of 2 children, and is a merchant.  She sells men and women's clothing, underwear, cosmetics and shoes.  She started this business a number of years ago with financial assistance provided by her husband from his work as a trucker.

With the help of loans from AFODENIC she was able to buy a glass display case to provide more exposure for her business.  She is now motivated to increase her inventory.  With this new loan she will be able to buy more merchandise in the form of clothing, shoes, hair dyes, makeup, and decorations with the approach of Christmas.  She plans to set up a shop with more glass display cases and products so she can improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing, makeup, hair dyes, underwear, and shoes to increase her sales

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El sr. Juan  vive en la urbanización Amboro de la zona del plan 3000, vive en la casa de sus padres en donde tiene su punto internet el señor juan es soltero el préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar una computadora especial para juegos ya que tiene mucha demanda en su internet de estos juegos el ya tiene un saldo lo que le sobre es para comprar otra computadora para poder prestar un mejor servicio. El sr. Juan es una persona joven que esta reuniendo un capital para poder continuar con sus estudios universitarios, tiene muchas ganas de superación y cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres.
texts.en:
Juan lives in the Amboro area, Plan 3000 zone.He lives at home with his parents, where he runs an internet café.

Juan is single. He wants the loan to buy a special computer for games since there is a lot of demand for these games at his internet café. The additional computer will enable him to provide a better service. Juan is saving up to go to university. 

He is very keen to improve his situation and has his parents' support.

loans.use: Buy a computer

loans.name: Milagro

texts.es:
Milagro es una joven de 22 años de edad, reside en Gualococti departamento de Morazán, administra una tienda y vive con sus padres, es madre soltera de un bebe de 1 año y medio, este negocio lo atiende desde hace un año de 6.00am á 7:30pm. Ofreciendo a los clientes lo necesario para el hogar como frijoles, azúcar, jabón, detergentes entre otros productos, inicio este negocio por la necesidad de ayudar a sus padres para los gastos del hogar ya que también tiene a su hijo y sus padres le ayudan mucho.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en la tienda, ya que quiere surtir de productos que rápidamente vende con sus clientes, su compra será de frijoles, arroz, azúcar, con esta inversión ella quiere siempre estar preparada para atender la demanda y tener la oportunidad de crecer con el negocio.
La aspiración de ella con respecto al préstamo es cancelarlo bien sin atrasos, con respecto al negocio es aprovechar la inversión para crecer poco a poco para obtener de él los ingresos necesarios para dar a su hijo un buen crecimiento.
texts.en:
Milagro, age 22, is a young woman who resides in Gualococti in the Department of Morazán. She manages a store and lives with her parents. Milagro is a single mother of a 1½ year old baby. Her business has been in operation for a year and is open from 6am to 7:30pm. She offers her customers household necessities such as beans, sugar, soap, detergents, and other products. Milagro started this business so that she could help her parents with the household expenses as well as support her child. Her parents also provide much assistance.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her store. Milagro wants to restock with products that sell quickly among her customers. Her purchase will include beans, rice, and sugar. With this investment, she will always be prepared to meet demand and have the opportunity to grow her business.

Her goal with this loan is to repay it without any delays. With respect to her business, she wants to take advantage of this investment to expand little by little so that she can earn the necessary income to provide her son what he needs to grow.

loans.use: Purchase beans, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 34 years old and she is a widow. She looks after an orphan who is now 15 years old. She is well-known as a young entrepreneur selling mostly women's clothing. She runs a clean and well-organized store and has been in this business for eight years.

Fatuma has requested a loan to purchase more men's and children's clothing to sell. Fatuma will save a portion of any profits for her future, as she now has a fiance; the other portion will be used for further reinvestment in her business.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to sell.

loans.name: Alcesido Norberto

texts.es:
Alcesido Norberto M. R. tiene 48 años de edad, Es casado, vive con la esposa  y con los hijos  en  el  Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito, perteneciente a la parroquia puerto pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul , esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Alcesido Norberto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial García y Comercial López y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta asistir a una iglesia evangélica.
texts.en:
Alcesido Norberto M. R. is 48 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He has 3 children.

The members of the JERUSALEN community bank are located in Caimito district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.  They have been in this line of work for many years.

Alcesido Norberto is a farmer who grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  He buys his products in the García and López shopping areas and sells his products in the Vaca shopping area.  He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his corn, rice and pigeon pea crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy a plot of land.

Alcesido Norberto likes attending his evangelical church.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Eliberta

texts.es:
la señora Maria Eliberta I. tiene 52 años de edad y no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, vive en la colonia Buena Vista desde hace 45 años, tiene casa propia y se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en su pulperia, ahi vende todo lo que se necesita para el consumo diario.
el credito lo utilizara para compra de abarroteria y asi tener mas surtida su pulperia.
sus sueños es tener una pulperia grande en donde venda variedad de productos y brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
su pasa tiempo es hacer pan casero y venderlo los fines de semana.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Eliberta I. is 52 years old, and she has no children economically depending on her. She has been living in the Buena Vista settlement for 45 years, she owns the house she lives in and she engage in selling groceries in her corner shop, where she sells everything that is needed for the daily consumption.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy groceries in order to improve the supplies of her corner shop.
She dreams of owning a big corner shop where to sell a variety of products in order to offer a better service to her customers.
Her pastime is to prepare homemade bread and sell it during the week-ends.

loans.use: To buy a variety of groceries to sell in her corner shop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 32 years old and single. She graduated from primary school. The borrower will use this loan to purchase a sewing-machine, cloth and ribbons. The borrower has a good character and she is a skilled lady and can attract lots of clients. The clients go to her to have her make skirts, shirts and women's outfits. The borrower makes garments and then sells them to the customers. She has an ambition to develop and further her work in order to raise her income.

loans.use: For purchasing sewing-machine & cloth

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
Salome, tiene 20 años de edad, tiene un hijo y vive  en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú. Salome se dedica a tender a su hijo pero ahora ella quiere hacer un pequeño negocio que consistirá en vender ropa de forma ambulatoria, ella es socia nueva en el banco comunal pues su vecina Antonieta la invito a participar. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo chompas, polos, pantalones y muchas cosas más.
   
Salome pertenece al banco comunal “Yahuar Maqui” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Salome is 20 years old, has one child, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Salome looks after her child but she would like to have a small business selling clothes door to door.  She is a new member of her community bank and it was her neighbor Antonieta who invited her to become a member.  Salome needs this loan to buy merchandise such as sweaters, tops, pants and many other products.
   
Salome is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “Yahuar Maqui” community bank.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is being offered through this loan and, as such, pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as sweaters, tops, pants and many other products

loans.name: Lucelly

texts.es:
Desde hace 6 años Lucelly tiene una tienda que ha sido la fuente de su sustento, ella vive sola desde hace 22 años y su única forma de mantenerse es su negocio, ella siempre ha querido tener una tienda llena de muchos productos para poder brindarle a sus cliente mayor variedad.

Su gran sueño es poder construir su casa y esto solo lo podrá lograr al incrementar las ventas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucelly has managed a store for six years as her source of income. She has lived alone for 22 years and this is the only way to support herself. Lucelly always wants to keep her store stocked with many products so that she can provide her customers a wide variety.

Her greatest dream is to build a house, so the only way to achieve this is to increase sales in her business.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Agustina Monserrate

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.

La señora Agustina es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque le han ayudado mucho los créditos tanto  a ella como a sus amigas del banco. Tiene  57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para el negocio de su esposo, él vende productos del mar, su marido se desplaza todos los días hasta el mercado de Portoviejo para comprar variedad de mariscos para sus clientes,  se abastece de camarón, calamar, pescado, conchas, cangrejo, etc.  Y  luego en su triciclo sale a recorrer con  sus productos.

Este crédito es para comprar calamares, camarón, pescado, cangrejos, entre otras especies de mariscos.  Está en el Banco Comunal hace 6 años y le gusta por el apoyo y ayuda que ha recibido.  Su sueño es arreglar su casa ya que está viejita.
texts.en:
The members of the “Mejorando El Futuro” (Improving the Future) communal bank meet every other week in an area called Tierras Amarillas in the Rocafuerte canton.  This sector is known for its agriculture because most of its inhabitants grow short cycle crops.

Agustina is a founding member of the communal bank.  She likes it because the loans have helped her and her friends in the bank a lot.  She is 57 years old, married, and has three children.  The children are grown and independent.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a great housewife who wants the loan for her husband’s business.  He sells products from the sea.  Every day he goes to the market in Portoviejo to buy a variety of seafood for his customers.  He stocks up on shrimp, squid, fish, scallops, and crab, etc.  He then leaves in his tricycle to travel around with his products.

This loan is to buy squid, shrimp, fish, and crabs, among other types of seafood.  She has been in the communal bank for six years.  She likes it because of the help and support she has received.

Her dream is to fix up her house because it is a bit old.

loans.use: to buy fish, squid, shrimp, and crabs, etc.

loans.name: Chhon's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Chhon is a married man who was born in 1975.  He was selected to be the bank president of this village group loan by the other members.  The  member of this village loan will use their money to support their different purposes.

Mr. Chhon's wife, Mrs. Meas, is a grocery seller in the local village who is able to earn a small income to support her family. Since this business is going well, Mr. Chhon would like to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to expand his wife's business activities. This couple has two children: one is a student and the youngest one is a year old. 

Mr. Chhon is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land which he uses to grow rice for a living.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for his wife's grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 53-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and four school-aged children. He is a talented construction worker specialized in floor covering for almost 20 years.   His story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to help their families satisfy their needs. 

Because of his older age, his wife who works as a nurse in a local hospital helps him pay the heavy life expenses.  He feels positive about his business potential for the coming years because along his professional path, he has been able to build a good business reputation. Today, he is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new tools needed for his work. He has newly made deals with multiple construction projects and wants to offer the best quality services to the customers in order to gain superior profits.

loans.use: to purchase new tools.

loans.name: Claudina

texts.es: La señora Claudina  era cliente del grupo solidario "leo" quien trabajo 18 secuencias  demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad  con sus pagos, ella se dedica a  la   venta de comida se levanta muy temprano para preparar los alimentos y poderlos vender a los  choferes del sindicato para ella es un trabajo sacrificado debido a que debe levantar ollas con bastante peso para poder salir a su negocio que se encuentra ubicado  en la zona el tejar  con los ingresos que percibe mantiene y paga los estudios de sus   cuatro hijos  debido a que hace poco tiempo falleció su esposo y quedó viuda y también falleció su hija mayor quien le ayudaba con los quehaceres del trabajo, fue un golpe para ella ya que perdió a dos miembros de su familia, pero ahora esta saliendo adelante. Ahora el crédito lo  destinará  para comprar de abarrotes para su segunda actividad ya que también tiene una tienda de barrio en el mismo lugar que vende comida  y así mejorar sus ingresos, es una persona muy fuerte y luchadora, agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Claudina used to be a member of the "Leo" communal bank and made her payments punctually and responsibly through 18 loan cycles. She sells food, rising very early to prepare the products and be able to sell them to the drivers' union. This is very difficult work for her, because she has to carry extremely heavy pots to get them to her business, which is located in the El Tejar neighborhood. 

With the income she earns she cares for her four children and pays for their education. Not too long ago her husband died and she has not remarried. Her oldest daughter, who helped with her work, also died. It was a great blow for her to lose two members of her family, but now she is getting by. 

She will use this loan to buy groceries for her second business, which is a neighborhood store in the same location where she sells food, and in this way she will increase her income. She is a very strong person and a real fighter, and she is grateful for the support offered by Emprender.

loans.use: to purchase barrels of oil and groceries for her second business

loans.name: Wakilare Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Wakilaré  est crée en Décembre 2007. Il  est composé de 10 femmes qui  habitent le même quartier. Elles ont une bonne entente. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame D. B. (debout à l’extrême droit sur la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de sept enfants. 

Elle fait le petit commerce de légumes dans le marché de son quartier. Elle a plus de 5 ans d’expérience dans ce domaine d’activité.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de financer son petit commerce de légumes.

Les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettront d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la scolarité et de la nourriture des enfants.
texts.en:
The Wakilare group was created in December 2007. It is composed of ten women who live in the same neighborhood. They all get along well. Their main activity is retail.

Mrs. D. B. (who stands all the way to the right on the picture) is the group's leader. She is 47 years old. She is married and the mother of seven children. She sells vegetables at her neighborhood's market. She has over five years of experience in this professional domain.

Her new loan will allow her to finance her small business selling vegetables. Benefits generated by her activity will make it possible for her to help her husband provide for the children's education and food.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables intended for sale

loans.name: Khoja

texts.ru: Хоча проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 48 лет. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Его старший сын находится на заработках в России. Сам он занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин, где он продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для покупки продуктов питания и напитков.
texts.en: Khoja lives in the Yavan region. 48 years of age. Married, with five children. His wife is a homemaker. His eldest son is a migrant worker in Russia. Khoja is in retail business. He has a store in which he sells groceries. He is taking out a loan to buy groceries and beverages.

loans.use: to  stock up on groceries and beverages

loans.name: Josefa Del Socorro

texts.es: Josefa de 43 años de edad es casada, labora para la Escuela Enrique Tierno Galvan como directora docente desde hace 25 años. Esta solicitando su 8vo credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto para mejor comodidad de su familia. Doña Josefa expresa que todos sus creditos los ha utilizado para mejorar poco a poco su casita, y  con el credito anterior puso la ceramica a la sala. Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Josefa is 43 years old and married.  She has worked as the principal of the Enrique Tierno Galvan School for 25 years.
