She is requesting her eighth loan in order to improve her house. The loan is to build a room in order to make her family more comfortable.  Josefa says that she has used all of the loans to improve her house, little by little.  With the previous loan she put down a ceramic floor in the living room.

Her biggest dream is to be able to give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
Zam lives in Kawempe in Uganda. She is married with five children – all of them are school-going. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She lives in a home that she owns. The family doesn’t have access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. 

Zam changed her business enterprise from selling spare parts to selling charcoal and has been in this business for a few months. She sells charcoal at the market and works seven days a week. She sells charcoal to all kinds of people, both retail and wholesale. Besides selling charcoal, she generates additional income through hiring out her motorcycle. Her business challenges include issues with transportation, the rainy season and defaulters. 

Zam requested 2,000,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Zam hopes to see her business grow big so that she can buy a delivery van to ease transport, and so she can get a permanent business premises. Zam decided to join MCDT because of the low interest charged.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Laura Emilia

texts.es:
Laura Emilia tiene 29 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, por la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembren maíz y arroz.

Laura Emilia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Sin Rival y Comercial S. y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes .   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafios como plagas en los cultivos.Su sueño es  realizar un viaje a otro pais con toda la familia.

En los tiempos libre le gusta reunirse con las amigas ha conversar.
texts.en:
Laura Emilia is 29 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and four children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The San Jacinto community bank is located in Campo Alegre, in Guare parish, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture.  They grow corn and rice.

Laura Emilia is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys her products in Comercial Sin Rival and Comercial S. and makes her sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Laura Emilia is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy supplies and fertilizers.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs. She faces challenges such as pests attacking her crops.  Her dream is to travel to another country with her whole family.

In her spare time, Laura Emilia enjoys meeting up with her friends to have a chat.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina de 41 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

Luz Marina desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), cuenta con 35 ovejas en su corral que se encuentra a unos minutos de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y  pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo, para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su hogar. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 700 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados y forraje para engordar a sus animales y venderlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes, con esos ingresos podrá pagar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia.  Luz Marina es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo que lo único que quiere es poder sacar adelante junto con su esposo a sus hijos en un futuro cercano.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and children in their own house, which lacks basic utility connections. The house is located in the rural zone of the district of Tambogrande, which belongs to the department of Piura.  This zone is characterized by agricultural activity, ranching and handicraft production.

For several years, Luz Marina has worked raising and selling ovine livestock (sheep). She has 35 sheep in her corral, which is located a few minutes from her house. The enclosures are appropriate and generous, and she feeds her animals balanced feed and natural grasses, so that they achieve optimal growth. She offers them for sale at the various markets of the zone, and she obtains very good profits which help her cover her daily household expenses. 

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 700 Peruvian new soles to buy balanced feed and forage to fatten up her animals, in order to sell them at a better price to her customers. With this income, she will be able to pay off her loan and improve the quality of life for her family. Luz Marina is a person who is very dedicated to her work; the only thing she and her husband want is to help their children get ahead in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional balanced feed and forage for her animals.

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y una hija de 2 años de edad, él se a la venta de medicinas y ropa, comenzó con el negocio gracias al apoyo de unos amigos, trabaja con lo propio y posee mucha experiencia.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de ropa, como blusas, faldas, ropa interior, esta mercadería le servirá para servir mejor a los clientes, ofreciendo mercadería nueva que pueda ser de su agrado.
El quiere desarrollar su negocio, que cuente con la preferencia de muchos clientes y que su familia le ayude para superarse con el apoyo mutuo.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his wife and their 2 year old daughter. He sells medicines and clothing. He started his business thanks to the help of some friends. He works for himself and has a lot of experience. 

Currently he needs a loan to buy clothing like blouses, skirts and underwear. This merchandise will allow him to serve his clients better, offering new products that might be to their liking.

He wants to develop his business, which is preferred by many customers, and wants his family to support each other to improve themselves.

loans.use: to buy clothing like blouses, skirts and underwear.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 27 years old and has two children. She is married and her two children are in school.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evangeline has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 27 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Gulu region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children. One of his children is currently in school. Charles has a business of a small retail shop that sells produce like maize flour, which he has had for 2 years.         

To help expand his business, Charles has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase maize flour, rice for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Charles hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. In the future, Charles hopes to expand his business. Charles is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice for resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 36 year old married man, and blessed with one child.  He operates a retail shop in the Majengo area of Malindi town and his business has been in existence for the past year.  Peter earns a monthly income of about KES 20,000. 
 
Peter has been loaned KES 30,000 by KADET LTD and this serves as his first loan.  He intends to use his loan to buy products such as maize, flour, soft drinks, cooking oil, toothpastes, and sweets for sale.

Peter wishes to use the anticipated profit from the business to continue looking after his family as well as to continue restocking and gradually expanding.  In the future he would like to own a super market.

loans.use: to buy maize, flour, soft drinks, cooking oil, toothpastes, and sweets.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 50 years old. He is a business man and is married to Mulwa, who is a farmer. They are blessed with six children. He has been operating a hotel for the past year with the monthly income of 18,000 Kenyan shillings, which he uses to support his family members.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Alexander will use the loan to buy foodstuff and a TV set for his hotel.

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will expand it. His hope is to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy foodstuff and a TV set for his hotel.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 56 years old and widowed with four children. She earns a living by farming sugar cane in the Philippines. 
Elizabeth is borrowing 16,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to pay for the laborers' salaries for her sugar cane field. Elizabeth has been farming sugar cane for 23 years and also earns additional income from tailoring.
She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for the laborers' salaries on her sugar cane field.

loans.name: Judith Maria

texts.en:
Judith Maria is 49 years old and lives in Calunasan, Larena, Siquijor.  She is a single-mother of three children.

To earn a living, Judith Maria has a business making and selling bread.  She earns about PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work.  Judith Maria has a requested a loan amounting to PHP 6,000 to purchase assorted ingredients for her bread making business. 

Judith Maria has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for four months.  In the future, she would like to help her three children finish their studying despite being a single-mother.

loans.use: buy baking ingredients

loans.name: Nícolas Florentino

texts.es:
El Señor Florentino, tiene 50 años de edad y vive en una aldea rural del municipio de San Marcos, Santa Barbara. Esta casado, tiene 8 hijos, de los cuales 2 están estudiando.
Su actividad económica es la agricultura, dedicado específicamente a la producción de granos básicos y mantenimiento de una pequeña finca de café.
El se inicio sus labores en la agricultura desde muy joven. Dispone de un terreno que le fue heredado de sus padres. El cual ha logrado hacer producir con mucho trabajo, empeño y dedicación. En la actualidad produce maíz y frijoles que le sirven para consumo y venta.
Su experiencia crediticia la obtuvo manejando créditos de la modalidad grupal con lo cual las ganancias obtenidas las invirtió para ampliar las áreas de producción. En la actualidad esta trabajando con un crédito de manera individual.
Se siente motivado a seguir con su negocio productivo ya que considera que le generan buenas ganancias si maneja bien el crédito.
A futuro planea utilizar sus ganancias para poder comprar más tierra y heredarla a sus hijos y producir más.
texts.en:
Florentino, age 50, lives in a rural village in the San Marco municipality in Santa Barbara.  He is married and has eight children; two of them are in school.

His business is farming.  Specifically, he devotes himself to the production of basic grains and maintaining a small coffee farm.  He started doing farm work when he was very young.  He has land that he inherited from his parents.  He has managed to make the land productive through a lot of work, determination, and dedication.  He currently produces corn and beans, which are used for personal consumption and to sell.  

He got his loan experience handling group loans, which he used to expand the production areas.  He is currently working with an individual loan.

He is motivated to continue with his productive business.  The business generates good income if he manages his loan well.

In the future he plans to use his income to buy more land to bequeath to his children and to produce more.

loans.use: to plant beans and corn and for maintenance on his coffee farm.

loans.name: Sope Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est créé le 07 juin 2004. Il compte une quinzaine de membres qui ont pour activité principale le commerce. 

Mme Sadio est responsable du groupe. sur la photo, elle est debout à gauche avec la main levée et une écharpe blanche autour du cou.

Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle confectionne du savon et le vend au marché hebdomadaire de la localité.

Ce prêt lui permettra d'acheter de la matière première pour augmenter sa production de savon.

Avec les bénéfices générés, elle va aider son mari pour la scolarité et la santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The group was created June 7, 2004. It includes around fifteen members who work principally in sales. Sadio is the director of the group. In the photo, she is standing at the right with her hand raised and a white scarf around her neck.
She is married and the mother of two children. She makes soap and sells it at the weekly market in her area.
This loan will allow her to buy raw materials in order to increase her production of soap.
With the profits generated, she will help her husband with the schooling and health of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make soap.

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
Carlito is 46 years old and married with two children. His primary source of income is rice farming. Together with his wife, he plants and harvests rice from his two-hectare field. Last season, he did not have a good harvest due to an unexpected typhoon that affected their area. He felt sad about what happened to his crops, but he was determined to provide for the needs of his family.

Now he hopes to improve his crop to produce an abundant harvest. Carlito is asking for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy seedlings and fertilizers and to pay for the labor costs of planting. He wants to ensure good growth of his seedlings.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

For 10 years, Cherry has had a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more of these products for her store.

Cherry has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Ana Yancy

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su hijo en casa familiar, ella junto con su esposo se dedican a la reparación de bicicletas, el oficio lo empezó hace dos años debido a la situación económica, el cual no hay trabajo, todos los días trabajan prestando sus servicios en el taller.
El préstamo lo necesitan para la compra de materiales llantas, pedales, hacientos, rines, de esa forma podrá tener lo necesario para darles una buena atención a sus clientes.
El objetivo de Ana que su negocio aumente y tener más ingresos económicos a si podrá darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her son in their family home.  She and her husband repair bicycles, a business they started two years ago because of their financial situation.  There were no jobs, so now they provide services in their workshop every day.

They need this loan to buy supplies, such as tires, pedals, seats, and rims.  In this way they will be able to have what they need to give good service to their customers.

Ana’s objective is to grow her business and have a greater income.  In this way she will be able to provide the best for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 51 years of age. She is luckily married to a farmer. As fruit of their love, they are blessed with four children. Dorothy manages their farming business, which is the planting and harvesting of rice. Aside from the farming business, she is also managing a sari-sari (variety) store business for an additional source of income of the family. Dorothy and her husband are helping each other to carry their family out of poverty.

With regards to her rice farming business, Dorothy is asking for a loan of 25,000 Philippines pesos to pay for the land preparation of her farm and buy seeds of rice. She looks forward to the success of her business to smoothly carry their family out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation of her farm and buy seeds of rice.

loans.name: Josue

texts.es:
Josué es un señor de 21 años de edad el cual vive con su familia, en una comunidad llamada Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal esto en la provincia de Puntarenas. Está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus playas. Sus principales actividades económicas son las turísticas y agropecuarias.

El tiene la motivación y la ayuda de sus familiares, lo cual le facilita seguir con su vida. Además  le es muy importante finalizar el pago de este medio de transporte, ya que la demanda es cada vez más fuerte y los vecinos de la comunidad se han sentido satisfechos con el servicio brindado.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita Josué es un micro crédito de ¢500,000(quinientos mil colones), para comprar cancelar la deuda de su automóvil, para movilizarse a su trabajo todos los días, y para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su proyecto.

Josué es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Josué is a 21 year old man who lives with his family in the community of Osa, located in Caña Blancal in the province of Puntarenas. This community is known as a rural area frequently visited for its beaches. Its main sources of income are tourism, farming, and cattle.

He has the motivation and help of his relatives which help him continue on in life. It is very important to him that he finish paying off his car. The demand for his taxi services is always increasing and his neighbors in the community have been pleased with the service he provides.

Josué is asking for a loan of 500,000 colones to cancel his car loan, to get to work every day, and for car maintenance. Josué is a member of the Community Credit Union of Caña Blancal, one of 150 organizations forming EDESA in Costa Rica. He hopes to grow personally and economically with this loan. He pointed out that, thanks to these types of loan providers, he can dedicate more of his time to productive activities.

loans.use: pay off his car

loans.name: 030711-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hồng has a retail business selling fish and shrimp. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish and shrimp to resell.

Hồng is 44 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 030711-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

In 2010, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Hồng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hồng hopes to buy land of her own, to travel for vacation within the country, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: To purchase fish and shrimp to resell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 43 years old. He is married with 5 children aged 1 and 17 years. They all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 8 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah comes from the Eldoret area of Kenya. She is married and has five children. She started farming from scratch 20 years ago. Today, she keeps dairy cattle, poultry, and sheep on her farm and transports the products to the local market, which is situated a bit far from her farm.

To make her transportation work easier, Rodah is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle. This asset will make transportation of goods very cheap, timely and convenient for her. In the long-run, the benefit of your loan investment will include allowing Rodah to participate in formal markets where structures are in place and the prices are much better.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Albena

texts.en: Albena G. is 38 years old. She is a jewelry designer and has a special education on this subject. Her father is also a jewelry designer and she has worked long years as an assistant in his atelier where she gains experience. In 1992 her father retires and she takes this family business. She not only sells her jewelry but also makers regular exhibitions in galleries. She is well known as a master of jewelry making and has lots of customers. Now Albena Gazazova prepares another exhibition and needs materials for her jewelry. She applies for a $ 2 000 loan.

loans.use: To buy materials for her jewelry

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos sells encebollados (seafood soup), arroz con menestra (rice and beans) and bollos (seafood tamales). Carlos began his business with only $100, and he only used to sell encebollados. Now he is offering more products like ceviche mixtos (mix seafood cocktails) and chuzos (shish kabobs). Carlos wants to have a diner and bbq restaurant because in his area there is non. He would use the Kiva loan to invest buying kitchen tools and chairs to expand his business. He has faith that with this new service he will have several happy clients. Carlos is 47 years old and he and his couple hope that this loan will bring him some economic stability and will be able to save for the future.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buy kitchen tools and chairs to expand his business.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng was married in 1979 and has one daughter. He used to run the ferry boat in Koh Dach. He is currently selling and purchasing sand & gravel for construction. His wife used to weave silk. She is currently a wholesaler of silk products, which are bought in the commune and sold in markets in Phnom Penh. Their daughter is married and she is making silk products in the village. This family has borrowed loans from MAXIMA for 2 cycles. The current loan amount is $500. Heng will use this loan to buy more sand, stone & gravel to sell in the commune. This family has the capacity to repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing more sand, stone & gravel

loans.name: Migdalia

texts.es:
Migdalia is married and has two small children. Her husband has a carpentry workshop but on occasion there would be no work and it was very difficult to cover the costs of the home. Before this necessity, Migdalia started her own business in the sale and application of facial treatments a year ago. The products that she sells are well received by her clientele and fortunately her sales are growing very rapidly.

Migdalia now needs a credit for $250 that will be destined for the purchase of merchandise to be able to cover the demands of her clientele. She commits herself to repay this amount in only three months. Be an important part in the development of this business. Migdalia and her family need and are very grateful for the support that you can offer them.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Migdalia es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos, su esposo tiene un taller de carpintería pero en ocasiones no tenía trabajo y era muy difícil cubrir todos los gastos del hogar, ante esta necesidad Migdalia inició su propio negocio con la venta y aplicación de tratamientos faciales hace un año, los productos que comercializa tienen mucha aceptación entre sus clientes y afortunadamente sus ventas crecieron muy rápido.

Migdalia necesita ahora de un crédito por $ 250 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en sólo 3 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, MIgdalia y su familia necesitan y agradecen mucho el apoyo que puedas brindarles.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for facials - Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Gloria Francisca

texts.es:
My name is Gloria T. and I'm dedicated to sell lingerie and underwear for women, men, and children. I started my business a year ago. My sales have been very good because I offer a good quality product. The best of all is that people can afford to buy it because the price can be adjusted to the needs of my customers.

My goal is to have a bigger assortment of products so I can increase my sales. With the earnings of the sales I will be able to feed my family and pay my daughter's school tuition. She is very close to graduate.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Mi nombre es Gloria T. me dedico a la venta de ropa interior par dama, caballero y niños, tengo mi negocio hace un año, mis ventas son muy buenas ya que mi producto es de buena calidad y lo mejor de todo es que la gente lo puede comprar porque el precio se ajusta a las necesidades de mis clientes, mmi meta es tener mas variedad de producto para tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias poder alimentar mi familia y pagarle los estudios a mi hija que esta por salir del colegio.

loans.use: Buying lingerie and underwear for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Hotim

texts.en:
Hotim is 30 years old and married with one child, aged 7. She runs a small shop which sells snacks, food and drinks, along with household products, earning about $5.50 per day. Her husband, Suki, is a framer who earns about $10 per week.

Hotim is requesting a loan to complete her business. The rest of the loan will be used for her husband business. Hotim hopes to improve her income so that she can provide for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To complete her business

loans.name: Mboni

texts.en:
“Kuku, kuku, kuku!” (chickens, chickens, chickens!) I exclaimed to my colleague. “Why is everyone selling kuku?! I’m sick of writing about kuku and Kiva lenders are probably sick of reading about them!” Not understanding that I just wanted to vent and that it was a rhetorical question, one of the earnest young men from IT gave me a serious analysis of the reasons why so many of our clients choose to raise and sell chickens. Firstly, they require little start-up capital, you can start with one or two and either add to them as you go or wait for them to multiple naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons why raising chickens is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but that was as deep as time would allow our analysis to go.

I imagine that some, if not all, of these factors encouraged Mboni M. to establish her kuku-raising business in 2005. She now requires a loan of $275 to purchase even more kuku and expand her business. Mboni is married to Henry and has one daughter, Erica, who is 4 years-old.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Titi

texts.en: Titi, 43, is the mother of 3 children and sells crispy snacks door-to-door earning about US$ 7 a day. She also sells snacks and beverages at her house and earns about US$ 3 a day. She has to work hard to provide for her family's needs. She is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of US$ 100 to add to her business capital. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Adding to her business capital

loans.name: Osas

texts.en: Osas I. is from Edo State, Nigeria. She is 33 years old, married, and has one child. She sells meat. She has been in business since 2002. She needs a loan of $425 to buy more meat to sell.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Irene Del Carmen

texts.es:
The business of a general store, or ‘pulpería’, is very common in the municipality of Somotillo in Chinandega, and thus there are many stores competing to attract clients. Nonetheless, Irene has been running this business for 4 years in the neighborhood.

She is solely responsible for supporting her child. Furthermore, she takes care of her old-age parents who need her help.

Ceprodel has been her source of unconditional support in providing loans, loans that she has invested in buying inventory. In this way upon selling the goods she improves her income so as to continue supporting both her child and her parents. She has worked with Ceprodel for one year.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de pulpería es muy común en el municipio de Somotillo en Chinandega por lo que existen varios de estos establecimientos que compiten por atraer a los clientes. Consiente de esto la señora Irene se dedica a este negocio desde hace 4 años en esta localidad.

Es madre de un hijo y con el deber de mantenerlo. Además tiene el deber de mantener a su sus ancianos padres que tanto necesitan de ella.

Ceprodel ha sido su apoyo incondicional brindándole créditos que los ha invertido en la compra de los productos y de esta manera al comercializarlos obtiene mejores ingresos para continuar manteniendo a su hijo y a sus padres. Su tiempo de trabajar con ceprodel es desde hace un año.

loans.use: Purchase of stock for a general store

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 39 years old, married, and has 5 children. She and her husband also care for an older individual, who is 63 years old. She began her business in 2003, and has been working from 5 AM to 11 PM daily to keep her business running. She earns about a total of $110 each month.

Amina would like to request a loan to increase her business’ inventory.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: During the visit to Christiana Iyiara's sales outlet, it was discovered that she a hardworking woman. She attends to her customers in a unique way, with good customer relationships that always make the customers to come back to her store. She sells kerosene to people living in her community; this is a business which she learned for a month. She has been a LAPO member for the past 4 years. She is 52 years old and married with 6 children; she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs a loan of $700 to buy more kerosene. She expresses her gratitude to KIVA and lenders.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene

loans.name: Tagisia

texts.en: Tagisia T., 28, is married with 1 children.  She has 5 year(s) of experience in the keke puaa business. She sells to the villagers/public 5 days per week. She has no previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Tagisia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will help her assist in buying tools for her business.

loans.use: stove,frying pan,20litre oil and case of mutton flaps.

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Pinolillo is a widely sold drink, typical of Nicaragua and known for its very good flavor. Rosa T. has for several years commercially sold powdered pinolillo, which is ready to be mixed with water and sugar. Her business is conducted through home sales and occasionally through travelling sales in the streets of Sandino City in Managua.

Rosa has sought the help of Ceprodel to obtain a loan for the purpose of buying more product to sell. Emphasis is placed on the fact that both Rosa and the two small children she cares for will benefit greatly from this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

El pinolillo es una bebida muy comercializada por ser la bebida típica de Nicaragua ya que se distingue por ser de muy buen sabor. La señora Rosa T. se dedica desde hace varios años a comercializar el pinolillo en polvo listo para combinarlo con agua, azúcar y prepara la bebida. Este negocio lo ha venido realizando por medio de ventas en su casa de habitación y en ocasiones ambulantemente en las calles de Ciudad Sandino en Managua.

Hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra del producto para comercializarlo. Es de necesidad destacar que con este crédito se beneficia tanto ella como sus dos pequeños hijos a los que tiene que mantener.

loans.use: Beverage sales (pinolillo)

loans.name: Alda

texts.es:
Alda is a 48 year old mother of 6 children, who she loves very much. She lives with three of her children who work and go to school. She has sold food and cold drinks for 13 years. Her friendliness and great care of her clients makes her a great businesswoman. Due to separation from her husband, she started her business, she did not do so out of suffering, but to overcome. She sells her food from 8 in the morning until 7 at night. Her work makes her feel useful. She enjoys her work because she learns to prepare a variety of platters, at the behest of her clients. She also works in order to support her daughter who is studying at university, as well as to cover the daily cost of living. Alda is requesting this loan in order to have a kiosk built and increase and develop her business, which will allow her to give better service to her clients. In the future she wants to have her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer.

Alda, de 48 años es madre soltera de 6 hijos que la quieren mucho, en la actualidad vive con tres de sus hijos que trabajan y estudian. Se dedica a la venta de comida y bebidas heladas desde hace 13 años, su amabilidad y la buena atención hacia sus clientes, hacen de ella, una mujer de negocio, a razón de la separación conyugal inició su negocio, considera entonces que ello no fue motivo de sufrimiento, sino de superación. Vende desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, su trabajo es una forma de sentirse útil. Le gusta su trabajo porque aprende a preparar variados platos, a exigencia de sus clientes. Trabaja también para apoyar a su hija que está estudiando en la universidad, como también para sus gastos diarios. El motivo de la solicitud de este préstamo es para mandar a construir un kiosco, ampliar e implementar el mismo y desde luego dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes. Posteriormente quiere tener su restaurante.

loans.use: Improve her food sales business with the construction of a kiosk.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 29 años, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Es una joven que trabaja muy duro por sus ideales, se dedica desde hace 5 años a vender combustible en el mercado Cerro Colorado de la ciudad de Juliaca, donde la venta es muy buena.Le gusta su negocio, ya que le permite sentirse independiente, sin preocupación de tener una pareja, solo para que la mantenga, por otro, lado el olor a combustible a veces suele marearla, pero con los años, se ha acostumbrado a esos pequeños y molestos detalles. 
Francisca quiere utilizar la suma solicitada para la comprar más galones de gasolina y así incrementar sus ventas, en el futuro quiere tener otro negocio, tal como una tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Francisca, 29, is single and lives with her parents. She's a young woman who works very hard for her dreams. For 5 years, she's operated a business selling fuels in the Cerro Colorado market in the city of Juliaca and her sales have been very good. She likes her business because it allows her to feel independent, without having to worry about having a partner, just making her own living. On the other hand, the smell of the fuels sometimes makes her sick but, over the years, she's grown used to these small and troublesome details.

Francisca wants to use the loan to buy more gallons of gasoline so that she can increase her sales. In the future, she wants to have another business, perhaps a store selling fuels.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gasoline for fuels business.

loans.name: Kaloline

texts.en:
Kaloline E. is 51 years old and is married with 6 children. She has 4 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells taro, taamu, and bananas to the village people and the public 3 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

Kaloline has 4 previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase equipment for her plantation business, including knives, pesticides, and chemicals. Kaloline's husband will help her in operating the business.

loans.use: Purchase taro tubers, knives, chemicals, and pesticides

loans.name: Bakyala Kwekulakulanya 2 Group

texts.en:
M. Teddy, 49, is the leader of her group and has various businesses such as having banana, beans and maize plantations, buying and selling coffee, and buying and selling small fish from her neighboring landing sites. Teddy is married with 8 children and she looks after 4 grandchildren. All her children are currently out of school, except one who is soon joining university, but she also pays school fees for her 4 grandchildren whose parents died of AIDS.

She is grateful for the loans because as a result of investing more into her businesses, she makes enough profits that help to cater for her family and pay her grandchildren’s school fees, while not forgetting to repay her loans promptly. She needs a loan to help her buy more fish for sale and partly for labor on her farm. In the photo at the front is their credit officer.

loans.use: Buy more fish for sale and hire labor on her farm.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
La señora Lorenza es socia del Banco Comunal “Chojchoni” del distrito de Copani, Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 46 años, es casada y madre de 7 hijos de los cuales 4 están a su cargo, no estudio porque solo la crió su abuela quien no tenia dinero para apoyarla. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 500. 00 nuevos soles decide invertir en la compra de habas, quinua,  maíz que en esa época vendía en Desaguadero. Su esposo viaja a Bolivia a realizar el negocio de venta de frazadas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles  que pagara en 4 cuotas comprara mas frazadas para vender en la Frontera.

Su deseo es obtener un préstamo más alto para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a partner of the Communal Bank, "Chojchoni," in the Copani District, Yunguyo-Puno Province. She is 46 years old, married, and mother of 7 children, 4 of which are still in her charge. Lorenza did not go to school because she was raised only by her grandmother who did not have the money to support her education. With her first loan of (around) $175 she decided to invest in the purchase of broad beans, Peruvian quinoa, corn, which she currently sells in Desaguadero, Peru. Her husband travels to Bolivia to manage his business in textile sales. With this loan of $250, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase more blankets to sell at the Border. Her desire is to obtain higher loan in the future to continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of textiles in Bulk

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris B. is married and has 4 dependents. She has received schooling through senior high school. Doris is a palm oil producer at Ntsiman near Elmina, which she has been doing since 2006. Her husband is a teacher. Doris uses her income to pay for the daily housekeeping expenses. Doris will use the loan to purchase more oil palm fruits to enable her to increase the production of the palm oil. With the new profits from her expanded business, Doris plans to improve upon the quality of education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more oil palm fruits to enable her to increase the production of  palm oil.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto tiene 23 años, vive en la casa de su madre con sus hermanos. Desde hace un año trabaja en su propia bodega, la cual él mismo atiende y administra todos los días durante casi todo el día, por la calidez de su atención ha logrado en corto tiempo tener la clientela necesaria para seguir adelante con su negocio. Él vende todo tipo de productos comestibles, lo necesario para cubrir las necesidades de su clientela, es por ello que logra implementar su sección de venta de carne, por lo que está muy animado en continuar con su negocio, para que de esa manera siga adelante con sus proyectos de mejorar y ampliar su tienda. Es la segunda vez que Roberto tiene un préstamo con MFP, y es uno de los socios de su banco comunal que ha demostrado ser eficaz para un trabajo en equipo y muy puntual en sus pagos. El dinero solicitado es para la compra de sacos de arroz, de leche evaporada en lata y demás productos, que le servirán para impulsar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Roberto is 23 years old and lives with his mother and siblings. One year ago he began working in his own store, which his runs and manages every day. Because of his good customer service he has gained, in a short time, the necessary customer base to keep his business running. He sells all types of food products necessary to cover his customer’s basic needs and he was able to add a meat section to his store. He is excited to continue improving his business and has goals of making his store bigger and better. This is his second loan with MFP. In his community bank he has proven to be an efficient team player and is always on time with his payments. This loan is to purchase sacks of rice, canned evaporated milk and other products which will help propel his business capital.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his merchandise

loans.name: Ahamad Sha

texts.en:
Ahamad sha lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with three children and lives with his family. Ahamad sha has a metal shop which he has owned for more than six years. He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months as he needs some machines. Ahamad sha wants to buy these new machines and increase his stock to attract more clients and make a good income.

He is very happy that he has the opportunity to make a good income and help improve his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase new machines for the metal shop

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Додов Дильшод проживает в районе Джалоллидини РУми. Возрат 36 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Имеет среднее образование. Работает на рынке , торгует продуктами питания. Опыт в сфере бизнеса составляет уже два года. Имеет небольшой товарооборот, который планирует увеличить , способом получения кредита. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Dilshod D. lives in Jalollidini Rumi. He is 36 years old and is married with four children. He has a high school diploma and sells groceries at the market. He has been in this business for two years. He would like to increase cash flow.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is married and has four dependents.  She has received schooling through senior high.  Mary has sold food supplies and groceries like milk, milo, canned products and rice at the King of Kings in Elmina, since 2008.  Her husband is a driver.  Mary uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic family expenses.  Mary will use the loan to increase the sale of food supplies to meet the increasing demand of her customers.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save towards acquiring a piece of land to build a house so they can stop paying rent and to get a comfortable shelter for their family.

loans.use: Increase the sale of food supplies and  groceries to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

loans.name: Komi Apélété

texts.fr: Monsieur A. est un enseignant, en 2007 i a laissé tomber l'enseignement et s’est lancé dans la vente de vêtements pour homme.  Il s’approvisionne en Europe, et il vend les vêtements dans sa boutique de prêt à porter à Protestant, un quartier de Lomé la capitale du Togo.son activité marche bien, son stock actuel ne lui permet pas de répondre à la demande actuel de sa clientèle.ayant besoin de se réapprovisionner pour satisfaire ses clients il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter plus de vêtements.  Monsieur A. est marié à une coiffeuse, et ils ont deux enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. A. is a teacher. In 2007, he left teaching and got started in selling men's clothing. He gets his supplies in Europe and sells the clothing in his read-to-wear shop in Protestant, a district of Lomé, the capital of Togo. His business is doing well. Right now his inventory prevents him from responding to the current demands of his customers. Needing to restock, so as to satisfy his customers, he's requesting his first loan from WAGES. Mr. A. is married to a hairdresser, and they have two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana  es socia del bancomunal Grandiosos Milagro.
T. es casada tiene 64 años, cuatro hijos que ya son mayores y están casados.
Juana empezó vendiendo en el mercado como ambulante, pero la competencia era mucha, vendía poco y tenia que llevar dinero a su casa tuvo la idea de viajar a provincia llevando su mercadería allí vio un nuevo mercado, ella ahora viaja a  Cerro de Pazco a la Orolla, vende en el  centro minero, una  vez al mes.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 3600 soles, para la compra de mercadería calzado, por docenas zapatillas sandalias, pantuflas por el día de la madre.
Desde que esta en Finca, su economía ha  mejorado, su negocio se ha levantado, puede comprar más mercadería, es más responsable con los préstamos que Finca le da.  
El sueño de  Juana es seguir luchando por su negocio, aunque sus hijos ya no quieren que trabajen, ella tiene muchas ganas de seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Grandioso Milagro community bank. She is married, is 64 years old, and has four children who are older and married. Juana began selling in the market as an itinerant but the competition was great, she sold little but still had to bring money home. She had the idea of traveling to the province and taking her goods and saw that there was a new market. She now travels to Cerro de Pazco a la Orolla where she sells in the mining center once a month. Juana needs a loan of 3600 soles to buy shoes, sandals and slippers for Mother's Day. Since she has been in FINCA, her income has improved, her business has increased and she can buy more merchandise. She is more responsible with the loans that FINCA provides her. Juana's dream is to continue fighting for her business. Although her children no longer want her to work, she wants to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes, sandals and slippers.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred A. D. sells unisex clothing, and music and movie CDs and DVDs at Cape Coast behind the Oguaa Hall. He has been doing so for one year. He is single and has received an education through the university level. He is responsible for paying utility bills and providing for his two young siblings. 

Alfred will use his loan to buy more and different fashionable clothing and music and movies. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest back into his enterprise.

loans.use: To buy clothing and CDs and DVDs to sell.

loans.name: Tièssiri Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du  groupe Tièssiri sont toutes mariées dans des familles monogames avec un âge moyen de 26 ans et  2 enfants. Elles habitent dans  le quartier Darsalam  de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Ce groupe excelle dans l’achat vente  des céréales, des parfums, de l’encens et de la friperie.
Pour augmenter le volume de leurs activités génératrices de revenus, elles ont  décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui elles  sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter,  3 sacs de riz, un sac d’arachide, 1 sac de haricot, 2 cartons de parfums, un colis de friperie, 50 kg de magnonkissèni et de n’guéni  à la foire hebdomadaire du grand marché de Ségou. Elles revendent toutes leurs marchandises en détail  au comptant et à crédit,  à domicile et en ambulant dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent  réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 28.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  aider les maris à la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.  
Elles ont pour ambition d’augmenter le volume de leurs activités à partir de leur collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women in the Tièssiri group are all married and live in monogamous families, with an average age of 26 and two children each. They live in the Darsalam district of Ségou (Mali’s fourth administrative region). The group excels at buying and selling cereals, perfume, incense and used clothing. To increase their volume of revenue-generating business they decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their first solidarity loan. This loan will be used to buy three bags of rice, one bag of peanuts, one bag of beans, two boxes of perfume, one bundle of used clothing and 50kg of magnonkissèni and n’guéni (seeds from exotic plants) at the weekly fair in Ségou’s main marketplace. Their clientele is made up of men and women, and they sell their merchandise at retail, either for cash or credit, in their own homes or by walking around the neighborhood. They expect to make an average monthly profit of CFA 28,000 which will be used to help their husbands take care of the family expenses. Their goal is to increase their volume of business through their collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous items

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em N., 53, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham province. All of the children are married and no longer live at home.

To earn a living she grows and sells vegetables in the market. On average, she is able to make about $10 in revenue per day. Her husband has been a moto-taxi driver for ten years and normally he makes $5 each day. Em N. would like to take out a loan of $800 to replace her husband’s old and unreliable motorbike as the old one uses a lot of gas and has had to be fixed many times.

loans.use: To replace her husband's old and unreliable motorbike

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana is forty-two years old.  She is married and has four children, one boy and three girls. All are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in their community. Christiana trades in soft drinks and pastries. She buys the drinks from big towns and sells them in a kiosk in her community. She has been in business for twelve years and wants a loan to buy soft drinks and pastries in bulk, in order to expand her business. Christiana desires to give all of her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks

loans.name: Floribel

texts.en:
Floribel is 25 years old and she manages a cell phone shop in the city of Santiago. She is married to Jerry B., her partner in managing the business. The couple is blessed with two children: Jaybie - 6 years old and Zyra Mae - 4 years old. They are presently living at Barangay Garit Norte in Echague, Isabela. Floribel has been operating her business for six years now. In fact, her cellphone shop is doing well and she now has two branches, in two towns.

However, she still wants to do her best to make her business more successful and to become the leading cell phone shop in the region. She believes that her faith in God and her patience will make her business keep growing. Now that a Kiva loan is possible, Floribel wants to apply for an initial loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos. This amount will be a big help in the progress of her cell phone center. She will buy more accessories to sell, including cell phone spare parts, to use in their cell phone repair business.

Floribel also says, if others can, why can’t I? She is hoping that she can improve her cell shop and that she will be able to achieve success in life. She hopes to be able to save money for the future education of her children and to give them a brighter future.

loans.use: accessories and spare parts

loans.name: Massama-Esso

texts.fr: Ce Monsieur s’est spécialisé depuis 2002 à Lomé dans le commerce du charbon de bois. Il est marié et père d’un enfant. Ce commerce qu’il exerce dans le marché d’Agoè Assiyéyé lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Parce que son stock fini, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 09 grands sacs de charbon, 11 sacs moyens et 12 petits sacs. Cet homme est expérimenté et a un nombre élevé de clients.
texts.en:
Since 2002, this gentleman has specialized in the sale of charcoal in Lomé. He is married and has one child. This business, which he runs at the market in Agoè Assiyéyé, allows him to provide for his family. Because his stock is depleted, he is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 9 large bags of charcoal, 11 medium-sized bags, and 12 small bags. This man is experienced and has a large number of customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat d'appareils électroménagers

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth, de 29 años es una joven muy alegre, vive en la casa de su madre a quien quiere mucho y juntas trabajan muy duro para salir adelante. En uno de los paraderos de transporte público más importantes de la ciudad de Juliaca, se encuentra el kiosco de golosinas de Ruth, su negocio es muy concurrido ya que los chóferes siempre aprovechan para comer algo entre cada viaje y también es el kiosco donde la mayoría de pasajeros compra algo para el camino. Lo que más le gusta a Ruth de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes y conversar con ellos, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su kiosco, sin poder salir a pasear por su ciudad. Para el futuro anhela tener una tienda grande de abarrotes donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad. 
Este es el sexto préstamo de Ruth con MFP y al igual como hizo en sus primeros crédito desea pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que sabe que si no lo hace así meterá en problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada por lo responsable que es. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su kiosco y así ofrecerles una mayor variedad de golosinas a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Twenty-nine-year-old Ruth is a very happy young woman. She lives with her mother, whom she loves very much. They both work very hard to get ahead in life. Ruth’s snack shop is located in one of the city of Juliaca’s most important public transportation stations. Her business is much frequented because the drivers always stop by to eat something in between every trip. Her stand is where the majority of passengers purchase something to eat for the road. What Ruth most likes about her job is attending to her customers and conversing with them. She has been in business for 5 years. What she thinks is the most difficult aspect of her job is having to stay in her kiosk all day long, without being able to take a walk around her city. In the future, she would like to have a big grocery store where she can sell her products with greater comfort.

This is Ruth’s sixth loan with MFP. Just like she did with her previous loans, she intends to make her payments on time because she knows that if she doesn’t, she will cause problems in her communal bank, where she is respected for being so responsible. With this 1,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase more snacks to restock her kiosk and in so doing offer her customers a greater selection.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Jojie

texts.en:
"Perseverance and creativity is needed in managing a small business," said Jojie. She is 26 years old and still single. She has a strong determination to succeed in life and is doing her best to achieve her dreams.

Jojie is weaving and selling hammocks as her source of income. She would like to buy additional materials needed in weaving hammocks but her capital is insufficient. For this reason, she is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders. She will use the loan to purchase the necessary weaving materials to improve her business. She prays and hope that her loan will be granted by the lenders for the development of her small business.

loans.use: To buy the necessary weaving materials for making hammocks

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena V. and her family live in Silang, Cavite, a breezy town in the southern part of Metro Manila. She is 42 years old. Her husband Arnulfo is a businessman. They have four children, two of whom are in school.

Lorena has been managing her own small bakery and general store for ten years now. She employs the services of a neighbor as assistant. She earns at least P6,000 a month. She uses her profits to support the education of her children, especially the one in college. She was also able to have their car fixed thru her earnings/savings.

She has just finished repaying her previous loan with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative so she applied for a new loan in the amount of P10,000 to purchase raw materials for bread production (flour, sugar, and lard). This is her 12th loan with the cooperative.

Lorena’s utmost dream is to see all her children obtain their college degree.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for bread making

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont des femmes mariées vivant dans des foyers monogames nucléaires à Sélingué (une sous-préfecture située à 140  kilomètres de Bamako) avec en moyenne d’âge trente trois ans et trois enfants.
Elles se sont connues par des liens d’amitié et d’activités professionnelles. Ce groupe de femmes excellent dans l’achat vente d’articles divers. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe après avoir remboursé sans difficulté le précédent. 
Elles s’approvisionnent  à Sélingué et à Bamako (capitale du Mali) une fois par mois et revendent à Sélingué sur des étales ou en ambulant dans les quartiers et  des les entreprises publiques  et privées.
Elles comptent avoir avec ce prêt,  35 pagnes, 10 cartons de savons de ménage et 40  kilogrammes de matières premières pour la fabrication d’encens. Elles vendent sur le marché de Sélingué et Dalabala à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 26.000 FCFA qui permettra de  payer l’échéance du prêt et contribuer aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The women of the Danaya group are married women living in nuclear monogamous homes in Sélingué (a sub-district located 140 kilometers from Bamako). On average, they are thirty three years of age and have three children. They know each other by bonds of friendship and professional activities. This group of women excells in the sale of various items. They are on their second group loan after repaying the preceding loan without difficulty. They supply themselves in Sélingué and Bamako (capital of Mali) once a month and sell to Sélingué from a place on the street, on foot in the neighborhoods and to public and private businesses. With this loan they plan to buy, 35 sheets of cloth, 10 boxes of household soap and 40 kilograms of materials for making incense. They sell in the markets of Sélingué and Dalabala to a various and varied clientele. They hope to realize a monthly profit of 26,000 FCFA that will allow them to repay the loan and contribute to the family expenditures.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, soap and materials for making incense.

loans.name: Cristo Del Consuelo (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cristo del Consuelo está formado por un grupo de mujeres luchadoras y decidas a entregar su vida para salir adelante con sus familias, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca es reconocida por la riqueza de su arquitectura, los 4 ríos que bañan a esta hermosa ciudad y también por su rica gastronomía.
La Sra. Olga M. es socia del banco comunal Cristo del Consuelo, vive en por la Urbe de la Ciudad de Cuenca en el sector de Cristo del Consuelo, tiene 27 años de edad, se encuentra casada y ha procreado 5 hijos de 10, 8, 7, 5 y 3 años de edad, sus hijos se encuentran estudiando en la escuela Víctor Manuel Albornos, su esposo se dedica al negocio de la venta de chuzos(carne asada servida en palillos), no tienen casa propia por lo que arriendan su vivienda.
Olga se dedica a la venta de chuzos lleva 12 años en su negocio, tiene un puesto propio en un sector de la ciudad, nos comenta que le va bien, se lleva con todas las socias de su banca comunal siendo la socia fundadora del banco, se encuentra en el segundo ciclo trabajando con los prestamos de la fundación y nos comenta que le han ayudado a superase en su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que  FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entrega, va a invertir en la compra de un carrito para crecer en su negocio, su mayor sueño es  llegar a tener su casa propia.
La Sra. María D. es socia del banco comunal Cristo del Consuelo, vive por la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, por el sector de Narancay Alto, tiene 30 años de edad, se encuentra casada fruto de su unión conyugal ha procreado 1 hijo que se encuentra de 4 meses de edad, su esposo trabaja como carpintero, ella está viviendo en casa de su suegro.
María se dedica a la venta de chuzos, lleva trabajando en este negocio hace 2 años y le va bien, su producto lo vende en su comunidad, se lleva bien con todas sus compañeras del banco comunal se encuentra en su primer ciclo y se animo a ser parte del banco comunal por que una compañera la incentivó contándole de todos los beneficios, con el préstamo que  FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le otorgará, va a invertir en la compra de carne y más productos para su negocio y un poco para la comida de su hogar, su meta es de llegar a ser costurera.
texts.en:
The Cristo del Consuelo (Christ the Comforter) communal bank is made up of strong women who are dedicated to give their lives to get ahead with their families. They live in the city of Cuenca which is renowned for the jewels of its architecture, the four rivers that bathe this beautiful city, and for its delicious gastronomy. Mrs. Olga M., 27, is a member of the bank. She lives in greater Cuenca in the Cristo del Consuelo sector. She is married and the mother of 5 children, who are 10, 8, 7, 5, and 3 years of age. Her children are students at the Víctor Manuel Albornos school. Her husband sells chuzos (dishes of grilled meat). They do not own their home; they rent. Olga has sold chuzos for the past 12 years from a food stand that she owns in a certain sector of the city. She relates that she does well, gets along well with the other members of the bank (she is the founding member), and she is in her second loan cycle working with loans from the foundation. She also tells us that the loans have been helpful for her to succeed at her work. She will use the new loan that FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR will grant to buy a little vending cart so that her business can expand. Her greatest wish it to someday have her own house. Mrs. María D., 30, is also a member of the bank and lives in greater Cuenca in the Narancay Alto sector. She is married and has a 4-month-old son. Her husband is a carpenter and she lives in her father-in-law’s house. María has sold chuzos for the past 2 years and she does well. She sells her product in her community, gets along well with the other members of the bank, and is in her first loan cycle. She was motivated to join by a girlfriend who told her about all the benefits of membership. The financing that FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR will grant her, will be invested for the most part in meats and more products for her business and a little for food for her home. Her goal is to become a seamstress.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meats.

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: T. Ayaba est née le 04 Juillet 1963 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Ayaba vit depuis environs 11 ans à Cococodji, non loin de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à KONATE Raïmi, un chauffeur, Ayaba est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. En plus de ses enfants, Ayaba a un autre enfant à charge. Ayaba vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Ayaba a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Depuis environs 5 ans, Ayaba vend des friperies à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est à Dantokpa et à Missèbo, un marché de friperies au Bénin, que Ayaba fait ses achats. Ayaba a obtenu une fois déjà de crédit à Alidé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. C'est pour augmenter son stock de produits et mieux satisfaire ses clients, que Ayaba sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Ayaba T. was born July 4th, 1963 in Ouidah, a historic town in Bénin. For about 11 years, Ayaba has lived in Cococodji, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Married to Raïmi Konate, a driver, Ayaba is the mother of two children who are both in school. In addition to her own children, Ayaba takes care of another child. She lives together with her husband and children. Together the couple financially supports the family. Ayaba dropped out of school in high school. For about 5 years, Ayaba has sold second-hand clothes in Bénin, where she also makes her purchases. Ayaba already received one loan from Alidé which she repaid in full. In order to increase her stock of products and better meet her clients' demands, she is asking for a second loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 4 Bales of Second-Hand Clothing

loans.name: Miyormiyeh Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the Miyormiyeh group. They are petty enterpreneurs in the small town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to expand their businesses.

Mabinty K. on the left in the photo is the leader of this group of four. Mabinty sells dried fish and has been in this business for five years now. With her share of the loan, she will buy two baskets full of dried fish. A dozen fish usually cost her SLL 2,500.

Mabinty K. was born in Magburaka, forty-eight years ago. She is married with four children. Her husband is a businessman and three of her children are attending primary and secondary schools.

loans.use: To buy two baskets full of dried fish

loans.name: Club Cell A Zaituni Ismail Group

texts.en:
Zaituni I. is is the president of her group. She is thirty-eight years old, is married, and is blessed with five children, all schooling.

Zaituni offers tailoring services and has been in this business for over six years. She is using the loan to purchase material for making different customers’ designs. She is buying the material (bitengi: pieces of cloth worn like sarongs) from the Congo (Zaire).

Zaituni is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to purchase another sewing machine to make more profits. She wants to purchase a plot of land, too, and construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase material for making different customers' designs

loans.name: Obras Group

texts.es:
Consuelo antes trabajaba en un colegio como recepcionista, eventualmente también se dedicaba a la costura haciendo algunos trabajos para el mismo colegio, D. esa forma se ayudaba con algo extra. Con el tiempo dejo el colegio para dedicarse D. lleno a la confección y no se arrepiente D. esa decisión por que le va muy  bien. Ella confecciona buzos, uniformes, casacas etc. Durante La época escolar  el trabajo aumenta y tiene que contratar personal para q la ayuD. a cumplir con sus clientes.
Con el producto D. su trabajo La Señora Consuelo ha logrado ayudar a sus hijos en  su educación, ahora también apoya a sus nietos y  lo que mas quisiera en el futuro es tener sus propia casa por q vive alquilando y poner allí su propio taller D. costura ella quiere especializarse en la confección D.  lencería(ropa intima D. mujer). su actual préstamo lo usara para comprar materiales y un viaje que tiene pendiente, EDAPROSPO es D. gran ayuda para ella y sus compañeras del grupo “OBRAS”  ya que todas han prosperado en sus pequeños negocios, aparte D. que existe mucho entusiasmo y apoyo entre ellas.

*La señora Consuelo esta D. pie es la cuarta D. la izquierda.el grupo aparece en la foto mostrando los almanaques D. EDAPROSPO.
texts.en:
Consuelo used to work as a receptionist at a school. She would also do some sewing jobs for the school for extra income. After some time she left her job at the school to devote herself to tailoring. She does not regret this decision because she is doing very well. Consuelo makes sweatshirts, uniforms, jackets, etc. During the school year, her work increases and she has to hire people in order to fill her clients' orders. As a result of her work, Consuelo was able to help her children with their education and she is now able to help her grandchildren. What she would most like in the future is to be able to own a home where she can have her own sewing workshop because she is currently renting her home. Consuelo would like to specialize in making lingerie. She would use this loan to purchase materials and to make a pending trip. EDAPROSPO is a big help to her and her fellow members of "OBRAS" as they have all prospered in their small businesses and there is a lot of enthusiasm and support between them. *Consuelo is pictured standing fourth from the left. The group is photographed showing EDAPROSPO's calendars.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials.

loans.name: Delia's Group

texts.en: Delia O.'s main source of income comes from raising ducks to produce and sell eggs. She is 37 years old, married and has four school-aged children. They are from the village of Olango, Mallig, Isabela. Delia has been in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Delia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Delia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. Delia is the leader of a 6 member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Creciendo Para El Futuro 4,5 Group

texts.en:
Veronica is the coordinator of her group Creciendo para el futuro ("Growing for the Future"). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsula where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their three children.
Veronica is excited to be taking her second loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her clothes and shoes business by purchasing blouses, skirts, blue jeans and tennis shoes in the main market in Santo Domingo, and then bringing them back to her community to sell at a profit. She will use her profits to invest in her children by purchasing school shoes as well as a computer to assist their learning. She intends to invest in her home by remodeling it, as well as purchasing a local space for her business so that she can move it out of her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy blouses, skirts, jeans and shoes to sell

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es: Lucas de 32 años de edad es casado, desde hace 9 años  trabaja como auxiliar de enfermeria en el centro de Salud de la colonia Talolinga  a 37 kilometros de Nueva Guinea, tiene dos niños, el mayor de 5 años y el menor 2 añitos, su esposa labora tambien como Auxiliar de Enfermeria en la colonia Jacinto Baca, ambos comparten los gastos familiares,  está solicitando su 3er crèdito para invertirlo en construcciòn de una habitaciòn ya que le ayudarà a tener mayor comodidad y  mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia,  actualmente està estudiando los fines de semana la carrera cirujano dentista en la UNAN Managua . El se siente agradecido con la Institución de AFODENIC ya que con los créditos anteriores ha mejorado la vivienda donde  el habita, su sueño es  tener salud y estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Lucas, age 32, has worked for nine years as a nurse’s aide in the Health Center of the Talolinga neighborhood, 37 kilometers from Nueva Guinea. He is married and has two children, 5 and 2 years old. His wife is also a nurse’s aide, working in the Jacinto Baca neighborhood. Lucas and his wife share the household expenses. Lucas is seeking his third loan with AFODENIC to invest in the construction of a bedroom in his house. This will provide more comfort and better living conditions for the family. Currently, Lucas is studying on weekends at UNAN in Managua for a career as a dental surgeon. He is grateful to AFODENIC, as the previous loans have greatly improved his house. His dream is to have good health and steady work.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a new bedroom

loans.name: Santos Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Santos tiene 39 años de edad,  es casado tiene una hija de 16 años de edad, su conyugue es ama de casa. Ellos cuentan con casa propia de material noble  de dos pisos recien construida,  ubicado en el Distrito de la Tinguiña, el es maestro de construccion y tambien cuenta con 3 motos taxis el cual recien a adquirido las dos ultimas. El se dedica como maestro de cosntruccion hace 10 años . El cuenta con su maquinaria propia como maderas y otros. El tiene muchos sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener mas vehiculos para tener mayor ingreso. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en el  mantenimiento de sus vehiculos.
texts.en:
Sr. Santos is 39 years old, married, and has a 16 year old daughter. His wife is a homemaker. Their house was recently constructed and is made of solid materials and has two stories. Santos and his family live in the District of La Tinguiña. He is a master builder and also has three motorcycle taxis, having recently acquired two of them.
