Santos has been a master builder for ten years. He has his own machinery for working with wood and other materials.

Santos has many dreams and goals, one of them being having more vehicles to generate additional income. The loan he requested will be used to invest in the maintenance of his vehicles.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Kem's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kem K. is 60 years old, and has a child who is a student. She has been selected by the other 4 members of her group, located in Svay Prey village in Kandal province, as its leader. The members will use their portions of the loan to purchase equipment, supplies and other items for different purposes. 

Mrs. Kem K. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Hean Hin, is a bike repairman who earns a small income to help support his family. Mrs. Kem K. decided to ask for a loan to purchase bike supplies to support her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase bike supplies

loans.name: Darling Celeste

texts.es:
La señora Darling Celeste S. G., es madre de dos niños, uno en edad escolar, tiene un tramo de venta de carne de cerdo, pepena, frito y morongas, desde hace 14 años, ubicado en el sector de cerdo.
Comenzó su negocio con un capital de C$ 3,000.00 ahorrados, siempre ha vendido en el mercado pero antes solo le ayudaba a vender a su mamá, lleva cinco años de trabajar con nosotros en el cual ella nos ha manifestado que ha través de los financiamientos a  podido  mejorar su condición de vida, ya que compra mercaderia para el negocio y de esto ella le hace mejora.
Con esfuerzo de ella y el de su esposo  ambos luchan por salir adelante con sus hijos.
texts.en:
La señora Darling Celeste S. G., es madre de dos niños, uno en edad escolar, tiene un tramo de venta de carne de cerdo, pepena, frito y morongas, desde hace 14 años, ubicado en el sector de cerdo. Comenzó su negocio con un capital de C$ 3,000.00 ahorrados, siempre ha vendido en el mercado pero antes solo le ayudaba a vender a su mamá, lleva cinco años de trabajar con nosotros en el cual ella nos ha manifestado que ha través de los financiamientos a podido mejorar su condición de vida, ya que compra mercaderia para el negocio y de esto ella le hace mejora. Con esfuerzo de ella y el de su esposo ambos luchan por salir adelante con sus hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Par compra de cerdos para destace para ni negocio

loans.name: Mnarani Group

texts.en:
Hadija is a 38-year-old married mother of five children between 13 and 20 years old.  Her youngest three children are at school.  Hadija sells fruits and vegetables at a tabletop stand in the Buja market near Dar Es Salaam.  She has been running this business for three years.  She leaves her home at 5am each morning to buy the produce, and after a day at the market, she returns home around 9pm in the evening. She earns a profit of about $50 a month.  This is Hadija's first loan from Tujijenge and she will use it to increase her stock and variety of fruits and vegetables so that she can continue to support her children.  

Hadija is the Treasurer of the Mnarari Group.  She can be seen raising her hand in the photo.  The group's 18 members run a variety of businesses including sales of clothes, medicine, food, and khangas (traditional East African cotton fabric).  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back this loan.

loans.use: To increase her stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Simone

texts.fr: A. Simone est née en 1973 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à GBEDEY William, Simone est mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Simone vit depuis une douzaine d'année au quartier Irédé à Cotonou, avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Simone n'a pas été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Simone prépare et vend de la nourriture (aliment local fait à base de maïs, accompagné de sauce) à Cotonou. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Simone fait ses provisions. Simone exerce cette activité depuis quatorze ans et a déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé. Simone  a bien effectué les remboursements desdits crédits. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Simone sollicite un troisième prêt, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de  sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Simone A. was born in 1973 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to William Gbedey, she has four children who are all in school. Simone has lived in the Irédé area of Cotonou with her husband and children for about twelve years. The couple take care of the various family expenses together. Simone did not go to school. To meet her various needs, Simone prepares and sells food (a local maize-based dish accompanied by sauce) in Cotonou. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Simone has run this business for fourteen years and has already obtained two loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners). Simone has repaid all of these credits properly. Faced with her customers' increasing demands, Simone is seeking a third loan, with the goal of strengthening her business and better responding to her customers' requests.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of maize, peanut oil, and sauce condiments

loans.name: Isabel's Group

texts.en: Isabel A. is from the village of Poblacion. She is 50 years old and is the group leader of this three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Isabel is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a business selling fresh ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Isabel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Isabel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used for house repair. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use for house repair

loans.name: Naomie

texts.en:
Naomie B. is from the village of Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she operates a motor transport service. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $225 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Naomie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en: Bonifacia C. is from Gingoog City. She is 38 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Bonifacia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Bonifacia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Bonifacia is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ignacio Alejandro

texts.es: El señor Ignacio trabaja de albañil en una constructora, y se pasa ahí la mayor parte del día, el piensa mucho en el futuro de sus hijos y quiere darles la mejor educación posible, ya que ese será el patrimonio para ellos mismos.  El necesita de este crédito para pagar las colegiaturas de la universidad de su hija, así como uniformes y útiles escolares.  El señor Ignacio y su esposa saben que es la mejor herencia que les pueden dejar a sus hijos, es una buena educación para que no batallen el día de mañana. El señor Ignacio no aparece en la fotografia ya que trabaja la mayor parte del dia.
texts.en:
Ignacio works as a bricklayer and he spends the major part of each day doing that work. He thinks a great deal about the future of his children and wishes to give them the best education possible, so that this will be their patrimony. Ignacio needs this loan to pay the registration fees at the university for his daughter, and to purchase uniforms and school supplies. Ignacio and his wife know that the best inheritance they can leave for their children is a good education, so they won't have to struggle daily in the future. Ignacio doesn't appear in the photograph because he works most of the day.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PAYING UNIVERSITY REGISTRATION FEES AND BUYING SCHOOL SUPPLIES FOR THE CHILDREN

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: La señora Reyna  se dedica a la venta de comida diaria  junto con sus Padres, también vende un plato especial los fines de semanas ella prepara el  conocido como chicharrón de cerdo este es un plato tipico d ela ciudad de Cochabamba y lo hacen en uno peroles grandes como se muestra en la foto, la cliente desea el crédito para poder comprase un pequeño refrigerador y así tener conservados sus verdura y su carne que compra para preparar sus comidas; ella es una mujer emprendedora que trabaja como padre y madre para sus hijas ya que su esposo se fue del país y a veces les envía algo de dinero y otros meses no les envía nada, ella se siente con un compromiso grande con sus hijas, ya que su sueño es sacarles adelante y que puedan estudiar. Y algún día verlas profesionales.
texts.en:
Reyna works selling daily meals alongside her parents. At the weekends, she also sells a special dish called "chicarrón de cerdo" which means "pork rinds" and is a speciality of the city of Cochabamba. She makes this in big pots, as shown in the photo. She wants the loan so that she can buy a small refrigerator that will preserve the vegetables and meat that she buys to prepare the meals. She is an enterprising woman who works as both father and mother for her daughters as her husband left the country and sometimes sends them money but some months does not send them anything. She feels a great responsibility for her daughters and her dream is to help them be successful and that they can study and one day be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia G. is from the village of Sta. Isabel Norte. She is 42 years old. Emelia is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Emelia owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Emelia has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emelia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Emelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela L. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Linao, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and a mobile phone service electronic re-loading businesses. 

Her husband Jose L., who is 40 years old, works as a security guard to earn his living. They have an 8-year old child. 

Carmela joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Carmela has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7500, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 5th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 12000, which she intends to use to  purchase more stocks to sell, so that she can continue to save up for future education of her child. Carmela L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Tunas Mekar Asih Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut T. is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya - Bali. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ni Ketut T. raises pigs for sale. She has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 250,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) a month. In 2010, Ni Ketut T. joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Ni Ketut T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 IDR from MUK which was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her second loan from MUK. Ni Ketut T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. She hopes that her partnership with MUK will go well so that in the next loan cycle she can potentially receive a larger loan. Also, she is hoping to receive free advice on caring for her pigs from MUK. Ni Ketut T. is the new leader of a 15 member group accessing a loan offered by MUK. Before her, the group leader was Ni Made A.. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Tunas Mekar Asih" (PK-10307). About MUK The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. Ni Ketut T. 0 (0) merupakan 36 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Ni Ketut T. adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 15 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Tunas MekarAsih (PK-10307). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Ketut T. sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut T. menghasilkan sekitar 0,250 IDR. Dalam 2010, Ni Ketut T. bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Ketut T. telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1.500.000 IDR dari MUK. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.500.000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Fátima Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Fátima del Socorro M. G. ella es Trabajadora activa de la Alcaldía Municipal San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como Recepcionista, tiene  dos años de trabajar para esta institución es casada actualmente tiene un niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con Ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Fátima del Socorro M. G. is married and has been working as a receptionist for the San Rafael del Sur city hall for the past two years.  She is married and has a school-aged son.  She has had two previous loans through CEPRODEL and has used each to buy building materials  to make improvements to her home.  This has benefited her because it has allowed her to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal Amaquella, tiene 50 años y 6 hijos.
Juana se dedica la venta de materiales de construcción como agregados arena fina, hormigón, arena de asentar, piedra chancada, ladrillos, tubos, cemento ella aprendió de ésta actividad desde muy joven pues sus padres se dedicaban a éste negocio.
Juana no almacena los agregados, sólo atiende pedidos mediante llamadas telefónicas y en esto le ayuda su esposo, tienen un volquete de 5 cubos el acarrea los agregados y reparte los pedidos a domicilio. El sueño de ambos es poder adquirir un volquete de 10 metros cúbicos, en cuanto a las dificultades si tuvo en una oportunidad solicito un crédito a su nombre para otra persona  y ésta no pago, pero ahora ya aprendió la lección y sigue trabajando con mucho animo, le gusta las reuniones de su bancomunal porque puede ahorrar y aprende mucho de las capacitaciones que imparte su promotora. Solicita el crédito para poder tener capital comprar los agregados.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the Amaquella Communal Bank. She is 50 years old and has 6 children.

Juana is engaged in the sale of construction materials such as aggregate, fine sand, concrete, mortar, gravel, bricks, pipes, and cement. She learned this business at a young age since her parents were involved in it.

Juana does not stockpile aggregate. She responds to orders made over the telephone. Her husband helps with this. They have a 5 cubic meter dump trick. He hauls the aggregate, and she gives out the orders from their home.

They both dream of being able to acquire a 10 cubic meter dump truck. Among the difficulties she has had is applying for a loan in her own name for another person who didn’t pay. She learned her lesson, however, and continues working with a lot of spirit. She likes the meetings of her communal bank because she can save and learn a from the training given by her backers. She is applying for the loan in order to be able to have capital for purchasing aggregate.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: Olivia G. R. se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, nueva y artículos para el hogar desde hace 4 años. Ella es madre de 4 pequeños por quienes sale adelante para ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. Aunque es apoyada económicamente por su esposo, ellos optaron por el negocio para tener una entrada más de dinero, al que en este momento desea invertir con ropa de temporada ya que en la época navideña se incrementa más sus ganancias.
texts.en: Olivia G. R. sells used clothes, new clothes and articles for the home.  She has been in this business for 4 years.  She has four young children and she works so that she can offer them a better quality of life.  Although she receives financial support from her husband, they decided to set up her business in order to have another source of income.  She would currently like to invest in buying seasonal clothes since her profits increase over the Christmas period.

loans.use: To stock her business

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha, de 30 años, convive con Robert, de 34 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Ziomara, de 8 y Sebastian de 8 meses de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. El trabajo al que se dedica Bertha, es la compra y venta de papa en un puesto que alquila en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Donde vende un promedio de 50 nuevos soles diarios, pero cuando vende su propia producción de papa, sus ganancias se incrementan a 200 nuevos soles diarios; ya que según afirma hace 12 años que siembra papa en sus terrenos agrícolas que tienen en el pueblo de Tapo y Huasahuasi, donde genera un promedio de 90 sacos en cada cosecha. Bertha agradece a Dios por toda la bendición que le dio hasta ahora, es por ello que quiere invertir sus ganancias en la compra de su casa propia, así como también en hacer crecer su negocio. Es el quinto crédito con MFP, y está orgullosa de los constantes avances que tuvo en estos meses, ya que los consejos que recibe en las reuniones con su banco comunal, la ayudan a tomar buenas decisiones. Por ello con el crédito que solicita, esta pensando comprar varios sacos de papa que venderá en el mercado.
texts.en:
Bertha, 30, cohabits with Robert, 34.  They have two children:  Ziomara, 8, and Sebastián, 8 months.  They live together as a family in a rented house located in the city of Tarma.  

Bertha is a potato merchant in a rented stall in her city’s wholesale market.  Her sales average about 50 new soles daily but when she sells her own potato production her profits increase to 200 new soles daily.  According to what she tells us, she has been growing potatoes for 12 years on fields she has in the town of Tapo and Huasahuasi where she harvests about 90 sacks of potatoes at each harvest.

Bertha thanks God for all the blessings she’s gotten to date.  This is why she wants to invest her profits in the purchase of a house of her own as well as to make her business grow.

This is her 5th loan with MFP and she is proud of the constant advances she’s had over the months because the advice she gets at the communal bank meetings has helped her make good decisions.  She plans to use the requested loan to buy several sacks of potatoes that she will then sell in the market.

loans.use: To stock up on sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita is from the village of Dicayas. She is 56 years old and is single. Alita operates a family member's business in the agriculture sector  raising pigs in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Alita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials and labor needed to build her pig fence. Alita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional piglets and feeds for her business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Alita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feeds

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” LOS HERALDOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marina; ella tiene 42 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias como consultora de belleza de las marcas de Esika, Avon, Unique y Dupre, la socia vende cremas, colonias, perfumes entre otros a la vez la socia vende jugos de en mercado del distrito de Zarzuela y de esta manera la socia saca a su familia adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas productos para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Marina is a member of the ”LOS HERALDOS” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Marina is 42 years old, married and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities as a beauty consultant for Esika, Avon, Unique and Dupre brand cosmetics.  She sells creams, cologne, perfume and other products.  She also sells juice in the Zarzuela district market.  In this way, she gets her family ahead in life.

Marina is requesting this loan so that she can buy more products for her business.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more products for her business

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Don Elías, reside en Semsembra departamento de Morazán, donde vive con su esposa, sus hijos, don Elías tiene 61 años de edad, se dedica a la crianza de ganado, inicio este negocio desde que era joven trabajando todo el día en el mantenimiento del ganado y en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, esto le ha permitido ganar experiencia.
Por el momento está necesitando un préstamo para la compra de harinilla y concentrado para el ganado esto le ayudara a mantener alimento para un buen tiempo en el verano, beneficiándole con la facilidad de contar con un inventario.
Su sueño es tener la posibilidad de que sus hijos asistan a la universidad para que se preparen académicamente y puedan accesar a un empleo bien remunerado, también sueña con un crecimiento en el negocio como ganadero para proveer ingresos y sostener los gastos del hogar y tener un estilo de vida más estable.
texts.en:
Elias lives in Semsembra, in the department of Morazan. He lives together with his wife and their children. Elias is 61 years old and he is a cattle farmer. He started the business when he was very young, working all day raising their cattle and tending the corn and bean plantations.  This has earned him a great deal of experience. 

He requests a loan to purchase cornmeal and concentrated feed for the cattle. it will help him secure the feed he needs to ensure a good summer season, improving his inventory. 

His dream is to see his kids go to university and to be academically ready to access a well-paid employment. He also dreams to expanding his business to increase his income and support the house hold to have a more stable quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase cattle feed.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria vive en el municipio del sauce, ella tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Se dedica a la venta de sorbetes, hace más de 16 años que tiene este negocio, ha salido adelante por medio de los sacrificios que diariamente realiza ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que disfruta de su medio de vida ya que la mayoría de sus clientes son los niños. Todos los días recorre diferentes calles para ofrecer sus deliciosos sorbetes. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de sorbetes, bolsas, hielo.
texts.en: Ana Maria lives in the municipality of Sauce. She has three young children to take care of. She works selling sorbets, and has had this business for more than 16 years. She has gotten ahead due to her daily sacrifices. She is an entrepreneurial woman who enjoys her livelihood, as the majority of her customers are children. Every day she travels different streets to sell her delicious sorbets. The loan is for purchasing sorbets, bags, and ice.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: The purchase of manure for use on his farms

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda, de 52 años es una mujer muy jovial. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Antonio de 60 años y sus hijos 5 hijos de los 7 que tiene en total. Con quienes juntamente trata de salir adelante. Por muchos años Hermelinda, trabajó preparando buffets para todo tipo de eventos. Pero hace 2 años, en sociedad con su hijo emprendieron el negocio del Internet  en el ambiente de su casa. Se iniciaron con solo 2 maquinas y al poco tiempo 2 más y hoy tienen 10 cabinas para este fin, y una para el control de las horas de las maquinas. Desde entonces, no dispone de mucho tiempo libre, y sus ganancias son muy alentadoras y eso le motiva a seguir trabajando con el mismo dinamismo, pero también se llena de mucho temor en  invertir más; por lo que en su barrio hay mucha delincuencia. Esta contenta de ser un apoyo y pilar para su hijo, por ello se propone construir el segundo piso donde trasladen su negocio y le sea más seguro su negocio. Es el 11avo crédito que tiene con MFP y pertenece  a un grupo de crédito muy pequeño conformado de tres personas, pero si todas son muy responsables, por lo que se siente orgullosa de trabajar con ellas. Asimismo promete pagar puntualmente. De obtener el crédito Hermilinda, comprará una impresora, para renovar la que tiene en uso, de este modo continuar trabajando con las anhelos de sobresalir.
texts.en:
Hermelinda, aged 52, is a very jovial woman. She lives in her own house, together with her husband Antonio, aged 60, and 5 of their children - they have 7 in total. They all try to succeed together.

For many years Hermelinda worked preparing buffets for all sorts of events. 2 years ago, however, she and her son started an Internet cafe in their home. They started with just 2 computers, before long had 2 more, and today they have 10 booths available, plus one more computer to manage the timetabling of the machines available. This now takes up most of their time, and the profits are very encouraging, which motivates them to keep working with the same dynamism that got them started. Hermelinda is nervous about investing more, however, because there is a lot crime in their neighbourhood. She is happy to be able to provide support to her son, and she proposes building a second story onto their home, which they would move the business into, and which would be more secure. 

This is Hermelinda's 11th loan with [field partner] MFP. She belongs to a small group of 3 borrowers, who are all very responsible women, and Hermelinda is proud to work with the others. By the same token, she promises to make her repayments on time. On obtaining the loan, Hermelinda will buy a printer, and continue her work with the same drive to improve.

loans.use: Comprar una impresora.

loans.name: Nem

texts.en:
Nem M. is 48 years old and married to Chor Nak, 49, a casual construction worker. They live in Reusey Keo commune, in the capital of Phnom Penh. The couple is blessed with five teenage children, two of whom are married and have their own homes, and three of whom still rely on their parents' income. 

Nem M. is a fast food seller in the mobile place by using her motorbike. 

Recently, the family has faced difficulties with living conditions as her house is really old and it needs to be repaired. So she will use this loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: to repair her old house

loans.name: Gulsunbubu's Group

texts.en:
Gulsunbubu J. is the leader of this group. She is 58 and married. Together with her husband she has raised two sons; both sons are engaged in cattle breeding. The family lives in a small mining town, Tashkomur, which is in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Gulsunbubu and her husband started to breed cattle a long time ago; they have been in this business almost 21 years. Reselling cattle after fattening they earn 10,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan the family would purchase a calf for breeding. In the near future she wants to finish building a shed for her cattle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa C. is from the village of Tayong, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 49 years old. Rosa is separated from her spouse and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rosa owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing videoke or karaoke services to local community members. Rosa has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rosa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosa is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools & equipment needed to provide service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools & equipment needed to provide service.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame K. sells plastic containers such as pails, baskets and basins, in Eguafo near the fishing town of Elmina. Her husband works in a gold mine and Maame’s income helps pay for their utility bills and accommodations.  

Maame is keen to grow her business and plans to use her Kiva loan to buy more plastic items to sell. She wants to reinvest any additional profits she earns back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: buy more plasticware to sell

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un joven de 24 años de edad que vive con su esposa y pequeño hijo en el distrito de Tambogrande – Piura. La falta de una buena calidad de vida (la casa de Luis no cuenta con los servicios básicos) lo motiva a seguir trabajando y él tiene muchos deseos de superación.

Luis se dedica diariamente a la crianza de ganado ovino y a la agricultura, este cosecha semanalmente. Además, la crianza de ovejas le ha dado muchas satisfacciones pues las puede comercializar ya sea por carne, por su leche o por su lana. Esto le ha permitido a Luis darle ciertas comodidades a su hijo.

Luis solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1600 nuevos soles para comprarle alimento balanceado a sus ovejas, para que estas tengan una mejor lana y mejor calidad de leche y carne. Además otra parte del crédito será destinada a la compra de fertilizantes para los cultivos de Limón que Luis está cosechando actualmente.

Este crédito le permitirá a Luis seguir creciendo en ambos negocios, para poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Luis cuenta con un buen historial crediticio en nuestra entidad.
texts.en:
Luis is a 24 year old young man who lives with his wife and young son in the Tambogrande-Piura district.  The lack of a good quality of life (Luis’ house does not have basic services) motivates him to continue working.  He has a great desire to get ahead.

Luis devotes himself every day to raising sheep and to farming, and he harvests weekly.  Also, raising sheep has given him great satisfaction because he can sell them for their meat, their milk, or their wool.  This has allowed Luis to give certain comforts to his son.

Luis is requesting a loan for 1,600 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed for his sheep.  This is so that they have better wool and a better quality of milk and meat.  He will use the other part of the loan to buy fertilizers for the lemon crops that he is currently harvesting.

This loan will allow Luis to continue growing in both businesses.  This is in order to give his family a better quality of life.  Luis has a good credit history with our institution.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 48 years old, married and has two children. Her oldest child is 25. Gloria is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She has been growing rice for five years. She also raises hogs and runs a sari-sari store. She earns about 11,000 PHP per month from her businesses.
This loan will be used to purchase pig feed, fertilizer and more items to sell, such as canned goods. In the future, she hopes to make her family successful.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed, fertilizer and more items to sell, such as canned goods.

loans.name: Oscar Ernesto

texts.es:
Oscar Ernesto tiene 20 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los padres. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NARCISA DE JESUS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Temistocles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Osacar se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz, es tradición en su familia dedicarse a este negocio. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa en la ciudad de ventanas.

Le gusta trabajar y conversar con la esposa.
texts.en:
Oscar Ernesto is 20 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and parents. He lives in the Canton Ventanas Province of Los Rios.

This group is called Narcisa de Jesus. It is located in the San Temistocles Building in the Canton Ventanas zone. This group pertains to agricultural work within the short planting seasons for corn and rice.

Oscar works in agriculture, especially in the planting of corn. It is a family tradition to work in this business. He purchases the seeds locally each month and sells [the produce] in the local market.

He is requesting this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. This loan will help him financially to meet his needs in the face of challenges such as plagues, crop diseases, and climate changes. His dream is to purchase a house in the city of Ventanas.

He likes to work and talk to his wife.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude is married with eight children and five are school going.  She takes care of one additional family member.

Getrude owns a retail shop in Ndeeba.  She has been in business for less than a year and sell to all categories of people both retail and wholesale.

Gertrude has requested a loan of 800,000 from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO to buy more stock for her retail shop and to build her own shop. Gertrude lives in a home that she rents and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes rent, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria Mercedes tiene 45 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene dos hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA, se encuentra ubicada en el en el Recinto La primavera, perteneciente al Canton Ventans, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Maria Mercedes se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz  y frejol. Compra sus productos en Comercial Peña y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es arreglar la casa por que la familia aumenta.

Le gusta hacer la limpieza en la casa.
texts.en:
45-year old Maria Mercedes lives with her husband and children in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province. She has two children.

The V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA Community Bank is located in La Primavera Recinto, in Ventanas canton. Its members work in agriculture and grow corn and rice.

Maria Mercedes too is a farmer and grows corn, rice, and beans. She buys her supplies in the Peña store and sells them in the wholesale market in Ventanas. She is seeking a loan to buy corn and rice seeds as well as supplies and fertilizer for her fields. The money will help her buy daily necessities. 

Maria Mercedes’s dream is to renovate her house as her family is growing. She enjoys keeping her home clean and tidy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Kadith

texts.es:
La Sra. Kadith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Lameñas” del Distrito y Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 37 años y 1 hijo en edad escolar.
	
A partir de los 16 años empezó a trabajar y de esa manera apoyaba con los gastos de casa, esto le permitió contar con independencia económica desde entonces.  La idea del negocio fue su iniciativa propia, empezó elaborando chupetes (helados de hielo) y gelatina.
Luego decidió juntar un pequeño capital (con el préstamo de Manuela Ramos) y vender abarrotes en su casa. Actualmente ha incrementado nuevos productos como carne, huevos, todo tipo de bebidas, granos y verduras, cuenta con una buena clientela pues brinda una buena atención y se esmera cada día más para mantener a su clientela.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 comprará perfumes, regalos, ropa y zapatos para captar nuevos clientes, la idea de comprar estos productos es diversificar su negocio y ampliarlo, de esa manera mantener satisfechos a sus clientes actuales, los mismos que demandan estos productos.

Kadith  es una mujer creativa y emprendedora, su sueño es contar con un negocio que vaya creciendo, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle la oportunidad de crecer como micro empresaria.
texts.en:
Sra.  Kadith is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Lameñas” which is located in the District and Province of Lamas, Department of San Martín.  She is 37 years old, single, and has a son who is of school age.

At the age of 16, Kadith began working in order to help with the household expenses.  This has allowed her to be financially independent since that time.  The idea of starting a business was her own.  She began making ice cream treats and gelatins.  Later on, she decided to take out a small loan with Manuela Ramos and used the money as capital for selling groceries from her home.  At the moment, she has increased her inventory with new products such as meat, eggs, all types of beverages, grains, and vegetables.  She has a good customer base and provides them excellent service and care each day so that they will continue to do business with her.  

With this new loan of 3000 PEN, Kadith will buy perfumes, gifts, clothing, and shoes so that she can attract new customers and satisfy her existing customers.  

Kadith is a creative and enterprising woman.  Her dream is to have a growing business.  She is extremely grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing her the opportunity to grow as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, gifts, clothes, and shoes

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo de 28 años está casado con Sandra de 29 años, juntos tienen un hermoso hijo. Viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Alfredo, es un hombre trabajador que desde su infancia poseía el deseo de sobresalir. Debido a la economía precaria en la que su familia se encontraba, no pudo desarrollar bien sus estudios por lo que decidió  dedicarse a los negocios. Inicialmente, se dedicó a la agricultura,  con el dinero que logró ahorrar se compró una mototaxi. Actualmente, es taxista en la localidad de Pichari lo que le da una óptima rentabilidad; esto le permite brindarle una buena alimentación a su familia y  poseer una economía estable.
En el futuro, Alfredo  desea abrir una tienda de abarrotes y ubicarla en su propia casa. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que el se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.  Con los 1,500 amueblara su nueva tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en: Alfredo, 28, is married to 29 year-old Sandra and they have one beautiful son together. They live in their own house located in the district of Pichari. Alfredo is a hard-working man who has possessed a desire to succeed since infancy. Due to the precarious economic situation that his family found itself in, he was not able to get very far in his studies. Therefore, he decided to dedicate himself to business. Initially, he worked in agriculture. With the money that he saved up, he bought a motorcycle taxi. Now he is a taxi driver in the locality of Pichari, which is where you make the most profits. This allows him to provide his family with good nutrition and economic stability. In the future, Alfredo hopes to open a grocery store in his house. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and he promises to be punctual in his repayments. He will use the 1,500 nuevos soles to furnish his new grocery store.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his new grocery store, such as shelves

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a 54-year-old woman living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store at home to cater to neighborhood's daily consumption. She has been running her store for 3 years.  This business operation normally provides her a total of PHP 3,000 a month.

Marilou has been a GDMPC member since this year. She has applied for a loan worth PHP 5,000 from the cooperative. She will use the money to buy additional grocery stocks to sell.  She means to attain her goal of improving and expanding her business, that is why she is exerting more effort. With the probable gain in revenue, she hopes to buy a new fridge for drinks .

loans.use: buy more grocery stocks to sell

loans.name: Khursona

texts.ru: Хурсона проживает в города Вахдат. Ей 52 года. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Ее муж предоставляет услугу, он парикмахер. Сама Хурсона занимается торговлей на рынке. Она занимается продажей детской обуви. В этой области она уже 17 лет. Кредит берет для покупки детской одежды.
texts.en: Khursona lives in the city of Vahdat.  She is 52 years old, married and has six children.  Her husband provides a service; he is a barber.  Khursona is involved in retail sales at a market.  She sells children's shoes and has been in this business for 17 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of children's clothing.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing

loans.name: Natsagdorj

texts.en:
Natsagdorj, 19, is an accounting student at a university. He lives with his father, mother, sister and brother in the town of Kherlen in Dornod, a province of Mongolia. His parents are herders and his sister is not yet employed. The family needs additional income from another source to improve their living conditions. Also, Natsagdorj has been paying his own school fees and meeting his basic daily needs, but over several years his costs and fees have risen dramatically. 

These factors have led Natsagdorj to decide to start his own business selling spare auto parts. He owns a small apartment downtown and wants to pledge it against the loan, which he needs to build working capital and start planning his business.

loans.use: To build working capital and start planning his auto parts business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a determined businesswoman aged 33.  She is married and blessed with three children.  She has been rearing pigs to support her family. 
Through Faulu Kenya, she has improved her business hence improving her living standards.  In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy pigs.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is 57 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Rosela has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retailing business for 3 years and also earns an income from her sari-sari (general) store.

Rosela aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 45-years-old and lives in Lobogon Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children.
 
Luzminda has a clothing business and earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more clothes for her clothing business. 

Luzminda has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her clothing business.

loans.name: El Pinito Group

texts.es:
Julgencia cuenta con 36 años de edad, es casada tiene 6 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando el mayor no estudia se llama Fernando, y  Suriel está cursando 3º de secundaria, Jessica esta en 1º de secundaria, jazmín, en 2º de primaria, maritza en 3º de preescolar mientras que Jotzamara solo tiene 2 años de edad, su esposo se llama Tobia el se dedica al campo.

Ella se dedica al comercio vende ropa en el mercado del pueblo lo cual surtirá su préstamo en la compra de nuevos modelos de pantalones, faldas, vestidos, etc. doña julgencia le gustaría establecer un local para poner su negocio, ella dice que su préstamo le ayudado mucho, ya que pues con sus ganancias ayuda con los gastos de su familia y así le podrá dar una mejor educación a sus hijos ya que Suriel sueña ser doctor.

Julgencia pertenece al grupo el pinito llama pinito ya que donde se reúnen esta un pinito, él grupo  se encuentra integrado por 13 personas 12 mujeres y un hombre que a continuación  serán mencionados:

Felicitas, Prisciliana, Araceli, Adilene, Tobia, Irma, Paula, Juana, Margarita, Fabiana, Rogaciana y Irma. Todos se dedican a una actividad distinta de comercio como son venta de pan, camote, carnicería, pesca, dulces, quesos, tamales, etc.
texts.en:
Julgencia is 36 years old, married and has 6 children who study except for the eldest, Fernando. Suriel is in her 3rd year of high school, Jessica in her 1st year of high school, Jazmin in 2nd grade, Maritza in preschool whilst Jotzamara is only 2 years old. Her husband, Tobia, is a farmer.

She sells clothes at the town market and will use the loan to buy new models of pants, skirts, dresses, etc.  Doña Julgencia would like to establish her business in premises. She says that her loan has helped her a lot as her profits help with the household expenses. In this way she can give her children a better education as Suriel dreams of becoming a doctor. 

Julgencia belongs to the communal bank called El Pinito (Small Pine Tree) as there is a small pine tree where they meet. The group consists of 13 people, 12 women and 1 man who are mentioned below.

Felicitas, Prisciliana, Araceli, Adilene, Tobia, Irma, Paula, Juana, Margarita, Fabiana, Rogaciana and Irma. They all have different business activities such as the sale of bread, meat, sweet potatoes, fish, sweets, cheeses and tamales, etc.

loans.use: to buy new models of pants, skirts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 5 children who all go to school. She takes care of an additional family member (her sister's child). Irene owns a food stall at the market on a retail basis. She works 6 days a week and has been in business for the last 10 years. She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, and cassava. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to build rental houses. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, and cassava.

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson is aged 33  and married with 3 children aged between 7 and 2. The oldest two are already at school. He lives with his family in their home in Litein where he currently carries out dairy and tea farming. His produce is sold to the local market. He also does timber lumbering.

Nickson has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He is optimistic that his farming business will grow and help him to provide his family with their basic needs. He aims to make farming his full time activity.

He is however concerned at the poor prices for farm products in the market.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nozimjon

texts.ru: Нозимчон сорокасемилетний женатый мужчина. Он проживает в городе Исфара. У него четверо детей. Нозимчон предоставляет услугу на своем грузовом автомобиле. Он берет кредит для ремонта автомобиля.
texts.en: Nozimjon is a forty year old married man. he lives in the city of Isfara and has four children. Nozimjon uses his truck in his transportation business and needs this loan to repair the vehicle.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Marilú

texts.es:
La Sra. Marilú, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, su edad es 52 años y tiene 05 hijos, que ya no están a su cargo porque se sostienen solos.
 La señora Marilú, siempre ayudó a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar, con la venta de abarrotes en su casa ayudó con los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos, que ahora ya son profesionales, pero dejó el negocio por motivos económicos. Desde hace tres años, al ingresar a su banquito, que decidió reiniciar un nuevo negocio para generar sus propios ingresos, es así que con el primer préstamo que recibió compró madera, y su esposo la ayudó fabricando sillas, stands y mesas, que ella vendía, y duplicó sus ganancias, esto le sirvió para comprar una máquina de coser, donde confeccionaba vestidos y salía a venderlos, es así como iba juntando dinero para comprar vitrinas, mesa y cumplir con su sueño de volver a implementar una tienda de abarrotes para poder trabajar desde sus casa, 
Con este préstamo de S/.2,000.00, compró productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, jabón, detergente, etc.) para  implementar una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, que es lo que siempre quiso tener un negocio que pudiera realizarlo desde su casa.
Marilú, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora,  su sueño es que su familia esté más unida en el futuro y además seguir implementando su negocio, para incrementar sus ganancias, y satisfacer las necesidades de sus nuevos clientes. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por los valores que les viene impartiendo como son la responsabilidad y la solidaridad.
texts.en:
Marilú belongs to the “Mujeres de la Colina II” (Women of the Hill II) communal bank in La Banda de Shilcayo District, San Martín Province and Department.  She’s 52 years old, married and has five children who are no longer in her care because they support themselves.

Marilú always helped her husband with household expenses selling groceries at home.  She helped pay for her children’s schooling and they are all now professionals.  She left the business due to economic reasons.  For the last three years since joining the communal bank she decided to start a new business to earn her own income.  This is how she used her the first loan she got to buy lumber.  Her husband helped her to manufacture chairs, stands and tables that she’d sell.  She doubled her profits.  This helped her buy a sewing machine that she used to make dresses that she’d go out to sell.  This is how she gradually saved up money to buy display cases and tables to reach her dream of once again opening a grocery store so that she could work from home.

She will use this 2000 sol loan to buy basic staple items (rice, sugar, milk, oil, soap, detergent, etc.) to set up a small grocery store which is what she’s always wanted to have: a business she could run from home.

Marilú is a hardworking, tenacious woman.  Her dream is that her family is more united in the future and that she can continue to equip her store to increase profits and meet the needs of new customers.  She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for the values it’s imparting like responsibility and mutual support.

loans.use: to buy groceries (basic staple items).

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis used his previous loan to buy shoes for resale. He is still faced with challenges of price fluctuation, inflation, and high transportation costs. In addition to his dream of buying land to build rental houses, he would also like to buy a car to simplify the transportation of his shoes to the different markets. Francis needs the new loan to buy more used shoes to sell during this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy used shoes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
This is Merlita, 42, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Jesus, an Aircon technician, and mother of two children. By the grace of God, Merlita has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Merlita operates a business selling sugar. What she basically does is buy sacks of sugar from wholesalers, repack them and sell them per kilo to individuals, general store owners, and the local community. Sugar is repacked in ¼, 1/2, and 1 kilo packages. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more sugar to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Merlita dreams to be able to give all of her children a high quality education through her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work, and to draw strength and inspiration from her study of the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy sugar

loans.name: Naisuako

texts.en:
Naisuako is a mixed farmer. She has been practising mixed farming; livestock and land farming for the last ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 14,000. She is taking her second loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD and plans to use the loan to purchase farm inputs.This includes land preparations, fertilizers and hybrid seeds to boost crop yields.

She intends to use the anticipated profits in diversifying into getting livestock breeds for fattening and also to pay school fees for her children. Her future dreams are to prosper and improve her family’s living standards

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Quevedo.  Empezó con su propio dinero, con el cual invirtió en mercadería para comercializarla.  Labora todos los días, particularmente los fines de semana cuando sale al campo a vender sus artículos.  Se encuentra separada de su esposo, tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 8 años, quienes estudian en el colegio y escuela fiscal del sector.  A futuro, piensa en comprar un vehículo para incrementar su negocio.  Necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de zapatos, blusas y jeans para su venta.

loans.use: Compra de jeans, blusas y zapatos

loans.name: Adjo

texts.en:
Born on July 27, 1981, Ms Adjo A. is the mother of two (2) children. Her husband, a volunteer teacher in a private school where the pay is unpredictable, is unable to meet the needs of his household. Ms A. takes care of her younger sister and her grandmother, who raised them from the age of five. Having left primary school owing to a lack of means, at a young age she began a second-hand clothing business, which she now operates successfully. She has had three previous loans, all quickly paid off without difficulty. She is evidently a trustworthy woman deserving of financial support.

She is now asking for a loan of $900, to buy bales of used clothing directly from the port of Lomé, so as make a bigger profit. In this way Ms A. will increase her income, enabling her to provide for the education of her two children and her younger sister, and to cover her grandmother’s medical expenses. In short, she will be able to improve their quality of life. She would then have enough money to seek out and bring home her mother, who left the country without any indications of her whereabouts and has not been heard from since.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY/J.V. Guy-Bray.

Née le 27 juillet 1981, Madame A. Adjo est mère de deux (02) enfants. Son mari, un enseignant volontaire dans une école privée aux salaires irréguliers, n’arrive pas à subvenir au besoin de son foyer. Elle a à sa charge sa petite sœur et sa grand-mère qui les a élevés depuis l’âge de 5 ans. Ayant arrêté ses études au cours primaires par manque de support, elle s’est lancée très tôt dans le petit commerce de friperie qu’elle maîtrise très bien aujourd’hui. Elle avait bénéficié par le passé de trois crédits promptement remboursés sans incident. Elle fait preuve d’une femme de confiance et mérite d’être soutenue financièrement. Elle sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $900 qui servira à acheter des balles de friperie directement au port de Lomé pour en tirer plus de bénéfice. Ce faisant ainsi, Madame A. augmentera ses revenus lui permettant d’assurer l’éducation de ses deux enfants et celle de sa petite sœur, à faire face aux soins médicaux de sa grand-mère, bref, à améliorer leur cadre de vie. Elle pourra ainsi disposer de moyens pour chercher et ramener aux bercails, sa mère qui a quitté le pays sans laisser de trace et sans faire signe de vie.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing for sale

loans.name: David

texts.en: I am a single man. I dropped out of school due to lack of school fees. I am the breadwinner in my family. I believe the loan will help me diversify and expand the business and be able to meet our basic needs with ease.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Juan Martin

texts.en:
Mr. Juan Martin needs to make a few improvements to his property. He says, "I would like to build a bench because the water accumulates when it rains and creates moisture on one of the walls of the house. I also want to paint the exterior walls of the house." He is asking for $1200 to build a bench and paint.

Translated from Spanish by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Juan Martín necesita hacer algunas mejoras en su vivienda. “Me gustaría poner una banqueta ya que se acumula mucho el agua cuando llueve y provoca humedad en una de las paredes de mi casa, también quiero pintar las paredes por fuera de la casa”. Solicita $ 1,200.00 dlls Para poner una banqueta y pintar.

loans.use: To build a bench and paint the exterior of his house.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
A. Muhabbat has been selling women’s clothes for six years. She is married, has secondary education. Her husband works as a painter, he renovates apartments. She started getting loans from Microinvest in 2002. Then her assets were 200$. She started from selling cosmetics then moved to women’s clothes. Her assets have increased to 1200$. Her mother helps her with the business. She travels once a month to purchase goods. In the future she wants to increase inventory and travel to purchase goods more often. P.S. The picture is of her mother

Translated from Russian by Asya Lisak, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдуллоева Мухаббат занимается продажей женской одежды уже шесть лет. Замужем, образование среднее. Муж работает маляром, он ремонтирует квартиры. С 2002 года начала кредитоваться в «Микроинвест»-е. Тогда её активы состовляли около 200$. Она занималась торговлей парфюмерий, затем перешла на продажу женской одежды. Сейчас ее активы возросли до 1200$. В её деятельности помогает её мать. За товаром ездит раз в месяц. В дальнейшем хочет увеличить товарооборот и ездить за товаром чаще. P.S. На фото её мать.

loans.use: increase assortment

loans.name: Fatou Seye

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the eleven members of the Sant ak Kooluté group, represented by Ms. Fatou Sèye D.. Located in the traditional fishing village of Yoff, Sant ak Kooluté has long specialized in producing the batiks and other vibrant hand-dyed fabrics that are used to make traditional clothing here in Senegal. In addition to their main occupation of cloth-dyeing, the members of Sant ak Kooluté group collaborate in a wide variety of modest income-generating activities, from raising chickens and vegetable gardening to sewing and crafting artisanal dolls. The funding from this loan will be used to expand the Sant ak Kooluté cloth-dyeing business, including the purchase of a greater variety of blank fabrics and dye colors.

This is the Sant ak Kooluté group group's second Kiva loan. They have recently reimbursed their previous loan in full and have applied for a larger loan to continue to expand their cloth-dyeing business. Check out this group's previous journal entries.

Background: Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural micro-enterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance. Visit our website at www.sem-fund.org to learn more!

loans.use: Purchase materials for traditional cloth-dyeing business

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir has a shop where he sells clothes and shoes for men. He is 23 years old, single, and lives in Khachmaz town. This young man has been in this business for 3 years. Now he needs a loan of $950 to buy clothes and shoes for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes for improving his business

loans.name: Thi Ly

texts.vi: Chị Lý sinh năm 1951, có 4 con. Hiện tại chị đang kinh doanh băng đĩa. Đây là công việc chính tạo thu nhập cho gia đình. Chồng chị làm thợ xây cũng hỗ trợ được cho gia đình. Từ trước đến nay, chị chưa tvay vốn từ tổ chức nào vì chị không đáp ứng được các yêu cầu cho vay của họ như phải thế chấp, khoản vay phải lớn, lãi suất cao.... Chị rất vui mừng khi tiếp cận được với chương trình  tài chính vi mô Binhminh và mong muốn sớm được nhận vốn vay.

loans.use: To purchase discs & tapes

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en: V. Ismayil is a 66-year-old farmer who owns his small business in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Biasuvar region. He lives with his wife and four children in an IDP settlement since 1992. He has more than fifteen years in selling dairy products. One cow used to provide enough product to support his family, but in recent years, prices have increased and earning enough money is difficult. In order to increase his production, he is requesting a loan of  $1200 to purchase two milk cows.

loans.use: To purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Haryati

texts.en: Haryati, 33, is married to D. who has no fixed job. To provide for her family needs, she sells cosmetics such as powder, parfume, face cleanser, etc., door to door, earning $4 a day. She is a member of MBK and now requesting a loan of $75 to buy more good to sell. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Buy more goods to sell in her cosmetics business

loans.name: Aura Delia

texts.es:
The sale of cosmetics is a business that Mrs. Aura O. has dedicated herself to for the last 2 years in the region of Condega of the city of Esteli. She is a married mother and with the responsibility of 5 children in her charge she fights and makes an effort to satisfy all and every necessity. A problem that she has had to overcome is the necessity of obtaining cosmetics and due to her low economic income she requests credits from Ceprodel so that she can obtain the cosmetics from the suppliers and sell them so that she can keep maintaining her nuclear family.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de cosméticos es el negocio al que se dedica desde hace 2 años la señora Aura O. en el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí. Es madre casada y con la responsabilidad de cinco hijos a su cargo que lucha y se esfuerza para satisfacer todas y cada una de sus necesidades.

Una problemática que atraviesa la señora Aura es la necesidad de obtener los cosméticos y debido a sus bajos ingresos económicos solicita créditos en Ceprodel para adquirir los cosméticos que le proporcionan los proveedores y de esta manera comercializarlos para continuar manteniendo su núcleo familiar.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Abra

texts.en:
Ms. Abra D. is 41 years old and a married mother of 3 children.  She lives and works in the town of Adéta, a medium-sized town located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo.  Popular dress in Togo consists of a skirt and top cut and tailored from a length of fabric, and another length of fabric wrapped around the waist.  These pieces of fabric, which are vibrantly colored and lightweight, are called ‘pagnes.’  Selling pagnes is a popular business for women in Abra’s region, as they travel to Lomé to purchase them to resell in the market in Adéta.  
With her loan Abra hopes to buy more pagnes in various prints and colors to increase her stock and continue to satisfy her loyal customers.  The revenue generated from her increased sales will allow her to continue to send her 3 children to school and to improve the quality of her family’s life.

loans.use: To buy more pagnes (West African fabrics)

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es:
Maria Ester is a woman with a lot of character and a great personality. She was exclusively a homemaker until one of her sisters gave her a carrito sanguchero (a mini kitchen on wheels) so that she could work. For six months she has been selling salchipapas (typical Peruvian food with potatoes and sausages) by night, at first with the help of her brother but now on her own. Still, Maria does not count solely on the income from her kitchen cart. She and her husband, who works as a chauffer, have succeeded in building extra rooms in their house as rental units. Additionally, they rent a car which is used as a taxi.

Maria Ester's plans include paying off the loans that she and her husband both owe so that they can buy a bus to rent out. Ultimately she would like to change to another district in order to have a better quality of life, since at the moment she cannot count on having a network of water-drainage nor on having potable water for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Ester es una mujer con mucho carácter y gran personalidad. Ella siempre se ha dedicado a su casa. Hasta que una de sus hermanas le regalo un carrito sanguchero para que lo ponga a trabajar. Es así que por seis meses ella ha estado vendiendo salchipapas por las noches, al inicio con la ayuda de su hermano pero ahora lo hace sola. No obstante, María no solo cuenta con el ingreso de este trabajo. Ella y su esposo, quien trabaja como chofer, han logrado construir su casa con habitaciones extras para poder rentarlas a inquilinos. Muy aparte de ello alquilan un automóvil para ser trabajado como taxi. Dentro de sus planes esta el terminar de pagar los préstamos que adeuda con su esposo, para comprarse un bus y alquilarlo también. Así también, quisiera mudarse a otro distrito para tener una mejor calidad de vida, ya que actualmente su casa no cuenta con red de desagüe ni de agua potable.

loans.use: Business expenses - sale of fried foods

loans.name: Nuutupu

texts.en: Nuutupu S., 37, is married with 5 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the pork cake business. She sells to the village people  6 days per week. She has 6 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be $208 USD.  SPBD loans are Nuutupu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband is also working hard as a fisherman to support her pork cake business.

loans.use: To provide capital for her pork cake business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María is 55 years old, she did not have the opportunity to study, she speaks Aymará and understands little Spanish, she is married with six children, four are married and two in school. Her home is located in “Barrio Central de Villa Santa Rosa”, District of Yunguyo. For a living she buys and sells cows, sheep, and pigs. She buys at the markets in Huapaca, Chacachaca, and Yunguyo. After raising them they are sold at the same markets. She has been doing this since she was very young. She is a member of “Banco Comunal Túpac Amaru”, and with her first loan of S/.300.00 new Soles she bought three sheep. With this loan of S/.2000.00 ($725), to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy two cows to be sold after the weight-gaining period.
