Thanks to the loans her family is able to move forward and she has learned to be responsible with her payments. Her dream is that her children continue studying and work.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

María tiene 55 años de edad, no pudo estudiar, habla solo aymará y entiende poco castellano, es casada y tiene seis hijos de los cuales cuatro son casados, dos que estudian. Su domicilio esta ubicada en el Barrio Central de Villa Santa Rosa, Distrito de Yunguyo. Se dedica a la compra y venta de vacas, ovejas y chanchos; comprando en las ferias de Huapaca, Chacachaca y Yunguyo, después de criarlas en el proceso de engorde también son vendidas en las mismas ferias, desde muy joven inicio con esta actividad. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Túpac Amaru” inicio con un crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con lo que pudo comprar tres ovejas. Con este crédito de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará dos vacas que serán vendidas después del proceso de engorde. Gracias a los préstamos recibidos su familia puede seguir adelante, además aprendió a ser responsable en sus pagos. El anhelo que ella tiene es que sus hijos continúen estudiando y trabajen.

loans.use: Purchase of cows to be raised and sold.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.en:
Joaquin is a barber who works in the capital of Guatemala. He began working as a barber three and half years ago. His dream was to have his own business and to be a great businessman. He is single and is a member of a church. He saved money and bought a swivel chair, clippers, a table and three plain chairs. He began with a small shop at his house. After a few months his client base grew so he needed more space and he changed to a bigger shop. He now has a swivel chair, a fixed chair, two pairs of clippers, two mirrors, five normal chairs and one employee that helps him cut hair.

His dream is to have another shop, tools, and another employee to continue expanding his client base and be better off economically. He also dreams of having his own house and a family.

He is requesting this loan to buy tools, such as clippers, two mirrors, five plastic chairs, and an apron. Perhaps in the future he will ask for another loan to buy another swivel chair and more clippers. Joaquin is very happy and excited about this loan and hopes to achieve his dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

Joaquin S. es un barbero que trabaja en la capital de Guatemala inicio su trabajo como barbero hace tres años y medio, su sueño era tener su propio negocio y ser un gran empresario el es soltero y es miembro de una iglesia. El ahorro dinero y compro una silla giratoria un cortadora de pelo un mueble y tres sillas normales, el empezó en un local pequeño donde era su hogar y su área de trabajo pasaban los meses y sus clientes aumentaban y necesitaba mas espacio se cambio de local a uno mas grande. Actualmente tiene una silla giratoria, una silla fija, dos cortadoras de pelo, dos espejos cinco sillas normales y un trabajador que le ayuda a cortar pelo.

Su sueño actualmente es tener otro local, herramientas y otro trabajador para seguir aumentando sus clientes y estar mejor económicamente y comprar su propia casa y tener una familia.

Su préstamo lo necesita para comprar herramientas como una cortadora de pelo, dos espejos, cinco sillas de plástico normales y una gabacha y talvez mas adelante necesite otro préstamo para comprar una silla giratoria y otra cortadora de pelo el esta muy contento y emocionado con su préstamo y espera cumplir su sueño.

loans.use: Buy hair clippers, mirrors, chairs, and an apron

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres últimos hijos de 18,12 y 8 años.
Se dedica a la producción de verduras, sus chacras se encuentran a un costado de su casa y la otra parte de ellas, en las afueras de su comunidad, a donde tiene que  trasladarse todas las mañanas después de  atender a sus hijos y esposo.Esta actividad la viene realizando por más de 20 años, espera seguir dedicándose a ello por mucho más tiempo, ya que le agrada. Cuando sus verduras están listas, las trasporta hacia las ciudades más cercanas, siendo complicado para ella el pago del flete (a los camiones) por el traslado de sus productos.
Nelly lucha por el bienestar de su familia, esto la motiva en poder  trabajar cada día más.
Invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de abonos, con lo que espera mejorar sus productos y con ellos se eleve el costo de estos para sí, y en un futuro cercano poder adquirir su propia movilidad para trasportar sus verduras a las diversas ciudades.
texts.en:
Nelly is 43 years old and lives with her husband and the last three of her children, who are 18, 12 and 8 years old.

She raises vegetables. Her fields are located beside her house and another part of the fields are on the outskirts of her community, where she goes every morning after attending to her children and husband. She has been doing this work for more than 20 years, and hopes to continue for many more because she likes it. When her vegetables are ready, she transports them to nearby cities; what is complicated for her is paying for trucking to transport the products.

Nelly struggles for the well-being of her family, this motivates her to work harder every day.

She will invest the money she is requesting in the purchase of fertilizers, with which she hopes to improve her products and to be able to charge more for them. In the near future she would like to buy her own transportation to take her vegetables to various cities.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers to improve the quality of her vegetables and be able to charge more for them.

loans.name: Ia

texts.en: Ia I., 43, is married with four children. She has 5 years of experience in the bingo/taxi business. She conducts her bingo game 2 days per week, while her taxi works 7 days per week. She has 5 previous loans with SPBD. Ia expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~$208 USD). SPBD loans are Ia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy car parts to repair her taxi and also to purchase bingo materials.

loans.use: Ia would like to purchase bingo materials, taxi tyres and spare parts.

loans.name: Nazih

texts.en: Nazih is a 58 year old man who lives with his wife and their 3 children in Saida, southern Lebanon. Nazih owns a small shop where he sells underwear. He is a very energetic man who works 12 hours per day in order to provide a suitable life situation for his family. He has requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase products for his shop since he wants to diversify his business.

loans.use: To purchase more products for his shop

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Don Julio tiene 34 años, es casado, actualmente  vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, quienes son menores de edad. Es agricultor, ya que su actividad principal es el cultivo de plátanos, lo cual le agrada realizar, ya que es una actividad que realiza desde muy pequeño junto a sus padres. El plátano es un producto muy demandado por la zona y en temporada el precio de la producción es  favorable para  don Julio, sin embargo la producción es  algo costosa, debido a los abonos y mantenimiento de sus terrenos, los cuales  tienen que realizarse quincenalmente, por lo cual  trabaja muy duro para poder cubrir las inversiones y continuar con su producción de plátanos. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Don Julio desea invertir el dinero adquirido en la compra de abonos y mano de obra para poder dar un buen mantenimiento a sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Julio is 34 years old, he is married and he lives with his wife and their three children, all of whom are still minors. He is a farmer primarily harvesting bananas, something he loves todo and it is something he started out doing with his parents as a little boy. Bananas are a product in great demand and when they are in season the income is better for Julio. But production is somewhat expensive due to the fertilizers and maintenance of his fields, which has to be done bi-weekly. He works very hard to cover his investiments and continue with his banana harvests. This is the first loan with MFP (Kiva field partner). Julio wishes to invest the funds in the purchase of fertilizers and labor expenses for the maintenance of his fields.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and to pay for the labor expenses to work the fields.

loans.name: Annie

texts.fr: D. Clanclounon Annie est veuve avec 3 filles, Chimène, 17, Cynthia, 14, and Mireille, 10, tous scolarisées. Elle est née le mi-aout 1967. Il y a 5 ans qu’elle commence son travail avec les verres à boires. Actuellement, elle vend les tissus de vêtements, les habits d’enfants, et les pagnes. Elle est ambulante, et elle achète ses produits au marché des Libanais. Elle utilise ses revenus pour payer les frais de scolarité. Dans le futur, elle veut ouvrir une boutique pour vendre ses vêtements.
texts.en:
Annie Clanclounon D. is a widow with 3 daughters; Chimene 17, Cynthia 14, and Mireille 10, all attending school. She was born mid August, 1967. Five years ago she started a business selling drinking glasses. Now she is selling clothing fabrics, children's cloths and pagnes (decorative cloth). She sells traveling door to door and she buys her products at the Libanais Market. She uses her profits to pay for her children's schooling. In the future, she wold like to open a shop to sell cloths.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cloths for resale

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es: Zenaida tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su propia casa. Desde su niñez aprendió el valor del trabajo, ya que siempre ayudó a sus padres, las habilidades que obtuvo le sirven hoy cuando vende sus productos del campo, es decir, su cosecha, la que vende en los mercados principales de su ciudad, también sabe cómo almacenar sus productos para momentos de escasez. El trabajo duro del campo que ella realiza es más duro en la época de siembra, ahora Zenaida tiene planes de dedicarse al transporte, ya que con largos años de trabajo esforzado, logró adquirir un minibús del que actualmente están pendientes sus tramites de autorización para circulación, con este vehículo podrá obtener ganancias adicionales en el transporte público de pasajeros, a las que tiene con la agricultura, ya que espera incrementar sus ingresos para la educación de sus hijos. Es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, como parte de su banco comunal ella siempre ha promovido la unidad para realizar juntos un trabajo armonioso. La cantidad solicitada será para la compra sacos que le se sirven para empaquetar sus productos cosechados, también costeará el tramite de su póliza de seguro de su movilidad, que en los próximos días estará en circulación, el precio aproximado de este trámite es de 65 soles por asiento, su movilidad tiene capacidad para 20 pasajeros.
texts.en:
Zenaida is 41 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in their own house. Since she was a little girl, she has learned the value of work, always helping her parents. This skill serves her well today when she sells her crop in the main markets of her city. She also knows how to store her products for times of shortage. She works hardest in the field during the time of planting. Now Zenaida plans to focus on the transport of her products. After long years of hard work, she has been able to buy a small bus, which has a pending application of authorization for circulation. With this vehicle she will be able to gain additional profit through the public transportation of passengers along with her crops. She hopes this will increase her income to afford her children's education. This is her fourth time taking a loan with MFP. As part of a communal bank, she has always promoted unity to be able to carry out together a harmonious job. The amount she is requesting will be used to buy sacks that will allow her to pack her harvested crops and to help pay for the application for her vehicle insurance policy, which will be ready in the next few days. The approximate price of this application is 65 soles per seat, and her vehicle has space for 20 passengers.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks for packaging her products and vehicle insurance policy

loans.name: Abia A.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 46 year old Abia C. from Mbeya. She is widowed with 5 children, between the ages of 22 and 30. Abia has been running a retail shop and cosmetics business since 2007. She purchases her products wholesale and resells them retail.

She works at the business for 16 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Abia currently earns about 250USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 300USD in order to expand her business by increasing the quantity and variety of items in bulk. In the future, she plans to start a new business. Abia thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing quantity of items and varieties of items in bulk

loans.name: Uilson Francisco

texts.pt:
Uilson nasceu em gaza tem 35 anos de idade vive maritalmente, estudou ate a 10 classe e pai de 6 filhos com idades comprieendidas entre os 3 aos 23 anos de idade os primeiros 5 vao a escola .

Uilson sai de gaza a namaacha uma vila na fronteira de swazilandia com seus pais devido a guerra, continua com estudos e faz a 10 classe começa a trabalhar com seu pai este que era trabalhador de uma grande plantacao de cereais. Dois anos depois abandona o emprego e faz  plantios na sua propria machamba tem 3 hectares e o seu melhor produto agricola e o pipinno, repolho, eo tomate pois tem muita aceitacao no mercado e bons kilos, tem enfrentado grandes problemas de agua na regiao mas ele consegue superar as dificildades porque Para alem de trabalhar com terra uilson e chefe da localidade e aufere um valor mensal de 4.000.00mt deste modo teve que empregar 2 trabalhadores para tomarem conta dos seus produtos enquanto ele estiver a trabalhar.  Tem tido um valor de 25.000.00mt em cada 3 meses e consegue por mês poupar 5.000.00mt porque para alem da sua familia responsabiliza se pelos seus pais que vivem numa localidade do mesmo distrito emviando lhes um valor de 1.000.00mt e alguns cereais que tem produzido na machamba. 

Este e o segundo emprestimo de uilson na hluvuku e primeiro no kiva. Os 15.000.00mt foram usados para comprar insumos agricolas e pede estes 20.000.00mt para o mesmo fim esta confiante que o seu nivel de producao vai subir e reembolsar sem nenhuma dificuldade.
texts.en:
Uilson was born in Gaza. He is 35 years old and married. He went to school until the 10th grade. He is the father of 6 children with ages between 3 and 23. The youngest 5 go to school. Uilson left Gaza for Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, with his parents due to the war. He continued with his studies and finished the 10th grade when he began working with his father who worked at a large grain plantation. Two years later he abandoned his job and began planting his own farm. He has 3 hectares, and his best agricultural products are cucumbers, cabbage, and tomatoes. He is well accepted at the market. He has encountered big problems with water in the region, but he has been able to overcome the difficulties because besides working the land Uilson is also head of the locality and earns 4,000MT per month. Because of this he has had to hire two employees to take care of his products while he is working. He has earned 25,000MT in each of 3 months and has been able to save 5,000MT per month because besides his family he is also responsible for his parents who live in the same district. He sends them 1,000MT and some grains that he produces on his farm. This is Uilson's second loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. The 15,000MT was used to purchase agricultural supplies, and he is requesting 20,000MT for the same reason. He is confident that his level of production will increase, and he will be able to pay off the loan without difficulty.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz B. is a seaweed farmer. She is 54 years old and has seven children. "I am not contented of just being a wife, stay in a house and wait for your husband to come" she said. "I want to do something else especially earn little income for my children," Luz added.   Her husband, Rodrigo Baaron Jr. manages their seaweed farm.   They grow and sell seaweed in their village.

Luz is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI.   She will use the loan to buy more seedlings for her farm.   The loan will definitely help Luz increase the size of their farm.   She is also thinking of venturing to another line of business to contribute well to their family income.

CEVI supports seaweed farmers to sustain their livelihoods.   They provide their clients with credit assistance, training and insurance coverage to grow their small businesses.

loans.use: Buy seedlings for seaweed farm.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Madame E. a pour activité  la vente de bijoux et de pagnes, un commerce qui est très rentable au Togo car beaucoup de personnes surtout les femmes l’utilisent pour confectionner les habits.  Madame E. a commencé ce commerce en 1998.  Voulant agrandir son stock pour mieux vendre et pour mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, elle sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter des pagnes et des bijoux.  Madame E. habite avec son mari à Awatamé, un quartier de Lomé, la capitale du Togo.
texts.en:
Ms. Abra sells costume jewelry and "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth), a business which is very lucrative in Togo because many people, especially women, use this cloth to make clothing. Ms. Abra began this business in 1998. Wishing to expand her inventory so as to make more sales and better satisfy the demand of her clientele, she is requesting her first loan to buy "pagnes" and jewelry. Ms. Abra lives with her husband in Awatamé, a district of Lomé, the capital of Togo.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of pagnes and costume jewelry for re-sale

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel A. works as a petty trader, selling soft drinks at Bantma near Elmina which he has done since 2003.  He is married with 5 dependents and received an education through Senior High School. While Daniel is employed as a petty trader, his wife works as a hairdresser.  He is responsible for paying school fees and bills. His loan will be used to purchase additional crates of drinks to sell. Daniel hopes to use the new profits from his business to finish building his house.

loans.use: purchase additional crates of drinks for selling

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a widow. She is 50 years old with four children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions in Lagos State, Nigeria. Victoria hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more goods to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions

loans.name: Ankabenkélenkan 2.1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Ankabenkélenkan 2.1 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Fonfona de la ville de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies.
Elles cultivent principalement  du riz et de l’arachide comme  secondaire culture.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  Ankabenkélenkan 2.1 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre premiers prêts, elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter,  des semences de riz, d’arachide et des intrants  au marché de Fonfona, M’pessoba et  Zansoni. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au marché de M’pessoba et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant à une clientèle  composée de revendeurs venant généralement des grandes villes et de consommateurs.
Les membres du groupe Ankabenkélenkan 2.1 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 75 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Ankabenkélenkan 2.1 Group is a group of married women from the village of Fonfona in the main city of Koutiala (in Mali's third administrative region). They have an average age of 40 and six children each and live in large, extended traditional families. Rice is their main crop, with groundnuts their secondary crop. Keen to make a profit from their agriculture business, the members of the Ankabenkélenkan 2.1 group decided five years ago to join Soro Yiriwaso’s loan program. Having fully repaid their first four loans, they are now on their fifth country loan. The current loan will be used to buy rice and groundnut seeds and fertilizer at the markets in Fonfona, M’pessoba and Zansoni. After the harvest season, the crops are placed in storage for a certain period of time to increase in value before being sold at retail (often in bulk) at the market in M’pessoba or surrounding markets for cash to a clientele composed of retailers (mainly from the large towns) or consumers. Once the crops are sold, the members of the Ankabenkélenkan 2.1 group each expect to make a profit of CFA 75,000, which will be used to repay the loan and for current family expenses.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Marn

texts.en:
Marn S., 39, is involved in a business of selling fish at a local market in Battambong Province, and her income is US$ 5 per day. Together she and her husband have three school-aged children. Her husband is unemployed, yet he always helps S. in the business because it is hard work.

S. plans to take a loan of US$ 1000 to expand her inventory of fish to sell for more income since she has repeat customers who are always come to buy her fish. (Her husband is present in the picture with his motorbike used for transporting fish to sell.)

loans.use: buying more fish to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria A. hails from the island village of Buhangin, Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is 46 years old and mother to six. Three of her children are of legal age already and three are still minors who are still studying. Her husband, Maximino, is a carpenter and is 50 years-old.
In 2006, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, full of determination and aspirations to rise above poverty. Her primary business is making of kaing (Big baskets used as storage for various products).  She proposes a loan of 20,000 pesos as additional capital for making kaing. She has regular customers and she also accepts orders.
She is optimistic that with her regular customers and with the orders she receives, she can make a sound and strong business. She also aspires to send her younger children to college and find jobs so they don't experience the same life that she has.

loans.use: Additional capital for making "Kaing" (large baskets used for storage of dry goods and products).

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria J. is a 58-year-old woman from the city of Antipolo, Rizal Province in the Philippines. She is married to Geraldo, who is 60 years old and a jeepney driver. She lives only with her husband; they don’t have children.

Despite of having no child, she is still fighting poverty. She dreams of having a sustainable business that meets their needs and allows them to save for their future, since they are getting old. 

Victoria sells cement. In 2005, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, hoping to access capital for her business. Her previous loans were used as rolling capital business. Now on her 7th loan, she proposes the amount of 20,000 pesos as additional capital for her business. The loan will be used to buy open bags of cement for 9,000 pesos and closed bags of cements for 11,000 pesos. She hopes that the business will bring them good profits.

loans.use: To buy cement to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Mrs. Nenita Y. is 46 years old, married to Mr. Nemuel Y., and blessed with one child. She is united with her husband in their common goal of improving their standard of living.

Mrs. Y. already helped her husband in their buy and sell business, but she wanted to set up her own business to earn more for the family. She joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, to have access to the capital she needed to set up a sari-sari (general) store adjacent to their house. Later, she diversified into fishing. From these business activities, she earns 8,000 PHP per month.

Mrs. Y. is on her twelfth loan cycle and is requesting a loan of 19,500 PHP from NWTF-Project Dungganon. She will use this loan to purchase an additional pump or motorized boat for her fishing business and as additional capital for her sari-sari store.

The picture here shows Mrs. Nenita Y. with her husband, Nemuel, inside her sari-sari store.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: As capital for her sari-sari store and to purchase pump for fishing business

loans.name: Adakou

texts.fr: Cette dame s’est spécialisée dans la vente de pâte fermentée communément appelée « kom » dans le quartier de Kpogan à Lomé. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 1992, ce qui lui permet d’aider financièrement son mari photographe à subvenir aux besoins de leurs 02 enfants. Elle vend le plus souvent sa pâte aux différentes couches de la population. Elle réalise actuellement de très bonnes affaires dans son commerce. Pour disposer d’un stock suffisant pour continuer ses activités, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 17 sacs de maïs et 10 paniers de poissons.
texts.en:
Adakou D. has specialized in the sale of fermented dough commonly called "kom". Her business is located in the Kpogan neighborhood in Lomé. She has been active in this trade since 1992, which allows her to have the financial means to help her husband, who is a photographer, to provide for their two children. She usually sells her dough to a diversified clientele. Currently her business is very profitable. So as to have a sufficient inventory to continue her activity, Adakou applies to WAGES for a loan to buy 17 bags of corn and 10 baskets of fish.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and fish to prepare fermented corn dough

loans.name: Baby Jane

texts.en: 30-year-old Baby Jane R. is starting to see the fruit of her labor. In Agusan Del Sur, where she resides, farming is the main livelihood. Harvest time is quite near for some of the rice she planted. But the remaining rice still needs nurturing to produce a good harvest. Baby Jane joined CEVI for its financial service. She applied for a loan of Php 6,000. The loan will be used to acquire additional farm inputs.

loans.use: Farm inputs

loans.name: Mrs. Boeb Nget Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which consists of nine people is located in Sla village in Takeo province and they all will use the loan in different purposes. Mrs. Boeb N. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members and she is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for living.  In this farming, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive and she will use the rest of the loan to buy pesticides to kill all kinds of insects. She is 38 years old and the widow with three children who are all attending the local school. 

Five members in this village loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Francisco Fredy

texts.es:
El señor Francisco de 48 años  se dedica a la produccion de leche junto con su esposa la señora margarita ellos tienen 10 años de matrimonio, ellos viven en maica central  en una vivienda muy humilde ninguno de los dos pudo terminar  la escuela  son personas trabajadoras que desde las  cuatro de la mañana se dedican a hordeñar  las vacas y despues a cortar alfa para la alimentacion de las mismas. Y al mismo tiempo el señor Francisco se dedica a la construccion (albañil) por mas de 15 años.Apesar que sus ingresos como albañil no son muy buenos alcanza para pagar la alimentacion de la familia.

Ellos tienen cinco hijos pequeños de los cuales 3 van a la escuela de la zona.Ambos el señor Francisco como su esposa trabajan mucho para poderles dar una vida mejor y hacer a que sus hijos tengan una buena educacion. Con el credito solicitado ellos podran comprar una vaca y aumentar su entrega de leche y poder mejorar la casita en la que viven y establecer un mejor nivel de vida para su familia y en especial para sus niños.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco is 48 years old and produces milk together with his wife Sra. Margarita. They have been married for 10 years and they live in Central Maica in a very humble home. Neither of the two could finish school. They are hard-working people. From 4 o´clock in the morning, they milk the cows and afterwards they cut alfalfa for the cow´s food. At the same time, Sr. Francisco also has been in construction (builder) for more than 15 years. Due to the fact that his income as a builder is not very good, they must reach to pay for the family´s food.

They have 5 little children, of whom 3 go to school in the area. Both Sr. Francisco as well as his wife work a lot so that they can give them a better life, and make sure that their children have a good education. With the requested loan, they will be able to buy a cow and increase its milk delivery, so that they can improve the little house that they live in and establish a better level of life for the family and especially for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Aderunke

texts.en: Aderunke sells jewelry and ice blocks from home; she makes more profit from the ice block business. To her great joy, the high season is here. She is happy because her sales will increase. Aderunke has been in her business for a long time. She is 33 years old and married with three children. She has been borrowing from LAPO for the past three years and loans have been the source of capital for her business. She is hoping for a loan of 100,000 naira to purchase more ice blocks and jewelry to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ice blocks and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Flor De Marìa

texts.es: Flor de María es una mujer dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 36 años, es madre de dos hijos menores de edad, Flor de María se dedica a la venta de plátanos, yucas, culantro, papayas, etc en el mercado de la zona. Su esposo se dedica a la comercialización de madera. Ella es  socia  del  Banco  Comunal  “De la Amistad II” desde hace seis años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en gaseosas. En la actualidad  Flor de María necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será utilizado para comprar  verduras al por mayor y posteriormente comercializarlas. La meta de Flor de  María es tener un restaurante y aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Flor de María is a very dynamic woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 36 years old and the mother of two young children. Flor de María sells plantains, yuca, cilantro, papaya, and other vegetables at the local market. Her husband sells wood. She has been a member of the communal bank “De la Amistad II” for six years. The first loan she received was of 300 soles, which she used to buy soft drinks. At this time, Flor de María is requesting a credit of 1000 soles, which will be used to buy wholesale vegetables. Flor de María’s goal is to have a restaurant and to be able to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Singida Group

texts.en:
Mariam Omary, age 32, is single.  She has had a clothes, bag, and sarong and fabrics business for one year now.  She works daily from 10 am until 12 pm. She is able to make a monthly profit of around $483.

This will be Mariam’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She hopes for a loan from Tujijenge to increase her capital.
	
Mariam will share this loan with her loan group,  Singida, which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Mariam is 2nd from the left, front row.

loans.use: To increase the capital for her fabrics business

loans.name: Anushavan

texts.en: Anushavan D. was born in 1956. He lives in Yerevan with his elderly mother. He graduated from Medical Technicians’ College in St. Petersburg, and then returned to his native land and started to work at the Armenian Medical Technicians’ central administrative board. Since 1998 Anushavan has run his own business.  He has a shop where he sells eyeglasses, frames, and lenses, and also checks his clients’ vision and helps them to choose appropriate eyeglasses or lenses. Anushavan needs a loan of 950,000 AMD to rent a second shop and thus to increase his business.

loans.use: to rent a second shop

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is a 36-year-old woman who is married with one child who is currently in school. She lives with her family at Effiduase in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Abena is a food vendor, she serves rice and stew in the community where she lives. Abena as she is known by many in the town has been in food production for fifteen years now. She sells at a strategic location in the community but she has low a working capital to utilize that advantage and opportunity. She works all day but still she is unable to achieve more to increase her output.

Abena wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of meat and bags of rice so as to produce in larger quantities and increase her efficiency. She believes this will help expand her operations to raise more income to support her husband in providing support for her child’s education.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat, firewood etc.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Néstor, de 45 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y solidario, vive en la casa de uno de sus familiares y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida.
El negocio al que se dedica es la venta de ropa de forma ambulatoria. Todos los días recorre las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca en bU. de clientes que deseen comprar las prendas que vende. La ropa la trae de la ciudad de Tacna (límite con Chile), es por eso que los modelos que vende son muy novedosos y llamativos.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre las prendas que están de moda, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día.
Para más adelante, espera tener el dinero suficiente para implementar una tienda, donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad.

Este es el primer préstamo de Néstor con MFP y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro para pagar a tiempo sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es muy querido, ya que siempre le pone mucha a alegría a las reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ropa para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de dónde escoger.
texts.en:
Nestor is 45 years old. He is a very hard working and supportive. He lives in a relative's house and is willing to work very hard to improve his quality of life. His business is selling clothes as a street vendor. Every day he walks the streets of the city of Juliaca seeking clients who wish to buy the clothes he sells. He brings the clothes from the city of Tacna (on the Chilean border). This is why the styles he sells are new and eye-catching. What he likes the most about his job is giving advice to his clients about the clothing that's in style. He has been engaged in this activity for 4 years and thinks that the hardest thing is having to walk all day long. In the future, he hopes to have anough money to have a store where he can sell more easily. This is the first loan that Nestor has had with MFP and he is willing to work very hard to make his payments on time. He is much loved in his communal bank because he always brings a lot of joy to the meetings. With the thousand nuevos soles he is asking for he will buy more clothes to be able to offer his clients a wider variety to choose from.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Mrs. Savy Mai Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Savy M. is the village-bank president who has been selected by the members of a group loan. The village-bank loan consists of 14 people located in Preak Svay village in the Kandal province. They will all use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Savy M. is a housewife and her husband, Mr. Phy Than, is an electrician who owns a small business in the local village. This famiL. doesn't earn enough income; however, they try to work hard with their business. Thus, Mrs. Savy M. decided to ask for a loan to buy some electric supplies to expand their business. This couple has nine children, two of whom are employed in the garment factory. Two of their other children help them with the electric system, while the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy some electric supplies to expand their business

loans.name: Simona Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Simona Esperanza M. se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, su tramo esta ubicado en el mercado la terminal. 
Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de mochilas, relojes, billeteras, vanidades, shampoo, crema, pinturas de uñas, gorras.

Un hecho relevante de la señora Simona es que además de vender en su tramo ella se desplaza también a vender  en los diferentes buses de la localidad
texts.en:
Simona sells cosmetics in the terminal Marketplace. She is asking for this loan in order to buy bags, watches, wallets, vanity items, shampoo, creams, nail polish, and hats. Simona not only sells in the marketplace, but also on the different buses in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cosmetics and vanity items for resale

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Con el dinero que solicita obtendrá insumos e ingredientes para la elaboración de sus platillos y por ende atender la demanda de sus comensales.

La actividad que realiza es el tejido a crochet de adornos para chompas, por los que le pagan entre 2 y 3 soles cada uno, estas chompas son exportadas a otros países.
Ella es una persona muy amable y trabajadora, hace 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad, a la cual le tomó mucho cariño, pues le brinda las ganancias económicas para solventar los gastos de su hogar. Para el futuro quiere asociarse con su nuera para tejer sus propias chompas y agregarles los adornos que hace a crochet, así tendrían la posibilidad de exportar sus prendas y ganar mayor cantidad de dinero, pero por el momento están ahorrando el capital suficiente para poner en marcha ese negocio.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que se siente muy comprometido de seguir apostando por invertir en su negocio, ya que le permite mejorar su calidad de vida. Con el dinero que ahora solicita adquirirá lanas diversas y las telas que necesita como soporte de su tejido a crochet. Su idea es ir comprando lanas para implementar su futuro taller de chompas.
texts.en:
Alejandra crochets adornments for jumpers, and is paid between 2 - 3 soles for each adornment. These jumpers are exported to other countries. Alejandra is a very friendly and hard-working person. For 20 years she has worked at this activity, and takes great care doing it, as it gives her the economic earnings to meet her household costs. In the future she wants to start business with her daughter-in-law, to knit their own jumpers and add the adornments to them. In this way they will have the possibility to export their wares and earn better money, but for the moment they are saving sufficient capital to get the business going. This is Alejandra's third loan with MFP, and she feels very excited about continiung to invest in her business, as it gives her a better quality of life. With the money she is seeking she will acquire diverse wool and the threads she needs to crochet. Her idea is to buy wool to implement her future jumper workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool and threads

loans.name: María Lorenza

texts.en:
María Lorenza is part of the Los Diamantes communal bank. This bank, whose name means “The Diamonds” in English, consists of 32 members all hailing from the Cuzco area. María Lorenza is a 49-year-old mother of three who is separated from her spouse. She lives in the city of Cuzco. Two of her children are currently studying in local universities.

María Lorenza makes a living selling food from a small kiosk on the street. Here she sells soups and other lunch items. On Sundays, she also engages in the buying and selling of grains. María Lorenza says that she will use her Kiva loan for two things: to help grow her small business and to pay for her children’s studies. 

María Lorenza is appreciative and thankful for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To grow her business and pay for school tuition

loans.name: Viora

texts.en:
Viora is a 32-year-old married lady with one school-age child.  She sells handbags, cloth fabric, dresses and ladies shoes to earn a living. She was previously employed in a hotel.  She has been in this business for two years.  She also does farming so as to meet her family’s needs financially.  

She is a member of the Diamond Women group where all the members are women who have a common goal which is to succeed in business.  Being a member of this group, she can easily access loans from Faulu Kenya.  She has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to add to her stock of shoes, dresses and handbags.  She sees herself diversifying into the real estate business in the future.

loans.use: To add to her stock of shoes, cloth fabric, dresses and handbags

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa trajeamos en quechua.
Gladys es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Gladys junto a su esposo tienen un restaurante en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de 4 personas.
Gladys necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de víveres.
Gladys sueña con terminar de construir su casa, comprar un carro para realizar transporte urbano.
texts.en:
Glays is a member of the LLamkasum Communal Bank, which means “We clothe” in Quechua. Gladys is 36, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Gladys, together with her husband, has a restaurant in a rented location. They work at the restaurant everyday with the help of four other people. Gladys needs a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy supplies. Gladys dreams of finishing the construction on her house and buying a car for urban transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Rom T. is 47 years old and is the village bank president selected by 17 members, located in Koh Krabei village in Kandal province. Each member of this village loan will use it to support their different purpose. Mrs. Rom T. is a fruit seller while her husband can earn a small income by motorbike taxi driving to support his family's living. In order to support the fruit business, Mrs. Rom T. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruits to resell. This couple has three children who all are students and who also support their mother business.

loans.use: To buy more fruits

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita A. is from the village of Opol, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old and married with 3 adult children. Emerita owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, to the local community. Emerita has been involved in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 36 PHP per month.

In 2009, Emerita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emerita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, which she used to to purchase additional products to sell. Emerita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which she will invest in expanding the business. This loan will be Emerita's 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to poor households in Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 61-year old married man living with his wife and four children in Lebanon. He has been working as a taxi driver for 37 years.
He is now hoping to borrow $1,500 in order to perform the seasonA. maintenance for his taxi.

loans.use: to perform the seasonal maintenance for his taxi

loans.name: Iverisa

texts.en:
Iverisa V. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 25 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Iverisa owns and operates a business raising chickens for sale in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2010, Iverisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. Iverisa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Chhun S., 22, is married, with one young child living at home. They live in the Takeo province. Chhun is a professional tailor and also has a small grocery store, typically making US$3 each day. Her husband is a goldsmith. Her husband, Ly Sokphalla, typically makes about US$4 each day. Chhun S. would like a loan of US$1200 to invest in a new business. She will purchase clothes from wholesalers and resell them at her local market.

loans.use: To buy supplies of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lucina

texts.es: Lucina R. D. V. 55 años D. edad, resiD. en Municipio D. Cara Sucia, departamento D. Ahuachapán, vive junto a su esposo D. 64 años D. edad, una hija y su pequeña nieta a la cual cuida durante el día. Lucina posee una venta D. productos plásticos como: depósitos para guardar agua, comida, salsas, pimienta y azúcar, depósitos para basura, platos, cucharas, tenedores y otros artículos más, los cuales son muy utilices en las cocinas y en el hogar en general, su negocio se encuentra ubicado sobre la calle principal D. Cara Sucia en donD. posee ya muchos años D. trabajar D. esta manera, por lo que es muy conocida en el lugar, así mismo Lucina es una señora muy respetada, la cual goza D. muy buenas referencias personas, debido a que es muy trabajadora, quien siempre ha deseado darle todo lo mejor a su familia. Lucina solicita un préstamo por medio del cual, pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos plásticos, ya que estos por ser tan necesarios en el hogar cuentan con muy buena demanda, así mismo desea poder solventar otros gastos personales y D. esta forma poder dedicarse mejor a su negocio invirtiendo todo lo que pueda en el, y así obtener lo mejor D. su trabajo.
texts.en:
Lucina R. D. V., age 55, lives in the Cara Sucia municipality in the Ahuachapán department. She lives with her 64 year old husband, her daughter, and her small granddaughter; who she takes care of during the day. Lucina sells plastic products like containers for water, food, salsa, pepper, and sugar. She also sells containers for trash, plates, spoons, forks, and other items. They are very useful in the kitchen and in the home. Her business is located on the main street in Cara Sucia, and she has worked this way for many years. That is why she is well known in the area. Also, Lucina is a much respected women who enjoys a good reputation. This is due to the fact that she is a very hard-worker who has always wanted to give all of the best to her family. Lucina is requesting a loan to be able to buy a larger quantity of plastic products. There is a very good demand because these products are so necessary in the home. She also wants to be able to pay for some personal expenses. That way she will be able to better devote herself to her business by investing in it as much as she can. That way she will get the best from her work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plastic products

loans.name: Victor Gerardo

texts.es:
Victor es un padre de familia de 61 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a uno de sus hijos en el caserío Las Mónicas, una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande,  zona productora de frutas para exportación que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, situada a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde que era joven, posee un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar frutas como mango y limón. El cosecha el limón semanalmente y mango una vez por año, las frutas que procesa las vende a las diversas plantas procesadoras que se encuentran en la zona. Con los ingresos que le brinda este negocio el se encarga de solventar los gastos económicos de su familia por lo que siempre trata de dar lo mejor de si para mantener sus cultivos.

Actualmente el desea adquirir algunos fertilizantes que le permitan brindar mantenimiento a sus cultivos, de modo que se pueda asegurar una buena producción, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles  que le ayude a lograr su objetivo.

Victor es un padre que siempre ha velado por el desarrollo y bienestar de los suyos, gracias a su esfuerzo la mayoría de sus hijos se ha independizado y ya son personas de bien. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran alguien honesto y de confianza.
texts.en:
Victor is a family man who is 61 years old and lives with his wife and one of their children in the village of Las Mónicas, a rural area in the agricultural district of Tambogrande. This is a region that produces fruit for export, locating in the Piura province, in the region of the same name, located over three hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. Victor has worked as in agriculture since he was very young. He has a plot of land where he usually plants fruit such as mango and lemons. He harvests lemons weekly and mango once per year. He sells his fruit to a variety of processing plants located in the area. He uses the income form his business to cover his family's expenses, so he always tries to gives his best effort when caring for his crops. He would now like to purchase fertilizers to care for his crops, so that he can ensure a strong production. For this reason he has come to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to request a credit of 1000 new soles which will help him achieve his goal. . Victor is a father who has always focused on the development and wellbeing of his children. Thanks to his efforts, most of his children are living independently and are successful. In the area where he lives, his neighbors and acquaintances consider him to be an honest and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer to care for mango and lemon crops.

loans.name: Chynar's Group

texts.en: Chynar Z. is the leader of this group. She is fifty-two and a widow. She has three children: her sons are thirty and twenty-three while her daughter is twenty-eight. Her elder son and daughter work in another town and her youngest son is at home. Chynar breeds livestock. She started to breed livestock three years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 soms upon the suggestion of her relatives. She earns 3,000 soms each month which enabled her to make capital repairs to her house and to increase the number of her livestock. Chynar is applying for a loan in order to purchase two farm animals for breeding. In the future, she is planning to increase the number of her livestock and to celebrate her son's wedding. The other group members are: Batma D. is the treasurer of the group. She is fifty and is married with three children: her twin daughters are sixteen and her son is fourteen. All of them got to school. Her husband is director at the local administration and his monthly income is 5,000 soms. Batma breeds cattle. She started cattle breeding three years ago with initial investment of 10,000 soms upon the suggestion of her neighbor. Now, she earns 3,000 soms monthly. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase cattle for breeding. In the future, she is planning to make capital repairs to her house. Bumairam M. is fifty-eight and is a widow. She has four children: her sons are thirty-four, thirty-two and twenty-five and her daughter is twenty-nine. Her elder son and daughter work in Russia, while her other two sons are married and live with Bumairam. Bumairam breeds cattle with the help of her sons. She has been ten years in the cattle-breeding business that she started with an initial investment of 8,000 soms. Her monthly income from cattle breeding is 3,000 soms. She is planning to purchase additional cattle and is therefore applying for a loan. In the future, she is planning to see her youngest son married. Shaarbu M. is fifty-eight and married with five children: her daughters are thirty, twenty-five and nineteen, and her sons are twenty-nine and twenty-eight years old. Her husband is a builder with an income of 5,000 soms. Shaarbu breeds cattle with the help of her husband. She started cattle breeding thirty years ago with an initial investment of 1,000 soms and her monthly income from cattle breeding is 3,000 soms. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase cattle for breeding. It will enable her to expand her business through increase in the turnover. In the future, she is planning to continue to reinvest her profits in the business. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase two farm animals for breeding

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley T. is from the village of Central Poblacion, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old. Shirley is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Shirley owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling rice grains in the local community. Shirley has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Shirley joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shirley has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional rice to sell. Shirley is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Shirley from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: Olivia M. D. M. D. 40 años D. edad, resiD. en San Juan Opico, departamento D. La Libertad. Ella vive junto a sus dos hijos D. 18 y 20 años D. edad, quienes estudian y le ayudan con los quehaceres del hogar a Olivia. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos D. primera necesidad tanto alimenticios como para el hogar, Olivia es una señora muy alegre y amable, quien debe esforzarse mucho por salir adelante y poder contar con todo lo necesario para tener una vida digna. DesD. hace 12 años que ella posee la tienda en su casa D. habitación, por lo que es muy conocida en la zona y a pesar D. que tiene mucha competencia en los alrededores, siempre es preferida por las personas del lugar, ya que es D. mucha confianza en toda la zona. Olivia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar todo lo necesario para surtir más su negocio, comprando granos básicos, detergentes, desinfectantes, pan, leche, huevos, productos lácteos y todo lo que es más necesario y que sus clientes solicitan más en la tienda, así mismo Olivia desea poder incluir productos nuevos, los cuales a pesar que tienen poco tiempo D. estar en el mercado poseen una gran demanda como golosinas y bebidas, las cuales le asegurarían aumentar sus ventas, lo cual es la prioridad principal D. ella, ya que D. esta manera podrá contar con una mejor estabilidad en su hogar.
texts.en: Olivia M. D. M. is 40 years old and lives in San Juan Opico, La Libertad department. She lives together with her two children who are aged 18 and 20 years. They study and help Olivia with the household chores. She has a shop selling basic necessities such as everyday food items. Olivia is a very happy and amiable person who works hard to get ahead and to be able to live a decent life. She has run the shop from her home for 12 years and she is well known in her local area. Despite a high level of competition, she is always people’s preferred place to go to as everyone is confident in her. Olivia is asking for a loan so that she can buy the necessary stock for her business: grains, detergents, disinfectants, bread, milk, eggs, dairy products and all of the things that her customers come into her shop asking for. Also Olivia wants to be able to introduce new products for which there is high demand, such as sweets and drinks, which will be sure to increase her sales. This is her main priority as she will then be able to have a more stable home life.

loans.use: To buy food and household stock for her shop

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida N. is from the village of Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 60 years old. Zenaida is widowed and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $875 per harvest.

In 2008, Zenaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services needed to increase crop yield. This will be her 5th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Jobertiz Leonidas

texts.es:
En la parroquia Ayacucho del  cantón Santa Ana se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Amigas Por Siempre. Este lugar es conocido por su gran vegetación pero sobre todo por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por turistas locales y de otras ciudades.

Para el señor Jobertiz este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y está muy contento porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho en su negocio y por lo fácil que es conseguir los créditos. El tiene 36 años de edad, está casado y tiene tres niñas de 12- 10 y 8 años las mismas que estudian en escuela y la mayor en primer año de colegio. Su esposa es ama de casa.

Tiene una granja donde cría pollos. Trabaja todos los días en el cuidado y alimentación de los mismos ya que requieren de muchos cuidados, los compra en la agencia de Agripac en Santa Ana, los mantiene por espacio de dos a tres meses luego los lleva  a entregar en asaderos de pollos de la localidad y también vende por libras a sus clientes, entrega además a ciertas tiendas del lugar o de Santa Ana.

Este crédito es para comprar más pollos ya que se avecina la época de Navidad y Año Nuevo y las personas en estos días compran bastante de estos productos y se ponen a buen precio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijas y porque no tener un negocio  más grande
texts.en:
In the Ayacucho district, within the county of Santa Ana, the Amigas por Siempre (“Friends Forever”) cooperative bank meets every fifteen days.  This area is known for its grand vegetation, but most of all, for beautiful fresh water spas that are frequented by local and foreign tourists.

This is Jobertiz’s second cycle with the cooperative bank.  He is very content because the loans, and the way the credit is facilitated, have helped him a great deal with his business.  He is 36 years old, married, and has three daughters aged 12, 10, and 8 who are in school.  His wife is a homemaker.

He has a farm where he raises chickens.  He works every day feeding and tending to them, as they require great care.  He buys them at the Agripac agency in Santa Ana.  He keeps them for a period of two to three months, subsequently delivering them to the chicken roasters in the area.  He also sells poultry by the pound to customers and to certain stores in the area or in Santa Ana.

This loan is for the purchase of more chickens, as Christmas and New Year’s are approaching and people buy a great deal of his product during the season at good prices.  His dreams are to give his daughters all the best, and to have a bigger business.

loans.use: To purchase chickens.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn E. is 28-years old, married, and supports her family by operating a general store business. A resident of Brgy. Tuguis, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental and a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006, she has been improving her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, Ailyn is gradually making her family more economically stable and now earns an average income of PHP 6,000.

Ailyn is now borrowing PHP 19,500, her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, in order to purchase more store stock to sell. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ailyn aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a community member who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of goods to sell to customers

loans.name: Yawavi Nicole

texts.fr: Nicole a 35 ans et est mariée. Elle a 2 enfants en charge.  Pour participer au foyer, elle fait la vente de produits de beauté. Avec son activité, elle a remboursé plusieurs  prêts déjà. Elle s’approvisionne en Europe et au grand marché de Lomé et revend ensuite au marché de  Hédzranawoe. Elle compte 3 ans dans cette activité. Elle sollicite au près de WAGES un crédit   pour accroitre son commerce.
texts.en: Nicole is 35 years old and is married. She takes care of two children.  To help meet family expenses, she sells beauty products.  Through her work, she has already repaid several loans.  She gets her supplies in Europe and at the main market in Lomé and then resells them at the market in Hédzranawoe.  She has been in this business for three years.  She is requesting a loan from WAGES to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Isidra Engracia

texts.es: Isidra se dedica a la actividad del destace de cerdo. Ella es una persona muy responsable, inicio hace 19 años, que tiene a cargo este negocio. Ella ha demostrado que puede sacar adelante su negocio.  La venta la desarrolla en su casa de habitación, la compra de los cerdos la hace en la comarca aledaña, los cuales son compras de contado y al crédito. Ella solicita este crédito con el fin de invertir en la compra de cerdo. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda, con las ganancias que obtenga.
texts.en: Isidra's business is slaughtering pigs.  She is a very responsible person who started in this business 19 years ago.  She has shown that she can get ahead in her business.  She makes her sales from her home.  She buys her pigs in a neighboring district and she buys them for cash or takes them on credit.  She is requesting a loan to invest in buying pigs.  She dreams of improving her home with the profits that she makes.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 50 años, es una madre amorosa y muy laboriosa, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Desde hace 30 años se ha dedicado a la venta de lozas, lencerías y ropa en general, de acuerdo a la temporada climática, trata de  incrementar y diversificar sus productos. Es así que siempre esta en constante actividad, comprando y vendiendo, en su puesto informal de ventas, que constantemente la reubican, por no tener un puesto fijo. Su hija mayor le ayuda en esta labor y las veces que no pueden, dejan de trabajar,  y se van de compras sin mayor apuro y con mayor tranquilidad. Es así, con el pasar del tiempo, conoce sus puntos de ventas, en donde encuentra precios muy  módicos. Por ello, es que vende a precios más asequibles; por lo que cuenta con más clientes. Para María le es importante continuar en su negocio y buscar un puesto de ventas, donde realice su negocio  con mayor tranquilidad. Es su 7mo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete nuevamente en ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, considerando éste crédito muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más lencerías y ropas casuales, para la temporada del año nuevo.
texts.en: María, age 50, is a loving and hard-working mother. She lives in her own home with her husband and 4 children. For 30 years she has sold china and general clothing based on the season. She tries to increase and diversify her products. She is constantly working, buying and selling, in her informal sales stall which she is constantly moving, since she does not have a fixed location. Her oldest daughter helps her with this work. When they can't work, they go shopping. With the passing of time, she has become familiar with her sales points. She has very good prices, and so she has more customers. For Maria it is important to continue with her business and get a fixed sales location where she can do her work with more peace of mind. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she promises again to be responsible with the payment of her quotas. She thinks this loan will be very useful in the progress of her business. With the requested loan, she will invest in the purchase of more lingerie and casual clothing for the weather of the new year.

loans.use: to purchase more lingerie and casual clothing to fill her customers' orders.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 32 years old. She is married with two children who are twelve and fourteen years old. All her children attend school along with her other two other dependents. Her husband works as a motor vehicle mechanic. Jacqueline sells spare parts for various types of motor vehicles. She has been in this business for six years. From her business she says that she was able to do a lot of things like building a house and buying a car, and that all these tangible assets resulted from her business. Jacqueline has requested this loan to buy more spare parts to sell. She will use the profits that she expects to gain to reinvest in her business for its growth. She dreams of starting to import spare parts, which might yield preferable prices, in the future.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
Clorinda nació en la ciudad de Ocongate provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margarita Ocongate” de la asociación Arariwa Cusco. Actualmente, Clorinda vive en la ciudad donde nació junto con su esposo y sus hijos. (La ciudad de Ocongate se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad del Cusco). 

Hace 13 años, Clorinda  que se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, ella en su domicilio tiene un galpón donde aproximadamente tiene 300 cuyes, ella vende a S/. 20 nuevos soles cada cuy ya se ha preparado o vivo, ella vende a dueños de restaurantes, vecinos y amigos.  Al lado de su casa, Clorinda tiene varios terrenos de cultivo donde siembra pasto y alfalfa que sirven de alimento para los animales. La pueden encontrar los 7 días de la semana en su domicilio. Clorinda requiere el crédito para comprar semillas y abono.
texts.en:
Clorinda was born in the city of Ocongate, Quispicanchis Province, Cusco Department. She belongs to “Las Margarita Ocongate” (The Ocongate Daisies) communal bank with Arariwa Cusco. Clorinda currently lives in her hometown with her husband and children. (Ocongate is about two hours away from the city of Cusco.)

For 13 years, Clorinda has raised small animals like guinea pigs. She has a shed at home where she has approximately 300 guinea pigs. She sells them for 20 new soles each, either cooked or live. She sells them to restaurant owners, neighbors and friends. On the side of her house, Clorinda has several fields where she grows grass and alfalfa to feed the animals. She can be found at home seven days per week.  Clorinda needs the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Marcial Humberto

texts.es: Marcial tiene 26 años de edad es casado vive en casa propia con su esposa y su menor hijo de 06 años el se inicio como chofer de manera dependiente actualmente cuenta con un vehiculo propio en la cual trabaja de forma independiente el financiamiento otorgado sera destinado para el mantenimiento y mejoramiento de su vehiculo, se le propone el crédito por tener buenas referencias,voluntad y capacidad de pago.
texts.en: Marcial is 26 years old and married.  He lives in his own home with his wife and their minor child, who is 6 years old.  He started out employed as a driver, and now has his own vehicle so he can work independently.  The financing granted will be used to maintain and improve his vehicle.  He was approved for the loan on the basis of having good references and having the willingness and ability to repay the loan.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Evelin Jasmin

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Chicas Fresas, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad y las socias son muy amables y trabajadoras.

La señora Evelin es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la secretaria del mismo y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos. Tiene  28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos  hijos de 10 y tres años de edad, el mayor esta en el último año de escuela. Su esposo es maestro.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, también vende artículos para el hogar a través del sistema de cartillas, esto es por pedidos que le realizan los clientes por anticipado. Trabaja todos los días unas cinco horas al dia, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños y artículos para el hogar. Sus sueños son tener un buen trabajo y tener un bazar en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The “Chicas Fresas” (Uptown Posh Girls) communal bank meets every two weeks in Portoviejo’s San Pablo neighborhood, a crowded, marginal urban zone in the city.  The members are very kind and hard working.

Evelin, 28, is a founding member of the communal bank; she’s its Secretary and likes it because of the ease in obtaining loans.  She’s married and has two children who are 10 and 3 years of age; the oldest is in the last year of elementary school.  Her husband’s a Teacher.

She sells all kinds of clothes door to door.  She also sells items using the “cartillas” system (similar to lay-away; customer signs up for an item and makes small payments toward it until payment is complete and item is handed over) for items that are ordered ahead of time.  She works every day for about five hours daily.  She sells on credit and collects every two weeks.  She goes to Guayaquil every two weeks or once a month depending on need to buy her merchandise.

This loan is to buy pants, shirts, blouses, children’s clothing and articles for the home.  Her dream is to have a good job and a general store downtown.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, blouses, children's clothes and articles for the home.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia B. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 46 years old. Cecilia is married and has five adult children.
