To make a living, Cecilia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, detergents and beverages in the local community. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Cecilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for  working capital. 

Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and biscuits. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Cecilia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and biscuits

loans.name: 25 Trung Hai - Hoang Thanh - Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
To N. T. (303145) is a 34-year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang hoa - Thanh hoa. To is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 25 Trung Hai - Hoang Thanh - Hoang hoa (25 Trung Hai - Hoang Thanh - Hoang hoa).

To is married and has one school-aged child. To making a living, To operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattL. for saL.. To has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from these activities.

In 2004, To joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. To has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by To from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. To plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  V. T. Loan (143) is a 36-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.

2.  L. T. Thanh (17) is a 55-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  T. T. Khoi (36) is a 56-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4.  T. T. Be (97) is a 57-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5.  L. T. Dau (112) is a 53-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


To N. T. (303145) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang hoa - Thanh hoa.  To là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 25 Trung Hai - Hoang Thanh - Hoang hoa (25 Trung Hai - Hoang Thanh - Hoang hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  To thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, To kiếm được khoảng 1,000,000 VND.  Vào 2004, To đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  To đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6,000,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  V. T. Loan (143) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


2.  L. T. Thanh (17) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  T. T. Khoi (36) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  T. T. Be (97) là 57 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  L. T. Dau (112) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a twenty-nine-year-old married man with two children living in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a driver by trade and has been in service for five years. In order to increase his income he started a poultry project from his salary savings and the business is growing despite challenges of high cost of feeds. His dream is to buy a taxi and also expand his project. James needs the loan to buy chicks.

loans.use: To buy chicks for poultry farming.

loans.name: Nasia Custodia

texts.pt:
Nasia Custodia L. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique casada mãe de 2 filhos de 07 e 11 anos idade todos vaõ a Escola. Fez somente 8ª classe não continuou porque teve que cuidar dos filhos que teve antes de terminar com os estudos. Vive na casa propria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Nunca saiu da cidade de Maputo, tem um negocio proprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade  ha mais de 8 anos e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 2.000.00mt a 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e com ajuda do seu marido as vezes consegue poupar uma parte na sua conta bancaria.

Ja teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua amiga que é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (portas, pedra, cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. 

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para concluir a casa.
texts.en:
Nasia Custodia L. was born in the city of Maputo, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She is married and the mother of two children, ages 7 and 11. Both are attending school. She only completed 8th grade and didn't continue with her education because she had to care for the two children who were born before she finished her studies. She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone additional.

She has never left the city of Maputo, where she has had her own business selling basic goods for over 8 years. She has monthly earnings of around 2000 to 3000 meticais, which she uses for household expenses. With the help of her husband, she sometimes manages to save a portion in her bank account.

She has had loans at other banks in the past, and learned of Hluvuku through her friend who is a Hluvuku client. This is her first loan with Hluvuku, and it is for 15,000 meticais. With the loan, she plans to purchase construction materials (doors, stone, cement, sand, and other items) to continue building her house.

She is committed to paying on schedule to be able to obtain future loans. She plans to request new loans to complete the house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (doors, stone, cement, sand, stone, and other items).

loans.name: Xiomara Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Xiomara del Socorro Mendoza, tiene la edad de 59 años, habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, es madre soltera, actualmente tiene una hija a su cargo, los planes hacia su familia es poder cambiar las paredes de tabla que están bastante dañadas por bloques, ya que en tiempos de lluvia  se pasa y es muy incomodo  para ellas estar en medio de agua , doña Xiomara desde hace varios años labora de conserje y la mayor afectación que se le presenta es no poder contar con el apoyo económico para realizar las compra de materiales de construcción de una sola vez , ella se siente contenta por el apoyo y la con fianza que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva para que ella poco a poco realiza su gran sueño de tener su vivienda completamente de bloque y zinc.
texts.en:
Mrs. Xiomara del Socorro Medoza, age 59, lives in the town of Ticuantepe.  She is a single mother and has a daughter in her care.  The plans for her family include changing the damaged wooden boards on the walls for concrete blocks.  During the rainy season water gets in and causes discomfort in the living environment.  

Doña Xiomara has worked as a concierge for several years.  Her biggest challenge is not having enough economic support to buy construction materials at all one time.  She is happy about the support and confidence Afodenic is showing her through Kiva so that, little by little, she can achieve her dream of having a house made completely out of cement blocks and zinc.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has been in the hog-raising business for 10 years. She has a small backyard piggery where she raises pigs. She also owns and manages a sari-sari store, which sells various items like shampoo and soap. Mary plans to use her loan to buy pig feeds and more items to sell such as canned goods and spices.

Mary is 33 years old and is a married woman with 4 children.  Her oldest child is 23 years old. Mary's husband works as a driver. Mary hopes for her children to succeed in life.

loans.use: buy feeds for her pigs and items to sell  in her store

loans.name: Maura Valentina

texts.es:
"La Sra. Maura, tiene como actividad el servicio urbano de pasajeros en su movilidad (minibús), esta actividad la desarrolla conjuntamente con su esposo el Sr. Rudy, quien es el que conduce el mencionado vehicula y la Sra. es quien cobra los pasajes.
El destino del presente crédito es para la reparación del motor de su vehículo esta actividad es la principal fuente de ingreso para su familia que se complementa con sus dos hijos quienes están en edad escolar, es una familia muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, para mejorar su calidad de vida."
texts.en:
Maura’s activity is providing urban passenger transportation service in her minibus.  She carries out this work with her husband, Rudy, who is the vehicle driver.  Maura collects the fares.

The loan will be used to repair the vehicle’s engine.  This activity is the family’s principal source of income.  The family consists of her two children who are school aged.  It is a very hard working family with a strong desire to get ahead to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to repair her minibus.

loans.name: Lucienne

texts.fr: Née en 1975 au Bénin, Lucienne est mariée à Joseph un bijoutier. Le couple a quatre enfants tous à leur charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par Lucienne et son mari. Pour participer efficacement aux devoirs de mère de famille qui est le sien, Lucienne prépare depuis vingt cinq ans, de la bouillie de maïs et de mil qu'elle vend à son domicile au Bénin. Lucienne s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Lucienne sollicite auprès de ALIDé un quatrième prêt. Lucienne avait bien remboursé les crédits reçus antérieurement.
texts.en:
Born in 1975 in Bénin, Lucienne is married to Joseph, who is a jeweler. The couple are raising four children. Some of the children are enrolled in school. The couple live together with their children and share in covering the household expenses. 

For 25 years, in order to fulfill her duties of wife and mother efficiently, Lucienne has been preparing maize and millet porridge and selling it at her home in  Bénin. Lucienne buys her supplies in one of the markets of Bénin. Wishing to expand her business and better respond to the needs of her clientele, Lucienne is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. She correctly reimbursed the prior loans.

loans.use: to buy maize, millet, and sugar.

loans.name: Shirley Margoth

texts.es:
Shirley Margoth tiene 30 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los dos hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos..

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA, se encuentra ubicada en el en el Recinto La primavera, perteneciente al Canton Ventans, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Shirley se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz  y frejol. Compra sus productos en Comercial Peña y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es terminar de construir la casa.

Le gusta escuchar musica.
texts.en:
Shirley Margoth is 30 years old.  She is married, and she lives with her husband and their two children in the Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.

The members of the “Luchando Por Una Misma Causa” (Fighting for the Same Cause) Communal Bank are in the La Primavera neighborhood in the Ventanas canton.  This communal bank devotes itself to growing short cycle corn and rice.

Shirley grows corn, rice, and beans.  She buys her products at Comercial Peña, and she sells at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

She is requesting the loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support from the loan will help meet her needs.

Her dream is to finish building her house.

She likes to listen to music.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa tiene 39 años de edad, convive con Melitón de 40 años y fruto de esa relación concibieron 02 hijos Omar de 15 años y Devi de 13 años de edad,  juntos viven en su propia casa donde predomina la armonía. Ruth es docente de nivel primaria y cada día se esmera por entregar algo nuevo a sus alumnos, es así que labora en el centro educativo de Santa Rosa. Ella es una profesora muy querida por sus alumnos y padres de familia. Ruth se entrega por completo a su trabajo por que gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano pudo construir su casa a base de concreto armado a la vez compró su chacra donde los días no laborables acude ahí para brindarles todo su cuidado. Le gusta su trabajo como docente y estar pendiente de sus alumnos, quienes la agradecen por su paciencia y trato hacia ellos. Con el crédito solicitado comprará mayólicas para mejorar los pisos de su habitación. Para su futuro promisorio espera ser contratada nuevamente por el Gobierno Peruano ya que depende de ello  de seguir prestando sus servicios como profesora. Este será su noveno crédito con MFP y por tanto espera el apoyo de ustedes para mejorar el ambiente de su casa. En su banco comunal es una socia muy cooperadora.
Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar mayólicas para enchapar los pisos de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ruth is a native of the city of Santa Rosa.  She is 39 years old and lives with Melitón, aged 40, and their two children who are the fruit of their relationship.  Omar is 15 years old and Devi is 13.  They live together in their own home, where harmony prevails. 

Ruth is a primary school teacher and strives everyday to give something back to her students.  She works in the educational center of Santa Rosa.  She is a teacher who is much loved by students and parents.  Ruth gives herself completely to her work, and thanks to her daily efforts, they have been able to build their house on a base of reinforced concrete.  At the same time, she bought her farm; this is where she goes on days she's not working, so as to give the farm every care.  She likes her job as a teacher and keeps an eye out for her students; they are grateful to her for her patience and treatment of them.  

With the requested loan, she will buy tiles to improve the floors of her accommodation.  Her future looks promising, she hopes to be hired again by the Peruvian government since she depends on that to continue providing her services as a teacher. 

This will be her ninth loan through MFP, and therefore she hopes for your support to improve her home environment. She is a very cooperative member of her community bank.

With the support of the loan, she will be able to buy tiles to cover the floors of her home.

loans.use: to buy tiles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair treatments, creams, perfumes, and nutritional products.

loans.name: Gracelinda

texts.en:
Gracelinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling coconuts in the Philippines.

Gracelinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more coconuts to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Gracelinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Chhoeut

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhoeut, age 41, is a humble woman who presently lives in Siem Reap Province. She is married with four single children, two of them are employed in different jobs and the other two are students.

To earn a daily profit, Mrs. Chhoeut rents a few rooms to provide a karaoke service to people who need to sing a song with their family and friends. From this business, she gets a net income, on average, of 5 USD a day. She also has other income from her husband’s work as a fisherman. Mrs. Chhoeut would like to borrow a loan fund from Kiva through HKL in order to change rooms which are bigger than present time and she will use some of loan amount to buy some goods to sell for additional profits.

In the future plan, Mrs. Chhoeut hopes to use her income to expand her current business, to extend her house, and to send her children to study at university.

loans.use: to change rooms for running a karaoke service and to buy some goods to sell for additional profits

loans.name: Sunaati

texts.en:
Sunaatiis a 25 years old, single and lives in Narok, Kenya. He is a mixed farmer, which means he is involved in livestock rearing as well as livestock trading. He's been doing these activities since past two years. 

He came to know about KADET through one of its registered clients. This is his first loan that he plans to use for preparing land for farming and buying farm inputs. He hopes to make a profit that he can re-invest in other business. He is a sincere and hardworking man who can do more if helped.

loans.use: to prepare land for farming and buying farm inputs

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman with one child who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past two years, she has operated a beauty salon business, operating in a shop whereby the local residents are her potential customers. She faces the major challenge of price fluctuation in the area. Her major challenge is to establish a bigger beauty salon business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase weave braids, chemicals and washing shampoo. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase weave braids, chemicals and washing shampoo.

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
Genie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years now.

Genie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ingredients for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save money to buy more cooking utensils.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 63 years old and lives in Ciriaco, Pastrano, Oroquieta City. She is married and has 6 children.
 
Rosalina has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 1,200 each month. She has a requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business.

Rosalina has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es: A sus 64 años de edad Amparo es una mujer emprendedora que trabaja con gran esmero para salir adelante, desde las 8:00 a.m. hasta las 6:00 p.m. se dedica a la venta ambulante de jugos naturales, sueña con ver progresar su negocio para tener una vejez más tranquila, por lo que hoy en día solicita un préstamo para invertir en inventario, con éste comprará algunas frutas y pulpas de frutas para fortalecer el surtido, mejorar las ventas e incrementar sus ingresos, pues hoy en día está pasando por una difícil situación económica, lo que la motiva invertir para obtener mas ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su esposo.
texts.en: At the age of 64, Amparo is an enterprising woman who works with dedication from 8am until 6pm in order to get ahead.  She is a street vendor of natural fruit juice.  She dreams with seeing her business prosper in order to have a more peaceful old age.  To do so, she is at present asking for a loan to invest in inventory.  She will buy some fruit and fruit pulp to strengthen her stock, improve sales and increase income because she’s going through a difficult economic situation at present and this motivates her to obtain higher profits and to improve her and her husband’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruit and fruit pulp.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has practiced horticultural farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past year.  He is 51 years old, married to Wanjiru and they have four school going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of its existing clients and this will be his second loan.  He paid off his previous loan well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan to buy farm inputs as well as for labor purposes.

In the future, James hopes to expand his horticulture business and make more profits and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs as well as for labor purposes.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les  quatre membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont s essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles monogames à HAMDALLAYE  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur douzième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame FATOUMATA en deuxième position à partir de la droite fait le commerce de condiments.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt environ 10 kg de beurre de karité, 5 paniers de tomates, 3 cartons de cube maggies auprès des grossistes, qu’elle revendra en détail au grand marché de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Sabougnouma group are for the most part married women, on average 31 years old with four children. They live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, a neighborhood in the city of Sikasso.

They are on their twelfth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, seeking to meet the needs of their customers.

Mrs. Fatoumata (second from the right) trades in condiments.

She intends to use her loan to buy about 10 kg of shea butter, 5 baskets of tomatoes, three boxes of Maggi cubes from wholesalers, to be resold retail at  the Sikasso great market and also from her home, to mainly women customers, for cash and sometimes credit.

She expects average monthly profits to attain 35,000 FCFA, part of which will be used to repay the loan and its interests, and the remainder put into savings.

loans.use: Buy condiments

loans.name: Imani Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Imani Group in Western Kenya! Jeridah is the facilitator of the group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Jeridah takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Jeridah had a good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jeridah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Jeridah will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in business. In 2012, the members of Imani group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Fredeswinda

texts.en:
Fredeswinda is 64 years old and a widow with nine children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Fredeswinda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Fredeswinda has been raising pigs for 30 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dreams: to build and expand her business and to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 38-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His current business is motorcycle transport, which he started six years back. Alongside his motorcycle business, he has a retail shop; this has enabled him to pay school fees for his children. His business dream is to own a wholesale shop selling a variety of merchandise. Joseph needs the loan to buy sugar and soap to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 33 years old, married, and has five children. She also has three additional dependents, who live with her--her brothers and sisters whom she assists with their schooling. 

In 2009, Leticia established her clothing business. She began her business to be self-reliant. She sells to women, especially young women. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,800,000 every month from this business. 

Leticia is requesting a loan for Le 4,000,000, which she will use to buy ladies' jeans, t-shirts, shoes, sneakers, and blouses for her business. Leticia has already received and successfully repaid two loans, She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000.  In the future, Leticia plans to expand her business to a location in the nearby market.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' blouses, jeans, t-shirts, shoes, and sneakers.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
Suong is a 50-year-old divorced woman with a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Suong has been running a food stall for nearly twenty-one years. She sells mainly rice to people in the local community. She would like a 15,000,000 VND loan from CEP to buy a greater quantity and variety of food to meet her customers' demands.

Through this loan Suong hopes she can earn more money and save it for reinvestment in her business.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of food.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like shampoo, noodles, sardines and other groceries.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming sugarcane.

Alicia dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shampoo, noodles, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores has always the enthusiasm of farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur and has yield good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Dolores knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. In the future, Dolores hopes to buy hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: María Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a single mother, with a beautiful daughter to care for; she decided to start her own business because her little girl is all she has, and she wants to offer her a good education and a better quality of life. Alejandra knows that the only way to offer this to her daughter is by working very hard. This is why she requires your support and generosity today.

Alejandra needs a loan of $250 USD to purchase materials for her beauty salon such as cosmetics and hair tints; she says that these are the most requested services by her clients. She plans to return the loan within a period of 3-6 months.

**

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandra es una madre soltera, con una hermosa hija a su cuidado, ella decidió emprender su propio negocio porque su pequeña es lo único que tiene y quiere ofrecerle una buena educación y una mejor calidad D. vida. Alejandra sabe que la única manera D. ofrecer a su hija todo esto, es trabajando muy duro, por lo que hoy requiere D. tu apoyo y generosidad.

Alejandra necesita D. $250 USD para comprar material para su estética como un estuche para maquillaje y tintes para el cabello, ya que comenta que son uno D. los servicios más demandados por sus clientes. En un término D. 3-6 meses ella planea regresar el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase material for her beauty salon

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Martha Imelda

texts.en:
I have more than 16 years of experience in new and used clothing and shoe sales. It is the income I use to get ahead in life. My mother and I run the business. We are asking for a loan to buy merchandise and make some improvements to the store because when it rains and gets cold, we don't have a way to cover the merchanside. This way we will have a better store.

Translated from Spanish by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 16 años en el negocio de venta de ropa y calzado nuevo y usado. Es el ingreso que tengo para salir adelante. Mi mamá y yo somos las encargadas del negocio. Estamos solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercancía y reparar el local ya que cuando llueve y en tiempo de frió no tenemos como cubrí la mercancía y así tener un mejor local.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and repair store.

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.en:
Juana Antonia has been selling beautiful woven fabrics on the street for about six months. She weaves some of the smaller items herself and buys the larger items for resale. She goes on the bus every day to the nearby city of Quetzaltenango and spends all day selling. Juana's husband left her about ten years ago with three children. She has succeeded in getting at least some schooling for all, but the eldest (now 17) had to drop out after sixth grade because they just couldn't afford the school expenses. The other two, 12 and 14, are still continuing on in school.
Juana can make a profit of about US$3.30 each day with her full day's effort, but she battles on, because it's the way to fulfill her dream of a successful education and life for the children. As with most salespeople, Juana will invest this loan in inventory.
Written Kiva Fellows:  Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay

loans.use: Purchase more yarn for weaving and more fabric for sale

loans.name: Sevil

texts.ru:
Sevil Q. was born in 1955. She lives in Aksu. She is married and has 2 children. She sells clothing on the central market. In 2005, Sevil took her first Normicro credit. This is her third loan application. Sevil plans to use the money to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Курбанова Севиль.Родилась 1955 году.Проживает в городе Аксу. Семейная, имеет двоих детей. В центральном рынке торгует одеждами. 2005 году она взяла первый кредит из Нормикро Аксуниского филиала. Уже третий раз она обращаеться в Нормикро. Севиль хочеть расширять свой бизнес

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Le GIE Sante Yalla est une structure qui est déjà  fonctionnelle et fait de l aviculture entre autre activités .Elle a subit une formation en ce sens. Elle déroule un projet avicole mais la demande excède  de loin son offre. C’est dans ce contexte que nous sollicitons un prêt au près de vous pour pouvoir renforcer notre activité et améliorer notre rendement afin de faire face qu exigence du marche .La gestion est commune et l’entretien se fait a tour de rôle. Les bénéfices sont réinvestit jusqu’a l’obtention d’un fonds propre nous permettant de travailler sans prêt.  Note: there are twenty-one members in this group and the photograph is featuring those that were available for the photograph when the Loan Officer visited.

loans.use: Aviculture

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: My name is Shamim A. and I am 36, married with four children. I live with my family in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. My husband is a blacksmith and I embroider clothes on order. I have been doing embroidery for last eight years and I have expertise in my work.  I plan on starting my own embroidered clothes business for which I will need to invest in good quality fabric and equipment. Please lend me $250 for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy good quality fabric

loans.name: Ana Socorro

texts.es:
Ana Socorro R. is an elderly lady worth looking up to as she has worked hard all her life in order to get by. She sells fruit and vegetables and also bags of tortillas and yucas in smaller quantities.

She is a widow and has one son that cannot study because of their financial situation. Instead, he works with her selling these products.

Everyday, in the early hours of the morning, Ana Socorro sells her products from her own stall in the Ivan Montenegro market. It is necesaary to add that Ana has had 7 credits with Ceprodel over the last 2 years, which have greatly helped her to buy and sell fruit and vegetables. Moreover, due to her advanced age, Mrs Socorro R. wishes to invest more in her business so that she can improve its infrastructure and therefore dedicate more time to doing lighter work.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Ana Socorro R. es una anciana, digna de imitar debido a que es una mujer que toda su vida la ha dedicado al trabajo para poder subsistir. Su negocio es la venta de frutas, verduras y bolsas de tortillitas y yucas en menores cantidades.

Es madre viuda y con un hijo que no estudia por la difícil situación económica, sin embargo, se dedica a trabajar con ella den la venta de estos productos.

Todos los días desde muy tempranas horas en el mercado Ivan Montenegro, la señora Ana Socorro vende sus productos en un local propio en el mercado. Es necesario destacar que desde hace 2 años, ha realizado créditos con Ceprodel (7 créditos) el cual le han beneficiado grandemente por lo que ha logrado comprar las frutas y verduras para luego venderlas. Además, a pesar de su avanzada edad, la señora Socorro R. planea invertir mas en el negocio para mejorar su infraestructura y por ende seguir dedicando mas tiempo de su vida al trabajo digno.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercadería

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
For over 16 years I've been earning a living selling new and second-hand clothing in different parts of the city of Nuevo Laredo. My wife and I work the business, which is our family's source of income. We now wish to invest in the purchase of more new clothes and shoes. We ask for a loan of $1,200.00 to purchase merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 16 años que me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva y usada en diferentes partes de la Ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia en trabajamos mi esposa y yo. Pero queremos invertirle mas al negocio de ropa nueva y zapatos, solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la compra de mercancía.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Ni Putu Eka Yulianti

texts.id:
Ni Putu Eka Yulianti opened a stall in front of her home. The road in front of her home is a road passed by many from the community. This made her stall sufficiently visited by many from the community surrounding her home. With capital of Rp. 1.000.000.- (about USD110) from her savings, Ni Putu Eka started this effort with purchasing goods for trade to stock the stall. Every morning at 4 am, Ni Putu Eka goes to the market in the city to buy goods such as vegetables, fish, raw meat and others. Ni Putu Eka opens her stall at 6 am till 6 pm. Apart from vegetables, Ni Putu Eka also sells several essentials from day-to-day, income from this amount to Rp. 50.000.- (USD5.50) per day. This income is used to fulfill needs. Her hope is that with the loan from Dinari, Ni Putu Eka will add capital to her business and increase the goods in her stall.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Putu Eka Yulianti membuka usaha warung di depan rumahnya. Jalan didepan rumahnya merupakan jalan yang ramai dilewati oleh masyarakat. Hal inilah yang membuat warungnya cukup ramai dikunjungi oleh masyarakat disekitar rumahnya. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000.- hasil dari tabungannya, Ni Putu Eka mulai usaha ini dengan membeli barang dagangan untuk mengisi warungnya. Setiap pagi pukul 04.00 Ni Putu Eka pergi kepasar di kotanya untuk membeli barang dagangan seperti sayur mayur, ikan, daging mentah dan lain-lain. Ni Putu Eka membuka warungnya dari pagi hari jam 06.00 pagi sampai pukul 06.00 sore. Selain sayur mayur, Ni Putu Eka juga menjual berbagai kebutuhan sehari-hari, keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp. 50.000.- perhari. Keuntungannya dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhannya. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari, Ni Putu Eka akan menambah modal usahanya dan memperbanyak isi warungnya .

loans.use: Purchase more goods for trade until adequate for customers' needs (Membeli barang dagangan lebih banyaklagi sehingga semua kebutuhan pelanggannya tersedia)

loans.name: Yolanda Del Rio Group

texts.es:
The Yolanda del Río Association of the Villa Adela Focus Center owes its name to the affection, respect and admiration that its 21 members have toward the woman responsible for said Center.

In its majority, its members find themselves obligated to peddle, offering their products through the biggest fairs and nearby markets due to the lack of permanent sales stands. New and used clothing, electric appliances, pastries and other products are sold in their small businesses that represent sustenance for their families, especially those that are married, since only about 10% of its members are single.

Currently, they need capital to invest in their businesses with the objective of generating the necessary resources to face the difficult situation their country is passing through, and with the sole purpose of sustaining their families.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La asociación Yolanda del Río del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, debe su nombre al cariño respeto y admiración que las 21 socias que componen la misma, le tienen a la responsable de dicho Centro. En su mayoría, las socias se ven obligadas a deambular ofertando sus productos, por las principales ferias y mercados de sus zonas a raíz de la carencia de puestos de venta fijos. Ropa nueva y usada, electrodomésticos, repostería y otros, son pequeños negocios que les representa el sustento para sus familias, principalmente aquellas que son casadas, ya que de todo el grupo solo un 10% son solteras. Actualmente ellas precisan de capital para invertir en sus negocios, con el objetivo de generar los recursos suficientes para hacer frente a la difícil situación que atraviesa el país, con el único objetivo de sustentar a sus familias.

loans.use: Purchase capital to invest in their respective businesses.

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Valor and bravery have been what Angelica has needed to start her own business and to develop herself as a wandering saleswoman; selling clothes in the Jauja market. She made this decision 3 years ago when she was looking for business opportunities and now this is an important source of income for her and her 10 year old son. She plans to work very hard and improve her finances with an increase in capital.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El valor y valentía a Angélica le han servido para emprender un negocio y ser protagonista de su propio desarrollo mediante la venta de ropa de manera ambulante en la feria de Jauja. Tomó esa decisión hace 3 años cuando estaba en búsqueda de oportunidades de negocio y hoy esta actividad es una fuente de ingresos económicos importante para ella y su pequeño de 10 años. Está planificando trabajar arduamente y mejorar su economía con el incremento de capital.

loans.use: To increase her capital to offer more products/Incremento de capital para elevar la oferta de sus productos.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shoes, curtains, and two embroidery machines.

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.en: E. Farrukh is 23 years old. He is married with an adorable kid. Farrukh has been farming since he was a young boy, and now he specializes in the cultivation of wheat and rice. He has worked the land since he was 17. When it is the season, Farrukh works in the field from early morning until late at night. Farrukh has a large and friendly family. They all try to help each other. His mother who helps him with the business was pictured on the photo as Farrukh by himself was absent that day. Now when the business is stable Farrukh believes that it shall be the main income for him in the future as his dearest children are growing up and their expenses are raising concomitantly. Today Farrukh requests 1000 Somoni ($300 US) for the term of 6 months. Farrukh is planning to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer. He thanks everyone who supports him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Javed

texts.en:
This is a poor but active man, Javed S.; he is 26 and engaged. There are 11 members in his family, and they have been living in Jalalabad for about 5 years. Javed has five brothers, two sisters and a small nephew. They are living with their parents together in their own house.

After 20 years of living overseas, when Javed's family returned to their homeland, Afghanistan, they found that because of the war, their house was destroyed and they had to rebuild it. So they scrimped and saved and made a new house instead of the one that had been destroyed. They had a little money after rebuilding the house and Javed started a small business, renting a small retail shop. He was able to provide all the necessities for his family and decided to let his father rest at home, because his father was weak and couldn't work.

Javed managed to enroll his brothers in a public school, and he was able to clear 800 Afghanis (about US$ 16) net profit in a day.

A few weeks ago, Javed decided to change his business, so he made a Public Call Office (PCO) and a mobile phone sales and repair shop with his 80,000 Afghanis (about US$ 1600), his own capital. He says that there is a great demand for these things and he will expand his business more if he buys enough mobile phones and equipment. Therefore, he has requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 Afghanis from AFSG, to achieve his goal. Javed dreams that, after repaying the loan, he will save some money for his wedding, and will marry as soon as possible. Finally he thanks honestly the lenders and their sincerity.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 42 años, vive con su segundo esposo y sus dos hijos de 12 y 9 años.
Desde que se separó de su primera pareja tuvo que hacerse cargo del hogar, gracias a la agricultura pudo educar a su hijo mayor, ahora en su segundo compromiso sigue trabajando, pero criando animales, a los cuales quiere mucho, ya que aprendió la cría y a cuidar de ellos, aunque esta actividad demanda muchas horas de trabajo para pastear a sus animales, lo hace con agrado, lo difícil es en los  tiempo de lluvia, salir a pastear se hace muy complicado.
Juana tiene como motor de su trabajo, a sus tres hijos, aunque su primer hijo se encuentre lejos, ella no deja de velar por su bienestar.
Ahora, desea mejorar la raza de sus animalitos, para ello tiene pensado adquirir ovejas de raza, y así, con el tiempo, poder ser una gran ganadera.
texts.en:
Juana is 42 years old; she lives with her second husband and her 12 and 9 year old children. After her divorce, she took care of her family all by herself, and she was able to send one son to school with the funds from her work in the fields. Juana now works raising cattle, a job which she loves even though on rainy days, she says, feeding the animals becomes a very tough task. Juana's children are what motivates her to work every day. Although one of them is far away studying, she tries to watch over his wellbeing. Now, Juana wants to improve the breed of her animals, and in order to do this she plans to buy quality sheep so that in time she can become a successful livestock farmer.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep to improve the quality of her livestock

loans.name: Siloma

texts.en:
Siloma S., 38 years old, is married with six children.  She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to the villagers and other customers about two days per week. She has already had a number of other successful loan(s) with SPBD.  

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (approximately 166 USD). SPBD loans are Siloma's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Siloma's husband is fully engaged with the business and helps out where he can.

loans.use: To purchase taro tubers, weed killer, pesticides, chemicals, a shovel, bush knives and barred wrire for her taro and banana business.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en: Hani is a 32-year-old man. He lives with his wife and their child in Saida, southern Lebanon. He is an auto mechanic and also a car polisher. In addition to his business, he imports cars from the USA. He has requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to pay the importation fees. This is his second loan and he always pays on schedule.

loans.use: Hani wants a loan to pay the import fees for his additonal business

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
N. Mahbuba is an innovative, highly capable, and very hard-working woman. Mahbuba is divorced and has two children. In search of a way to better support her household, she started selling clothes about seven years ago. Her business allows her children go to school. Her daughter helps her with the business during her free time. 

The day of our visit, Mahbuba had left to purchase new goods in the neighboring town, so her daughter is pictured in the photo instead. It is very important to Mahbuba that her children finish school and become honest, hard-working individuals. You can help Mahbuba provide for the education of her children. She is requesting 3000 Somoni ($ 900 USD) to buy winter clothing for the upcoming season. Mahbuba wants to continue to support her children and only wishes to work in order to achieve this. Let’s support this loving and hard-working mother.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing in order to increase her business inventory

loans.name: Elom

texts.fr: Elom A.est un jeune home de 29 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il habite à Lavie, un village situé à environ 135 kilomètres de la capitale togolaise, Lomé. Il fait la pépinière des palmiers, une activité qui est très florissante, étant donné que la population vit en majorité de l’agriculture et sollicite ses jeunes plants. Il espère avec ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV, accroître la taille de son activité afin de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle. est un jeune home de 29 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il habite à Lavie, un village situé à environ 135 kilomètres de la capitale togolaise, Lomé. Il fait la pépinière des palmiers, une activité qui est très florissante, étant donné que la population vit en majorité de l’agriculture et sollicite ses jeunes plants. Il espère avec ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV, accroître la taille de son activité afin de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Elom A.is a young man, age 29, married and the father of two. He lives in Lavie, a village located about 135 km from the Togolese capital, Lomé. He runs a palm tree nursery, a booming business given that most people make a living from agriculture and seek young plants. He hopes to use this second FECECAV loan to expand his business in order to meet the needs of his customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy watering cans and to employ tenant farmers

loans.name: Engels Daniel

texts.es:
El Joven Engels Daniel I. E. tiene la edad de 30 años, su estado civil es soltero por lo tanto no tiene hijos, Engels ha sido un joven emprendedor que ha podido sobrevivir a las difíciles situaciones que se le han presentado y ahora sus propósitos son contar con una fuente de ingresos con la que pueda sustentarse y ayudar en los gastos de su hogar sus deseos son remodelar su vivienda para tener mejores condiciones y un mejor nivel de vida y si algún día llega a formar un hogar pueda tener que ofrecer a su esposa e hijos sus sueños son dejar de trabajar de forma dependiente y dedicarse por completo al cuido de su propio negocio por lo que sus aspiraciones a cumplir son muchas pero sus propósitos  son su mayor prioridad a cumplir.

Su actividad económica es la de servicio de cyber, la ubicación de su negocio es frente a la Terminal de buses en León, el tiempo que tiene de conservar  su negocio es de 3 años, sus inicios se dan con la idea de contar con un negocio que ha tenido afluencia y solicito un cantidad de dinero para establecer este negocio y debido al buen servicio que ofrece en su negocio ha logrado obtener mas clientes por lo cual ha visto la necesidad de ampliar los servicios hoy en día ofrece recargas electrónicas movistar y claro llamadas telefónicas, servicio de Internet entre otras cosas, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para instalar cabinas telefónicas, compra de mas equipos y abastecerse en recargas de ambas compañías distribuidoras.
texts.en:
Engels Daniel I. E. is 30-years old, is single and has no children. Engels is a young entrepreneur who has been able to survive difficult times and now hopes to have a steady source of income to cover his household expenses. He wishes to remodel his house and improve his living conditions, so that if he one day has a family he can offer his wife and children a good home. He dreams of working for himself and having his own business. It will take a lot to accomplish his goals, but he is dedicated to accomplishing them. Engels has an internet services business located across from the bus terminal in León. He started his business 3 years ago when he was looking for work with a steady flow of customers. He obtained money to start his business and offered such good service that he had to expand his business to include telephone lines, Movistar cellular phone credit, and internet, among other things. This loan will be used to install telephone booths, purchase equipment, and stock phone credit from different cellular companies.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Bunthen Em Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank which consists of thirteen members is located in Saeprambei village in Kampong Cham province and they plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Bunthen E. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate vegetables. She currently does not have enough money to grow yams. In order to deal this problE., she decided to request for a loan to cultivate yams. Her husband, Mr. Va Kim Yin, is a laborer. Mrs. Bunthen E. is 35 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: Cultivating yams

loans.name: Marey Group

texts.en:
Marey is the group leader of the Marey Group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like to receive money for his/her own business.

Shafeqa and Fareshta want to take a loan for the business of tailoring. They want to buy new machines for their business. Meyna wants to take a loan for her husband's general store to complete his stock. Marey wants to take a loan for her husband’s tailor shop; he wants to buy necessary materials for his shop. They all want to expand and progress in their business and to earn more money to support their families.

With this loan they can make their businesss larger and support their families. To become strong in their businesses and make a better future for themselves and for their families. They are really very happy with this loan process in this poor country.

loans.use: they all want to expand and progress in their businesses

loans.name: Norma Del Carmen

texts.es: Norma del Carmen C. de 33 años de edad, reside en Zaragoza junto a su esposo y dos hijos los cuales son estudiantes de plan básico. Ella posee un negocio de venta de lácteos los cuales los comercializa de forma ambulante junto a su esposo, ya que este posee una pequeña camioneta la cual les sirve para repartir el queso en diferentes lugares del departamento de la Libertad, ambos poseen muy buenas referencias crediticias y además gozan de muy buena fama por ser personas muy responsables y trabajadoras. Norma tiene muy buenas ventas ya que posee clientes fijos los cuales compran siempre su producto. Ella solicita un préstamo ya que su deseo es el poder incrementar las ventas, debido a que desea que sus hijos continúen estudiando y teniendo una vida suplida de todas las necesidades básicas, gracias a l préstamo obtenido ella podrá comprar más queso el cual la proveerá de mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Norma del Carmen C. is 33 years old and lives in Zaragoza together with her husband and their two children, currently attending primary school. She owns a business selling milk products that she sells with her husband from door to door with the help of a small van. They distribute cheese to different regions of La Libertad. They both have good credit references and they are known to be hardworking and responsible people. Norma secures very good sales because she has steady customers who always purchase her products. She requests a loan so that she will be able t increase her sales. She wants to see her children continue their studies and she wants to provide them with all the basic necessities of life. Thanks to this loan she will be able to purchase more cheese that will provide her with greater earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cheese.

loans.name: Diaraye

texts.fr: Diaraye S., 49 ans, est mariée et a 5 enfants en charge. Elle souhaiterait promouvoir son activité de transformation et de vente de pâte d’arachide. Elle compte, avec ses revenus soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Diaraye S. is 49 years old and married with 5 children. She would like to promote her business producing and selling peanut butter. She hopes to support her husband with her income in providing for their family.

Translated from French by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production and sale of peanut butter

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence O. is fifty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, three sons and three daughters. She says some of her children are in junior high school while others are in primary school. Two are currently in senior high school.

Florence lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works to support her husband financially to provide for the family and especially meet the children’s school demands. Her husband is a farmer. He cultivates palm nuts. Florence is a petty trader. She runs a provision store on one of the principal streets in her community. She also sells vegetables on a small table top in front of her store.

Florence procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda and other nearby towns. Florence has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure provisions for re-sale

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate O. is a widow and has five dependent children. She has received schooling through senior high school. Kate sells and trades food and soft drinks in Yamoransa in Cape Coast and has done so since 1992. She uses her income to pay the light bill and school fees. 

Kate will use her loan to purchase more food and soft drinks to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business Kate plans to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more food and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr: Marié et père de famille, ce monsieur a ouvert en 2005 un débit de boissons à kégué, il s’approvisionne auprès de la brasserie du Togo, la plupart de ses clients sont des tenanciers de bar et des restaurateurs. Il fait face actuellement à une rupture de stock, il voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 30 casiers de bière et 25 casiers de sucrerie.
texts.en:
Married and the father of a family, this gentleman opened a drinks depot in Kégué in 2005. He buys his inventory from the brewery of Togo. Most of his customers are bar and restaurant owners. He has presently run out of some items so he needs to stock up and is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 30 crates of beer and 25 crates of sodas.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of crates of drinks

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita F. is from the village of Danao. She is 45 years old. Charita is married and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Charita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling baked goods in the local community. Charita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Charita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Charita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Charita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Shamil

texts.en: Shamil

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Grace Wanjiku

texts.en:
Grace K. is a 31-year-old single mother of one. She lives with her son Fredrick in Mariakani where she operates a retail shop and a grocery store.

Her business is located on a main road at the Mariakani Shopping Centre and has been in operation for five years.  This will be Grace's first loan from KADET, and with the 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan she plans to purchase more peas, beans, and maize for her shop in order to meet customer demand.

Grace's dream is to become a leading wholesaler in the area, and to purchase a pickup van to transport inventory she buys from from her main suppliers to her shop.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To expand the inventory of a small general store.

loans.name: Rosas Rojas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Rosas Rojas está ubicado en la Estancia, Parroquia el Cabo, en el Cantón Paute,  Paute es una zona turística de la provincia del Azuay, es visitado por su clima tropical, las plantaciones de flores y la gran variedad de frutas que se cultivan en sus tierras. 

El Banco Comunal está conformado por 14 socias todas muy amables y alegres se llevan muy entre sí y son muy buenas vecinas en su comunidad, se dedican a diferentes labores ya sea en la casa o fuera de ellas, es así por ejemplo citamos unas de ellas:

Gloria vive en la Estancia es una comunidad minutos antes de llegar a Paute, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada vive con su esposo y se llevan muy bien en su vida matrimonial, fruto de su unión conyugal concibieron 3 hijos de 10, 9, 8 años de edad, todos estudian en la escuela de la comunidad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en la casa de sus padres en cuartos separados, su esposo trabaja como chofer y es un pilar fundamental en su hogar.

Gloria es comerciante de ropa y tiene puesto propio en el mercado San José de Paute y también vende en su casa, trabaja en su negocio hace 4 años, y su horario es de 9 a.m. a 5 p.m. de lunes a domingo y en su casa a tiende en la noche o a la hora que lleguen a comprar por que tiene una gran variedad de ropa para hombre, mujer y niño todo muy surtido.

Es su segundo crédito y le a beneficiado mucho en su negocio, nos cuenta que se lleva muy bien entre todas las socias tanto en el bankito como en su comunidad. El préstamo que hoy realiza es para invertir en la compra de  más ropa como: chompas, casacas,  las cuales le entregan en el puesto de venta.

Para obtener un mayor  surtido de ropa viaja a la ciudad de Cuenca para comprar en la Feria Libre, su meta para el futuro es construir su casa y ampliar su negocio.

María vive en la Estancia a unos minutos antes de llegar al cantón Paute, tiene 39 años de edad, es viuda hace 17 años y no se ha vuelto a casar, tiene 3 hijos de 16, 9, 5 años de edad, su primer hijo concebido en su matrimonio esta en el colegio cursando el 4to año, el segundo y tercer hijo cursan el 5to año de educación básica y el jardín en la escuela de la comunidad, no son reconocidos por su padre y llevan el apellido materno.Ttienen casa propia pero se encuentra en muy mal estado a punto de caer, viven cuidando una villa.

María trabaja en la agricultura sembrando toda clase de hortalizas, también se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, pollos, su horario de trabajo es de 8 a.m. a 5 p.m. todos los días, por lo que no se debe descuidar del riego de sus hortalizas, de cortar la  hierva para los cuyes y estar al pendiente de la criaza de los pollos, este es su segundo crédito y se lleva muy bien con sus compañeras, es  una de las socias mas alegre y divertida en el grupo, el préstamo que hoy realiza  los va a invertir en la ampliación de su criadero de pollos y cuyes, su meta para el futuro es llegar a tener una buena casita donde pueda vivir dignamente.

Zoila vive en la parroquia el Cabo, sector la Estancia, tiene 29 años de edad, vive en unión libre hace muchos años, siendo su esposo un gran apoyo en su hogar, fruto de su amor procrearon una niña que tiene 12 años de edad, está en el colegio cursando el primer año, no tienen casa propia, viven cuidando una villa, se dedica a la crianza de animales como son los cuyes, pollos, chanchos, también se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, las que vende en los mercados de Paute y Gualaceo.

Lleva 6 meses trabajando independientemente y no ha tenido ninguna dificultad en la crianza de sus animales, nos cuenta que trabajar así tiene muchas ventajas por que no se descuida de los quehaceres domésticos, de su esposo y pasa más tiempo con su hija.

Es su tercer ciclo trabajando junto a la FUNDACION ESPOIR, y esta muy agradecida ya que se pudo desenvolver por si misma e independizarse en un negocio propio; el préstamo que realiza lo va a  invertir ampliando su criadero, en la compra de alimento para sus animales y la compra de semilla para su huerto.

El sueño que tiene para el futuro es de seguir trabajando para darle una mejor educación a su hija y tratar de que nunca le falte nada.
texts.en:
The Red Roses Community Bank is located in La Estancia, Cabo parish, in Paute canton, in a tourist area of the province of Azuay. People visit the region because of its tropical climate, its fields of flowers, and the wide variety of fruit grown there. The Community Bank is made up of fourteen members. They are all very friendly and lively, get on well together, and are good neighbours. They work at different jobs, some in their homes and some out in the community. Here are some examples: Gloria lives in La Estancia, a community located just a few minutes outside of Paute. She is 29 years old, married, and lives with her husband. They have a good marriage and get on well together. They have three children, aged 10, 9, and 8, who attend the local school. They don’t own their own home so they live in a part of the house owned by her parents. Her husband works as a driver and is a mainstay of the household. Gloria is a businesswoman selling clothing from her own stall in the San José de Paute market and from her home too. She’s had this business for four years and works from 9am to 5pm every day of the week. As she serves customers from her home too, she works in the evenings or whenever her customers arrive to buy items. She carries a wide variety of clothing for men, women and children. This is her second loan and her business has benefited greatly from the money. She says that all is going well with the members both within the bank and within the community. The loan she is asking for today will be used to buy more clothes such as sweaters and jackets which she sells from her market stall. In order to get a greater variety of clothing, Gloria travels to Cuenca to buy at the Feria Libre. In the future she would like to build a house and expand her business. María lives in La Estancia which is located a few minutes outside the canton of Paute. She is 39 years old and has been a widow for 17 years. She has never remarried. She has three children aged 16, 9, and 5. Her oldest son is in the fourth year of secondary school. The second is in fifth grade of primary school, and the third is in the local kindergarten. The children are not recognised by their father, and they have kept their mother’s last name. They do have a house of their own but it is in poor condition and on the point of falling down. They live in another house which they take care of. María works as a farmer growing all sorts of vegetables. She also raises guinea pigs and chickens. She works from 8am to 5pm every day as she has to water her crops, cut grass for the guinea pigs, or care for the chickens. This is her second loan and all is going well with her colleagues at the bank. She is one of the most lively and entertaining members of the group. This loan will be used to expand the guinea pig and chicken farm. In the future her goal is to have a nice home where she can live proudly. Zoila lives in the parish of El Cabo, in the neighbourhood of La Estancia. She is 29 years old and has lived with her partner for many years. He helps a great deal in the home. They have a daughter aged 12 who is in first year of high school. They do not own their own home but live in another house which they take care of. Zoila earns her living by raising animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs. She also grows vegetables which she sells in the Paute and Gualaceo markets. Zoila has worked for herself for the last six months and has had no problem raising the animals. She says that working independently has many advantages, as she doesn’t neglect her domestic duties, or her husband, and she has more time to spend with her daughter. This is her third loan with Kiva partner, Fundacion Espoir, and Zoila is very grateful as she has learned to cope by herself and become an independent businesswoman. She plans to use this loan to expand her farm, buy food for the animals and seeds for her vegetable garden. Her dream is to continue working so that she can give her daughter a good education and never want for anything.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing, animals, feed, seeds

loans.name: Jones Kilungya

texts.en:
Jones Kilunge K. is married to Mary Jones. He is thirty-five years old and has one child named Jane Katunge Jones who is three years old. Jones believes he is hardworking and focused.

Jones has six years’ experience selling charcoal from his second-story retail space. His clientele comes from hotels, small cafes and nearby residents. With his loan Jones plans to increase his stock of charcoal in the face of the coming rainy season. With the increased profits from these sales, he will then purchase a paraffin machine pump. Jones’ hopes and dreams are to become a wholesale and retail dealer in paraffin.

Jones was introduced to KADET by other KADET members. This is his first loan with KADET, and he has no loans from other MFI's.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to empowering its clients economically through its financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To increase stocks of charcoal.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a dealer of AVON, MSE and NATSHA products in the community of Barangay General Balao, Solana, Cagayan. She earns an income on a commission basis. She hopes to increase her business capital and income next month, because the peak season is at harvest time. She is hoping that she will be granted a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP5,000, so that her direct-selling business can grow further.

Janeth is 35 years old and married to Jomar, a simple farmer. They are blessed with three children. Christine Joy is 15 years old and a high school student. Both Christian Jay, who is 9 years old, and Shajarah Mae, who is 7 years old, are elementary pupils. All of them are enrolled in a public school where cheaper tuition is charged. The village where they live is an agricultural community where the main source of income is farming. Janet intends to do her best to make her business prosper and to save for future use.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 47 and is married to Vicente, a farmer who also works as a tricycle driver.  They have four  loving children: Michael - 22 years old, a nursing graduate who is taking a review course; John - 18 years old, a 1st year college student; Dave - 15 years old, a 4th year high school student and their youngest, Jaira - 7 years old, grade 2. They live in the village of Salay, Angadanan Isabela. Their house is near the rice field, which is one of the major sources of income in their village. 

Eva has managed a food vending business for almost 12 years and sometimes she sells vegetables for additional income.  Her weekly net income is PHP 1,700.00, and she decided to request a loan of PHP10,000.00 that she can use as business capital. This amount will be used to buy the necessary commodities she needs for her food production business.  She said that " we should be content with what we have right now because it is better to live a simple life".

loans.use: To buy different commoditites for her food business

loans.name: Yanira Elizabeth

texts.es: Yanira Elizabeth C. H. reside en Ilopango municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Yanira de 29 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hija. Yanira maneja su propio negocio ubicado en el mercado de San Martin donde ofrece zapatos y cosméticos, son siete años de experiencias en las ventas que caracterizan y marcan a Yanira que posee de una buena clientela, el crédito que solicita es para destinarlo en la compra de nuevos productos para su negocio los cuales los adquirirá comprándolos al por mayor y así obtener precios mas baratos, para generar mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Yanira Elizabeth C. H. lives in the Ilopango municipality in the San Salvador department. Yanira is 29, and she lives with her husband and her daughter. Yanira runs her own business, which is located in the San Martin market. She sells shoes and cosmetics. She has seven years of experience in sales. Yanira has good customers. The loan she is asking for is to buy new products for her business. She will buy the products wholesale in order to get cheaper prices. This will generate a greater margin of earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Bolale

texts.en:
Bolale sells drinks, wine and juice at retail prices to her customers. The high season for her business is here. She is a hardworking woman. She loves her business because it is highly competitive. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is 35 years old and married with two children. She is hoping for a loan of 100,000 naira to purchase more drinks, wine and juice to sell. 
She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, wine and juice to sell

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
Este unidad de desarrollo (UDE) se llama Las Flores porque todas las casas de esta comunidad tienen flores.  Las UDEs son grupos de más de 10 personas que tiene una cuenta de banco y tienen que reunir semanalmente o quincenalmente para realizar sus pagos.  Tiene un representante y un comité que lo gobierna.  Este grupo está ubicado en la comunidad de Las Trancas en el estado de Veracruz.  El grupo está conformado por  doce integrantes.  

El representante del grupo se llama Inocencia M. R. (Doña Chencha a sus amigos).   Doña Chencha tiene 51 años, es casada, estudió hasta el tercero de primaria, y tiene en total tres hijos (dos mujeres y un varón).  Ella se dedica a la venta por catálogo de calzado y necesita el préstamo para invertir en surtir su mercancía.  Ella va casa por casa ofreciendo calzado. 

Sabina T. M. es parte de este grupo, Las Flores.  Ella tiene sesenta años, estudió hasta la primaria, y tiene en total cuatro hijos (una mujer y tres varones).  Ella se dedica a la venta de pan y unos refrescos en una tienda en parte de su casa y necesita el préstamo para invertir en su refresquería y comprar pan hecho a mano en Córdoba (a dos horas de camino).  En su comunidad no hacen pan, pero allá hay varios tipos de pan.  Sus clientes son de su mismo comunidad y casi todo lo que vende es de pedido.  Nos cuenta que casi todo lo que trae de Córdoba ya está comprado. Tiene 10 años de su negocio.
