Sabina desea este préstamo para aumentar su negocio, para sacarse una ganancia para instalar un local aparte de su casa y tenerlo surtido, vendiendo más cosas.  También ahora trabaja en el campo si es necesario, pero espera que en el futuro se puede dedicar a solo este negocio que requiere menos esfuerzo. 

Los otros diez integrantes son:

Delfina V. L. quien vende calzado por catálogo
Zita González B. quien vende ropa
Alejandra V. Lopez quien vende ropa igual
Beatriz M. González quien vende carne de res
Yolanda R. Velazquez quien cocina antojitos regionales en su casa los fines de semana 
Alberto C. H. quien cría, mata, y vende cerdo
Ana R. M. quien vende de calzado por catálogo
Veneranda P. T. quien también vende calzado por catálogo
Maria Magdalena I. C. quien vende artículos domésticos como peltres, vajillas, y platos de cerámica
Beatríz América C. T. quien también cocina antojitos los fines de semana
texts.en:
This Development Unit is called “Las Flores” because all of the houses in the neighborhood have flowers. Development Units are groups of more than 10 people who have an account with us and meet either weekly or biweekly to make their payments. Each group has a representative and a governing committee. This group is located in the community of Las Trancas in the State of Veracruz. There are 12 members in this group.

The group representative is Inocencia M. R. (known as Doña Chencha by her friends). Doña Chencha is 51 years old, married, and has a third grade education. She has three children (two daughters and a son). She sells shoes by catalog and needs a loan to invest in more merchandise. Doña Chencha travels house to house to sell her products.

Sabina T. M. is also a member of the Las Flores Group. She is 60 years old, completed her primary school education, and has four children (one daughter and three sons). She sells bread and soft drinks from a store established in her house. Doña Sabina needs a loan to invest in her convenience store and purchase handmade bread in Córdoba (located two hours away). Bread is not available in her community, but there different types of bread sold in Córdoba. Her customers are residents of her own community, so they will buy just about anything she orders. Sabina tells us that almost everything she brings back from Córdoba is sold. She has been in business for 10 years and is requesting this loan to keep it growing by obtaining a location separate from her house. In addition, she will purchase more products. Sabina also works on her farm when necessary, but she hopes in the future she can focus solely on her business since it requires less effort.

The other 10 members are:

Delfina V. L. sells shoes by catalog. Alejandra V. Lopez sells clothing by catalog. Beatriz M. González sells beef. Yolanda R. Velazquez prepares regional snacks at home on the weekends. Alberto C. H. raises, butchers, and sells pigs. Ana R. M. sells shoes by catalog. Veneranda P. T. also sells shoes by catalog. Maria Magdalena I. C. sells household items such as pewter, china, and ceramic plates. Beatríz América C. T. also prepares snacks on the weekends.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an additional stock of drinks in bulk

loans.name: Seang Ly's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Seang Ly C. is the loan group leader with four members who live in Thnal Bat village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns two hectares of land to cultivate rice. At her plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil and is far from an irrigation system. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, gasoline, and hire laborers to work on the field. Her husband, Mr. Keo Khlei, owns a horse cart to help him transport goods and passengers. This couple has three children: one works; another attends the local school; and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, gasoline, and hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: Ouleymatou

texts.fr: Ouleymatou S. est une femme de 55 ans, mariée et mère 9 enfants. Elle fait du petit commerce vestimentaire. Son objectif est d’augmenter son capital et de prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Ouleymatou S., 55, is married and the mother of 9 children. She has a little clothing sales business. Her objective is to grow her working capital and support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: have a little clothing business

loans.name: Myrna's Group

texts.en:
Myrna T. is from the village of Dullan. She is 47 years old. Myrna is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Myrna is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna sells sand & gravel in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Myrna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Myrna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Gildo's Group

texts.en:
Gildo S. is from the village of San Juan. He is 32 years old. Gildo is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Gildo is single. To make a living, Gildo owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gildo has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gildo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gildo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gildo is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La señora Matilde se dedica a la venta de de frutas y verduras dando inicio a sus labores desde las 6:00 am comienza a ofertar sus productos a su clientela, su tramo esta ubicado en la 4ta calle del mercado la terminal.

Este crédito que solicito para la compra de zanahoria, cebolla, chiltoma, papa, yuca y otros.

Cabe mencionar que la señora Matilde es madre soltera tiene  seis hijos, el mayor de 27 años le ayuda en el negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Matilde works selling fruit and vegetables. At 6:00 am she starts selling her product from her location on Fourth Street in the Terminal Market. She will use this loan to buy carrots, onions, peppers, potatoes, yucca, and other products We should mention that Mrs. Matilde is a single mother with six children, the eldest of whom is 27 and helps her with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of carrots, peppers, potatoes, onion, yucca, tomato

loans.name: Brisas De California Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal denominada “BRISAS DE CALIFORNIA” se encuentra  representada por la señora Celia Rosa y conformada por 7 miembros carismáticos y  emprendedores de sus propios destinos.
La señora Celia tiene 44 años de edad, es casada, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 5 están en edad académica, y uno es independiente. El negocio al cual se dedica: es la venta de abarrotes o cereales de la sierra D. Perú, desde hace 4 años. Brisas de California, trabaja con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desde hace 8 meses, nuestros socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como la producción y el comercio minorista.  Con el reciente préstamo otorgado; por ejemplo la señora Celia comprará mercadería para su negocio de venta de cereales, todos los demás miembros incrementarán su capital para así obtener mayores ganancias, mejor posesión en el mercado y captar mayor cantidad de clientes. Los socios tienen grandes sueños y se encuentran muy agradecidos con la institución por todo el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos y seguir trabajando para sus ahorros.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank known as “Brisas de California” (Breezes of California) is led by Sra. Celia Rosa and consists of seven charismatic and enterprising members who determine their own destinies.

Sra. Celia is 44 years old, married, and has six children. Five of them are in school, while the other one is independent. Her business involves selling groceries and grain in the mountains of Peru and she has been doing this for four years. She joined “Brisas de California”, which has been working with EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad for eight months.

The members are involved in different activities such as manufacturing and operating small businesses. With this recent loan that has been provided, all of the members will be able to increase their capital so that they can generate better earnings, get a better hold of the market, and attract more customers. For example, Sra. Celia will buy merchandise for her grain sales business. The members have big dreams and are very grateful to the Institution for all the support that has been provided. They commit to completing their payments and continuing their work so that they can save.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains

loans.name: Emerson Eduardo

texts.es: El señor Emerson Eduardo T. B. cuenta con 21 años, casado tiene una hija vive con sus familia actualidad el se dedica a la artesanía en la elaboración de cortes típicos por las condiciones en las que vive no son suficientes para cubrir sus gastos personales por lo que se acerco a las intalaciones de la asociación ASDIR para adquirir un préstamo para poder comprar su propia materia prima según su experiencia en su trabajo quiere obtener un pequeño taller para la elaboración de cortes típicos mejorando así sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Sufragando sus gastos personales mensualmente.
texts.en:
Emerson Eduardo T. B. is 21 years old and lives with his wife and daughter. He is a craftsman who makes traditional clothing, but his income is currently not enough to cover his personal expenses. This is why he came to Kiva partner Asociacion ASDIR - to request a loan to buy raw materials and get a little workshop in which to make traditional clothing in order to better his and his family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying raw materials

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine is 33 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She makes a living running a pharmacy and a cosmetic shop. She also rents her house to earn extra income. She has been in business for four years and has one employee. Josephine has joined a group in Faulu Kenya named Elians, whose members co-guarantee each other's loans. She has requested a loan of Kes 60,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to buy additional drugs and cosmetics to sell. She describes herself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: Ta buy additional drugs and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Juan Benigno

texts.es:
Juan Benigno A. propietario de un local de Fotocopias y Estacionamiento en pleno centro de la ciudad de Asunción, el mismo es soltero y de profesión estudiante de Canto y Música.
El cliente es el sostén de sus padres con quienes atiende el negocio, con estos ingresos sustenta además sus estudios y sus propios gastos.
Cabe mencionar que con el crédito obtenido de la Fundación Paraguaya realizaría algunos arreglos como mejoras y pintura en su negocio.
texts.en:
Juan Benigno owns a parking lot and photocopying service right in downtown Asunción. He, himself, is single and a student of Music and Singing. He supports his parents, who help him out in the business; this income also pays for his studies and his personal expenses. It’s worth mentioning that he will use the loan obtained from Fundación Paraguaya to make some improvements to his business, like new paint.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for paint and labor costs.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru: Катаева Наталья проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 32 года. Разведена, имеет одного ребенка. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей. Она продает парфюмерию, нижнее белье и многое другое. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 2 года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Natalya K. lives in the Yavan district. She is 32 years old, divorced and has one child. She has a secondary education and is involved in retail sales. She sells perfumes, undergarments and various other merchandise. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Natalya is requesting the loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.en:
Nicanor C. is from the town of Banga. He is 40 years old, married, and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Nicanor owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nicanor has been engaged in his business for over four years.
In January 2010, Nicanor joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nicanor is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This loan will be his second from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About CEVI
Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single mother of six children and all of them are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. She rents and resides in a two-room house and the family has access to electricity. 

Jane Sells bark cloth in Nalukolongo road along the Masaka – Kampala road.  She buys these bark cloths from people who get them from Masaka and Rakai districts in central eastern Uganda. (Bark cloth is a textile-like material made from bark stripped from the Ficus Natalensis tree.)

She has been in this business for ten years. She plans to use the loan to buy more pieces of bark cloth to increase her stock. Her customers are the local people who have lost their loved ones. She works six days a week and depends on this job to make a living.  She hopes to start going directly to Masaka for bark cloth to sell. Jane joined MCDT to boost her business by getting additional capital.

loans.use: To buy more pieces of bark cloth

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal S., 32 years old, is the village bank president selected by its thirteen members located in Kanhchum village, Takeo province. The members of this village group will use this loan to support their different purposes and hope to increase their incomes to improve their families' standard of living.

Mrs. Sophal S. and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Ken, are farmers who own 1.20-hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living. They work very hard with the farm to support their family. In order to increase income, Mrs. Sophal S. decided to ask for a loan to buy chickens and chicken food for breeding. This couple has three children, who are students in the local school.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken food for breeding

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Mrs. Nget P. is a married woman who lives in Prey Chheu Teal village in Takeo province. She was born in 1949. She is a farmer who owns one point five-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family while her husband, Mr. Phan Ouch, is a palm juice collector. Now she has some problem because her field is infertile soil and it is far away from irrigation system. So to improve production, Mrs. Nget P. is applying for a loan to buy a pump machine and fertilizer. She is a mother of a child who is a seamstress in garment factory.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine and fertilizer

loans.name: Jonathan Lorenzo

texts.es:
Jonathan tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Santa Rosa, un distrito cuya economía depende de la pesca, se encuentra ubicado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de pescado en el terminal pesquero que se encuentra situado en el distrito donde vive, el se levanta todos los dias muy temprano a comprar pescado a las cámaras que llegan a dejar el producto hidrobiológico en el lugar para luego ofrecerlo en venta a los comerciantes que a su vez lo revenderán en los mercados de toda la región. Esta actividad le provee de algunos ingresos que utiliza en solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar económicamente a su familia.

Jonathan desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas pescado, de modo que pueda incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus ganancias, pero como no cuenta con dinero suficiente para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Jonathan es un joven trabajador y responsable, su mayor anhelo es ayudar a su familia a obtener una mejor calidad de vida, el ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado Puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Jonathan, 20, is single and lives with his family in Santa Rosa, a district whose economy depends on fishing. It is located half an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. He sells fish at the fishing terminal located where he lives. He rises very early every day to buy fish directly from the fishing boats that deliver sea food items to that place in order to offer it for sale to merchants that later resell it in all the regional markets. This activity provides him with some income that he uses to meet personal expenses and to help out his family’s economy. Jonathan would like to expand his business buying more fish so that his sales will increase thereby leading to higher profits. However, he doesn’t have enough money to do so. Therefore, he has called upon Edpyme Alternativa to ask for a 1500 new sol loan that will help him reach this objective. Jonathan is a hard-working, responsible young man. His greatest wish is to help his family attain a better quality of life. He has collaborated with Our Institution in the past and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with respect to his repayment obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “KUSIKOYLLOR ”,   El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Valentina;   ella tiene  45 años de edad, es  natural de Yucay y es soltera; La socia es una mujer multifacética, ella es empresaria tiene una agencia de turismo llamado nuevo mundo  y también ella alterna esta su actividad con la crianza de cuyes ella compra y luego de procrearse y llegar a la madurez los vende, este negocio le permite distraerse y también incrementar sus ganancias. La socia desea el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su agencia y en la compra de algunos cuyes.   
                .
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Valentina belongs to the “KUSIKOYLLOR” Communal Bank, located in Huanchac district of the province and department of Cusco. Valentina is 45 years old, single, and a native of Yucay. She is a multifaceted woman, an empresario who has a tourist agency called Nuevo Mundo (New World) and, also, she alternates this activity with raising guinea pigs. She buys them, then breeds more and when they reach maturity, she sells them. This business keeps her busy and also increases her earnings. Valentina requests the loan for maintaining her agency and buying more guinea pigs. Valentina appreciates and values the authorized loan from this source and, likewise, she promises to comply with all payments within the established time.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: INVESTING IN THE MAINTAINANCE OF HER AGENCY AND BUYING MORE GUINEA PIGS

loans.name: Greta

texts.en:
Greta A. is from the village of Guibang. She is 54 years old. Greta is married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Greta owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and selling vegetables in the local community. Greta has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Greta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Greta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Greta is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Greta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Nga

texts.en: Nga T. T. N. is 45 years old and has two high school ages children.  She is a successful business woman who sells fertilizer and pesticides. Every month, she makes 3,000,000 VND profit.  Joining our credit program in 2007, she has a good repayment history. Currently, she wants a loan of 6,322,000 VND to invest in her shop.

loans.use: Invest in her shop.

loans.name: Mariya's Group

texts.en:
Mariya  J. is the leader of this group. She is 58 years old and married. She has ten children, most of whom are married. A long time ago, Mariya and her husband started to breed livestock. They make 5000 KGS a month selling the fattened farm animals. They also have a piece of land where they grow wheat. Maria applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase hay and to hire laborers to collect the harvest. In the future she plans to repair her house.

Mahabat J. is the treasurer of the group. She is 38 years old and married. She has three sons and a daughter.  The first son works in constructor and the other children are in school. Mahabat breeds cattle. Her husband went to work in Russia. With the loan money, Mahabat wants to purchase hay for her cattle.

Seyezbek T., 44, is married. He has two sons and two daughters. Seyzbek is a farmer who grows wheat. With the loan money, he wants to hire laborers for the harvest. He wants to provide his children with a good education. 

Abdiubiraiym  B., 44, is married and has three children who are in school.  Abdiubiraiym also breeds cattle. He hopes to obtain the loan because he needs money to repaire his house. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line:
• People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society)
• Planet (being environmentally friendly)
• Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members receive special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To hire laborers for the harvest

loans.name: Heam

texts.en:
Mr. Heam H., age 27, owns and operates a handicraft business whose main activity is selling rattan cupboards. He sells rattan that his wife weaves and he also orders from other weavers who live in the village. He uses his old motorcycle witha  trailer attached as transportation and it takes a few days to sell all his rattan. Heam H. has been facing difficulties transporting his rattan because his old vehicle often breaks down and that affects how he can satisfy the needs of his customers. 

Because of this problem, Heam H. decided to request a loan to purchase a vehicle to replace the broken one. Mr. Heam H. was away selling his rattan when the photo was taken, so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase a vehicle to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda C. is from the city of Prenza, Tangub City. She is 52 years old and married, with 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda  plants and harvests bananas for sale. Rosalinda has been in this business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

Rosalinda joined GDMPC this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda is requesting her first loan, for 5000 PHP, to be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use additional revenue generated by the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen N. is from the village of Bayo, Iguig, Cagayan. She is 53 years old. Carmen is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Carmen owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Carmen has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Carmen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from ASKI. Carmen is requesting a new loan of 45,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Carmen from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Jimi Emmanuel

texts.es: Jimi Emmanuel V. es un señor trabajador, esforzado y emprendedor de 24 años quien vende repuestos de moto desde hace un año con el fin de sacar adelante a su familia y brindarles todo lo posible a sus dos hijos de 2 años y 11 meses. El invertirá el crédito en el negocio con la compra de materia prima como cascos, aceites, etc.
texts.en:
Jimi Emmanuel V. is a hard working, dedicated, enterprising, 24 year old man who has sold motorcycle spare parts for the last year in order to support his family and provide his two children, who are 2 years and 11 months old respectively, with everything possible.

He will use the loan to invest in the business buying raw materials like helmets, lubricants, etc.

loans.use: For spare parts.

loans.name: Marcial Salvador

texts.es:
Marcial es un hombre muy emprendedor, pequeño comerciante de venta de ropa, zapatos, el cual inicio hace treinta tres años con poca mercadería. Que gracias a su empeño de sobresalir adelante con su familia comienza a vender y aumenta sus niveles de ganancia.
Hoy en día aumento más su capital de productos de ropa nueva, ropa usada y la venta de zapatos con financiamiento que la institución ha dado, lo que para él ha sido de muchos beneficios, para la compra de variedad y estilo de zapato ya que la demanda es mucha.
Día a día labora en un tramo desde horas temprana para lograr vender su mercadería en donde vende a precios accesibles ya que compra a mayorista y que da  a buen precio. Con este nuevo préstamo será para la compra de cajones de zapatos variados para caballeros y niños. Que espera aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en: Marcial is a very enterprising man, a small-scale merchant who sells clothing and shoes. He started doing this thirty years ago with a little merchandise. Thanks to his effort to excel, he started selling with his family and his earnings are increasing. He currently increases his stock of new and used clothing and shoes with the loans that the institution has given him. These loans have been very beneficial for him, for the purchase of varied styles of shoes since there is great demand. Day to day he works, starting very early in the morning, in order to sell his merchandise. He sells at accessible prices, since he buys wholesale and gets a good price. This new loan will be for the purchase of crates of varied shoes for men and children. He hopes to increase his sales.

loans.use: To purchase cases of various shoes for children and men.

loans.name: Diego Boanerge

texts.es: Diego es un hombre trabajador que disfruta de su negocio y de obtener un medio de vida para sacar adelante a su familia. El se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra, desde hace más de 5 años pues ha sido una gran experiencia para el mantener este negocio y proporcionarle a sus hijos lo necesario. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues para él y el desarrollo de su negocio son muy importantes. Actualmente con este crédito comprara latas, botellas, abanicos, láminas de zinc entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Diego is a hard-working man who enjoys working in his business which helps him to get his family ahead in life.  His business is buying and selling scrap metal.  He has been in this business for more than 5 years.  It has been a great experience for him to keep his business going and provide his children with what they need.

This is not the first time that Diego has taken a loan.  Loans are very important for him and his business.  He will use this loan to buy cans, bottles, fans, corrugated metal, etc.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Amelia Sabrina

texts.es:
Amelia Sabrina V. F. tiene 28 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y con los hijos, vive en el cantón  Ventanas en la Provincia de los ríos. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. ESFUERZO Y TRABAJO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Campos Grandes perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Amelia Sabrina se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac, y  vende en la feria en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es llegar a comprar una casa.

Le gusta bailar.
texts.en:
Amelia Sabrina V. F. is 28. She is in a common-law marriage and lives with her partner and children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. She has 5 children.

The members of the V.R.C. Esfuerzo y Trabajo ["Effort and Work"] are located in the Campos Grandes neighbourhood belonging to the Pueblo Viejo Canton. The members of this bank have long worked in short-cycle agricultural labour, sowing corn and rice.

Amelia Sabrina has worked in agriculture, sowing corn and rice, for two years. She buys her products in Agripac and sells them in the market in the same area.

She is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural tools and fertilizers for cultivating corn and rice. In supporting this loan, you will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to buy a house.

She enjoys dancing.

loans.use: the purchase of agricultural tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Jovit

texts.en: Jovit A. is from the village of Turkan, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 27 years old and single. To make a living, Jovit owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. Jovit has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2011, Jovit joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovit is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jovit from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Orden y trabajo, son las virtudes de Gladys, una mujer de 48 años. Su familia lo conforma sus 4 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos, en su casa propia ubicada en La Merced (selva central peruana). La venta de productos de belleza, es la actividad a la que se dedica desde hace 8 años; en todo este tiempo logró obtener muchos clientes, quienes constantemente le hacen pedidos de cremas faciales, perfumes, bloqueadores y demás accesorios. Gracias a las facilidades de pago que ofrece, todos sus clientes están contentos con ella, pero afirma que tiene dificultades para cobrar. Pues hace unos meses comenzó a trabajar para el estado peruano, en la cobranza ambulatoria  de los comerciantes. Por esa razón, desea instalar una cabaña turística, donde pueda contratar un personal para que le ayude en la venta de sus productos y demás artículos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las optimistas”, y este es el sexto crédito que tiene con MFP, donde demuestra responsabilidad, ya que es la secretaria de su asociación. Gladys, comenzará la  construcción de la cabaña, por ello con el crédito solicitado, está pensando comprar los insumos necesarios. Así podrá vender aretes, ropa, y productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Organization and hard work are the virtues that Gladys exhibits. She is a 48 year old woman. Her family consists of four children, but only two of them still live with her in their home in La Merced (which is in the central Peruvian jungle). Gladys has been selling beauty products for eight years. Throughout that time, she has been able to acquire many customers who constantly place orders for facial creams, perfumes, sunscreens, and other accessories. Thanks to the payment options she offers, all of her customers are happy with her yet she still has difficulties collecting payments. A few months ago, Gladys started working for the Peruvian state government as a traveling debt collector assigned to the merchants. For this reason, she wants to establish a tourist stand so that she can hire an employee to help with the sale of her products and other articles from her existing business.

Gladys is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Optimistas” (The Optimists). This is her sixth loan with MFP. She has demonstrated responsibility through her service as secretary of her association. Gladys will begin the construction of her stand, so the loan she requested will be used to buy the necessary supplies. This will enable her to have a place where she can sell earrings, clothing, and beauty products.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials so that she can build a stand for her business

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Mrs. Somaly K. is 23 years old and her husband, Mr. Samnang Un, is 29 years old.  They have been married since 2005 and have two daughters. They live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Somaly sells Nom Pum in her village. Nom Pum is a kind of Cambodian cake. Her husband is both a lotus farmer and a fisherman. She assists him in the farming business when she is free.

Somaly is asking for her first loan of $700 to help with her husband’s farming and to buy a fishing boat.

loans.use: To farm and buy a fishing boat

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene B. is from the town of District 1, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is 36 years old. Arlene is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Arlene has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arlene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale . This loan will be the second loan taken out by Arlene from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia M., 60, is a married woman living in Surallah, South Cotabato with her family. 

She is a farmer and has been growing rice for 30 years. She earns about 3,000 PHP per month from this farming. 

She requested a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. Lydia works hard to improve her business and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Selfa

texts.en:
Selfa is a married woman with three school-going children. They live in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and food for the family.
For the past five years, Selfa has operated a fresh water sales business, selling wholesale, at the market and from door to door. The major business challenge she faces is the high cost of transportation and seasonality in her business. She dreams of owning a matatu (public motor vehicle) in the future. With her loan of 20,000 KES she wants to pay school fees for her child. She decided to work with Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia tiene 50 años, natural del distrito de Kimbiri; está casada con Pedro de 57 años y juntos viven en su propia casa con sus 05 hijos, en la comunidad de Villa Quintiarina caserío del distrito de Kimbiri. Eugenia y su pareja son el pilar de su familia, desde muy niña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la chacra, posee su propia parcela de 15 hectáreas en donde cultiva cacao, plátano y maní. Han transcurrido 23 años trabajando en esta actividad y considera que le gusta recolectar los frutos; pues de esa manera recibe la recompensa gracias al esfuerzo que dio a sus plantas, sin embargo lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio de la ciudad de san francisco, lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por su cosecha. 
Durante la temporada de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, además de los jornaleros que contrata, para así poder recolectar en menor tiempo sus productos. Por otro lado, Eugenia menciona que hay momentos que no tiene suficiente capital para invertir en su trabajo y pagar a los jornaleros por adelantado para que le ayuden en esta actividad que demanda mucho esfuerzo, es por ello que acude a los préstamos que facilita la institución MFP. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantaciones de cacao porque cuenta con espacio suficiente en su parcela. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una socia responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, contratará jornaleros para que le brinden el apoyo en la recolección de frutos.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 50 years old and a native of Kimbiri.  She is married to 57 year old Pedro and they live together in their own home in the Villa Quintiarina settlement of the Kimbiri district, along with their five children.

Eugenia and her husband are the pillars of their family.  Her parents taught her how to work the land when she was a little girl and now she has 15 hectares of her own, where she raises cacao, banana, and peanuts.  She’s been doing this for 23 years and enjoys collecting the fruits of her labor.  In this way she receives the reward, thanks to the effort she puts into her crops.  Never the less, the most difficult part is transporting her products to their point of sale in the city of San Francisco, where she can sell her harvest for better prices.

During the harvest season, she’s able to get some help from her children, and also hires field hands, in order to be able to collect the crops quicker.  She also tells us that there are times when she doesn’t have enough capital to invest into her work and pay the field hands in advance, so that they will help with this hard work.  This is why she has seen fit to request this loan though MFP.

At this time her biggest priority is to plant her cacao crops, because she has enough space in her fields.  This will be her 12th loan through MFP and she has always been on time with her payments.  She expects to be on time this time as well.  The will use the 2,000 PEN from this loan to hire field hands to help her collect her fruits.

loans.use: to hire field hands

loans.name: Kishegyere Kwetungura Group B, Kihihi

texts.en:
Ephraim B. is the leader of Kishegyere Kwetungura group B in Kihihi. He is 37 years old and married with four children, all school-going. 

He is an agriculturalist involved in tea farming. He has been selling tea leaves to the Kayonza Tea factory in Kishegyere for over 10 years. 

Previously, Ephraim was involved in the sale of coffee and cows, and the tea growing and selling is an additional business. 

He makes 650,000 KES as profits monthly and he hopes that will grow over time. His plan is to have more acres of tea and have his children educated. 

He says that ever since he started taking loans, his sales have increased and at the moment, he needs a loan to be able to buy manure and pay for labor for his tea farms.

loans.use: To buy manure and pay for labor for his tea farms.

loans.name: Heriknaz

texts.en: Heriknaz is from the village of Gtashen in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with two sons (twenty-three and twenty-five years old).  Heriknaz has a high school education and has been engaged in farming for the past twenty-five years.  In addition to supporting her family she helps relatives with produce grown on her farm.  Heriknaz is looking for a loan to purchase livestock.  She expects her family income to increase by twenty percent with the investment.  She dreams for her grandchildren to live happy, healthy lives and hopes to expand her business.  She enjoys the nature of her village and the farming life.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Felicita Gloria

texts.es: Felicita trabaja como docente de primaria desde hace 9 años, ademas cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que tambien es docente. Está solicitando su 4to  crèdito con el objetivo de comprar materiales de construciòn para construccion de la cocina y de esta manera tener mejores condiciones en su hogar.  Es muy reconocida por su dedicaciòn, responsabilidad y buenos principios.  Espera seguir contando con el apoyo de AFODENIC, pues gracias a los creditos que le ha financiado ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Felicita has worked as a primary teacher for 9 years. In addition, she has the support of her husband, who is also a teacher. She is applying for her fourth loan, with the goal of buying construction materials for the construction of the kitchen and in this way having better conditions in her home. She is well recognized for her dedication, responsibility, and good principles. She hopes to continue counting on the support of AFODENIC, since thanks to the loans that have financed her, she has improved her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Jeune dame de 35ans, Afi a commencé par vendre des céréales depuis 1998. Elle s’approvisionne à ANIE et revend au marché d’Akodessewa. Elle veut renforcer son activité. Elle a 01 enfant et son mari est gendarme.
texts.en: A 35-year-old woman, Afi began selling grains in 1998. She gets her supplies in ANIE and re-sells at the Akodessewa market. She wants to bolster her business. She has one child, and her husband is a policeman.

loans.use: to buy grains

loans.name: Rauben

texts.en: Rauben is a 25-year-old married man with one child and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling sodas and beer for eight years. He got his capital from selling coffee. His hardship is the high transport costs and his vision is a large-scale retail shop plus a well-educated family. Rauben needs a loan to buy sodas and beer to sell.

loans.use: To buy sodas and beer to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa, age 62, is a widow with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs, a business in which she has been engaged for a year now. She earns an additional income from food vending.

Teresa is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia (42 años), casada con Virgilio (43 años), tiene  4 hijos. Viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Desde hace varios años, Sonia se dedica al negocio de abarrotes en general,  debido a que en su barrio no existía una tienda. Actualmente viene obteniendo buenas ganancias económicas con respecto a años anteriores. Generalmente su horario de trabajo es a partir de las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 8: 00 de la noche, ya que recibe una cantidad considerable de clientes. La ayuda de sus hijos le permite una atención rápida de los clientes. Mayormente ella vende productos de primera necesidad para el hogar, por ello se siente contenta y satisfecha por lo que viene realizando. Su proyecto a futuro es abrir otra tienda  con la finalidad de obtener mejores ingresos económicos para el bienestar de su familia. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Ella está feliz por formar parte de su banco comunal. Con los  2000 nuevos soles que solicita, podrá amueblar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Sonia, 42, is married to Virgilio, 43 and has four children.  They live in their own house located in Pichari District.  For several years now, Sonia has been in the grocery business because her neighborhood did not have a grocery store.  Currently, she’s earning good profits compared to prior years.  

Generally, she starts work at 6am and goes until 8pm since she usually gets quite a large number of customers.  Help from her children allows her to take care of customers quickly.  For the most part, she sells basic need items for the home and she feels satisfied and happy with the work she’s doing.  Her future project is to open another store hoping to earn still better profits for her family’s wellbeing.

This is her second MFP loan so she commits to make her installment payments punctually.  She is happy to be part of her communal bank.  She will use the requested 2000 new soles to better equip her store.

loans.use: to buy shelving for her store.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 30-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her dream is to build her own house.

She owns a boutique, and has been in business for five years. She started by first working as an attendant, got capital and started her own business. Her main challenge has been the high prices of commodities, but she believes with hard work, she will be successful. Rose needs the loan to buy blankets, carpets and bed covers to sell.

loans.use: To buy blankets, carpets and bed covers to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 48 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has three children; one child is currently in school. Margret has a small retail shop, which she has had for two years. She owns rental houses as her second business.  

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like soap and sugar for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Margret hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Margret hopes to expand her business.  

Margret is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her standards of living.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like soap and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is a 39-year-old married man and father of five lovely children. He opened a grocery store three years ago and he's working hard on improving it as much as he can. Haidar is a hardworking man. His store is his only source of living. That's why it has to be going perfectly, to cover all of his family's expanses and at the same time to develop itself.

Haidar is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to increase his tobacco capital in addition to canned products, which are highly requested in the autumn/winter season. That's because most of the villagers stay at home during this season and eat canned food most of the time.

Haidar is a motivated person. This is his second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. His previous loan was invested in his business and had a positive impact. This loan will sure to be the same, since he plans exactly what he needs to achieve. 

One of his future plans is to turn his grocery store into a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To purchase tobacco and canned products for his store

loans.name: Ernestina Del Socorro

texts.es: Ernestina Del Socorro tiene 51 años, su actividad es una pulpería y venta de comida. Hace más de 34 años que tiene este negocio, inicio porque tenía que sacar adelante a sus hijos fue madre soltera y la necesidad de proporcionarles a sus hijos vestimenta, salud y educación. El motivo del crédito es para invertirlo en la compra gaseosas, granos básicos, detergentes, fósforos, cigarrillos y otros productos.
texts.en: 51-year-old Ernestina Del Socorro runs a small grocery store and sells food. She has had this business for more than 34 years, and started it because she was a single mother who had to bring up her children and provide clothing, healthcare and education for them. This loan will be used to invest in buying soft drinks, grains, detergents, matches, cigarettes and other products.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, grains, detergents, matches, cigarettes and other products for her store.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a focused businesswoman aged 28. She is married and blessed with four children. For the last two years, she has been operating a mobile-phone money transfer business and also sells phone accessories to make a living. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy phone accessories for resale.

loans.use: To buy phone accessories.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 50 years old and has 5 children. Leonila is married and has 3 children who are in school and the other 2 children work to help the family.

Leonila is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Leonila requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and feeds for her pigs.

Leonila has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leonila would like to save enough money so she could continue the education of her 3 children.

loans.use: To buy vitamins and feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Playa Azul Group

texts.es:
El grupo esta conformado por tres personas que es don Efraín, Natacha y doña María de Jesús el nombre del grupo lo eligió don Efraín y una hermana que se encontraba en el crédito, don Efraín estuvo un tiempo en la playa y le gusto mucho y la hermana le gustaba mucho el color azul por eso el nombre de “Playa Azul”, los 3 integrantes del grupo son familiares.
Don Efraín que es el representante del grupo tiene 42 años de edad esta casado desde hace 11 años con la señora María Minerva juntos han procreado un hijo Néstor Hugo tiene ya 14 años el se encuentra estudiando la secundaria.
El tiene un negocio de tacos el cual lo pone todas las tardes, de 8:00 pm hasta que vea que se termino su comida o cuando ve que ya no hay clientes en el negocio lleva ya tres años de experiencia el puesto de tacos tiene como nombre “Antojitos de la abuelita” en todo este tiempo no ha tenido ninguna dificultad para sobre llevar el negocio solo cuando bajan las ventas, pero el cometa que es algo muy normal ya que cuando hay crisis la clientela no tiene dinero para consumir.
Esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comprar productos para su negocio como refrescos, jugos, condimentos para la comida, como cilantro, jitomates, aceite, cebollas, limón, tortillas, carne y otras cosas que por el momento no recuerda.
La meta de don Efraín, Natacha y doña María de Jesús es que el negocio crezca y poder llegar ha tener otro puesto de tacos, pero lo primero es mejorara  la calidad  de artículos en su negocio.
Ellos están muy agradecidos con el apoyo que FRAC y KIVA le otorgan ya que es de gran ayuda para sobre salir en la vida.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three people – Don Efraín, Natacha and Doña María de Jesús. Don Efraín and his sister, who is part of the loan, chose the name of the group – Don Efraín went to the beach once and really liked it and his sister loved the color blue and this why they called it “Playa Azul” [Blue Beach]. The three members of the group are part of the same family.

Don Efraín, who is the group representative, is 42 years old. He has been married to Señora María Minerva for 11 years. They have a child together called Néstor Hugo, who is 14 years old and a high school student. Don Efraín has a taco business which he runs every evening from 8.00 pm until he either, runs out of food or there are no more customers. The taco stand is called “Antojitos de la abuelita” [Grandma’s antojitos]. He has three years experience and in all this time he hasn’t had any difficulties, except when sales are down but he says that this is quite normal since when there is a crisis, customers can’t afford to eat.

This time he has requested the loan to buy products for his business such as soft drinks, juices and condiments like coriander, tomatoes, oil, onions, limes, tortillas, meat and other things that he can’t remember right now.

The goal that Don Efraín, Natacha and Doña María de Jesús have is for the business to grow and to be able to have another taco stand but firstly they just want to improve the quality of their business.

They are very grateful for the support that FRAC and KIVA have given to them, as it is a great help for getting ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, juices and condiments such as coriander, tomatoes, oil, onions, limes, tortillas and meat.

loans.name: Emma Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Emma Rosa de 38 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 14 años de edad, quienes están estudiando en la escuela,  vive en una aldea de Ceguaca, Santa Bárbara tiene 15 años de casada.
Desde hace un año, Emma estableció un negocio de elaboración y venta de tajadas de plátano, en esta comunidad.  Anteriormente lo tenía en San Pedro Sula y lo inicio con fondos propios. Ahora que vive en esta comunidad le va mejor ya que nadie más hace esta actividad y tiene mucha demanda. Además le sale más rentable porque en la zona se consigue el plátano mas barato y gana más. El negocio es administrado por ella y su esposo. Tiene la oportunidad de vender en las pulperías de la comunidad y alrededores.
Este es su primer préstamo y lo utiliza para comprar insumos para elaborar el producto como  es el plátano, sal barbacoa y sal saborizada, bolsas y aceite.
texts.en:
Emma Rosa, 38, has two children who are 11 and 14 years old and are going to school.  She lives in village in Ceguaca, Santa Bárbara; she’s been married for 15 years.

A year ago Emma started making and selling fried banana chips in this community.  She used to do so in San Pedro Sula and she started it with funds of her own.  Now she lives in this community and she does better because no one else does this same activity and she is in high demand.  Besides, it’s more profitable because the bananas are less expensive here so profits are higher.  She and her husband run the business.  She has the opportunity to sell to local and nearby grocery stores.

This is her first loan and she will use it to buy ingredients needed to make her product like bananas, barbecue salt, flavored salt, bags and oil.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make banana chips like salt, bags, bananas and oil.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. For the past two years, Faith has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Faith has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase supplies for resale and will help Faith to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself. Faith hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Faith is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to offering micro-finance loans, the program provides a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Faith's future prospects by helping her improve her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for resale.

loans.name: Gumyumutima Group

texts.fr:
Espérance est une commerçante âgée de 32 ans qui habite la localité de Mutobo en Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle est vendeuse  de bananes depuis 8ans, un métier qu’elle a commencé alors qu’elle était cultivatrice. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 6 è année  primaire. Elle est mariée à Prosper et ont ensemble 3 enfants qui n’ont encore atteint l’âge de scolarité.
Son crédit Kiva de 120,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient va  lui permettre d’augmenter son capital pour acheter une grande quantité de bananes à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et accroitre ses économies 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire GUMYUMUTIMA
texts.en:
Hope is a 32-year-old retail merchant who lives in the town of Gitega, part of the Province of Mutobo in the center of the country.

She has been retailing bananas for the past eight years, a trade she started when she was crop farming. She attended school up to the 6th grade. She is married to Prosper with whom she had three children, all under school age.

Kiva's credit loan of 120,000 Burundian francs will enable her to increase her capital and buy large quantities of bananas for retail sales, in order to realize large profits and increase her savings. She is a member of the Gumyumutima community group.

loans.use: increase her working capital to buy large quantities of bananas for retail sales in order to realize large profits and increase her savings

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is separated with four children. 

Edgar has a food shop that sells viands like chicken barbecue, fried chicken & "halang-halang". He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

Edgar has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Edgar hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

loans.name: Laurah

texts.en: Laurah used her previous loan to buy salt, sugar and rice for resale and managed to use her profits to start up a new business selling clothes along side her retail shop.Her challenge has been price flactuations and inflation, customers not paying on time and high fuel and transportation costs. Laurah needs the loan to buy salt, sugar and rice for resale since the demand is high during this season.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, and rice for resale

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en: Sitha, 44 is widowed, and resides with her mother and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. This is an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples: Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey, etc). She sells food and drinks in front of the Siem Reap district hospital. This business is the only source of income to support the family. In order to generate extra income, Sitha requests a loan of USD to purchase a motorbike to use in her business. In the future, she would like to run another food store for her daughter, renew her house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to use in her business.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is a 47-year-old woman. She and her husband make money by sewing clothes, and they have done this for ten years. They have two daughters and live together in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Huong would like to take out a loan to buy sewing materials and fabrics. This will increase her productive capacity and allow her to make more clothing. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and set aside some savings for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and fabrics.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
Maria del Carmen is an active entrepreneur. She is 56 years old and married with two children who are the driving force in her life. Her husband has worked as a security guard for the past six years. However, her husband\'s income does not cover all the family expenses. Therefore, two years ago Maria del Carmen decided to start her own business selling bedding and decorative pictures to support her husband and allow her children to study. In the beginning she only sold her products among her relatives but soon she began selling to her neighbors and friends. Her group of clients has grown. Today many people know her and look for her to order her products.

She is requesting for a loan for $475 USD to purchase merchandise such as bedspreads, sheets and decorative pictures that her clients have been requesting. She plans to repay the loan within 6-12 months. You can contribute to Carmen\'s growth and support her with her loan.

** Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch:

Ser emprendedora y activa son las características principales de Maria del Carmen, ella es una mujer de 56 años, casada y tiene dos hijos que son el motor de su vida. Su esposo trabaja como vigilante en una empresa de seguridad desde hace seis años, sin embargo, el ingreso de su esposo era insuficiente para cubrir los gastos de la familia, esta fue la razón por la cual Maria del Carmen se decidió a iniciar su negocio de venta de colchas y cuadros decorativos desde hace dos años, para de esta manera apoyar a su esposo y poder brindarle a sus hijos la posibilidad de estudiar. Al principio vendía solo a sus familiares y poco después fue ofreciendo mercancía a sus vecinos y amigos y fue así como empezó a crecer su clientela, hoy en día mucha gente la conoce y la busca solicitándole sus productos.

Ella esta requiriendo de un préstamo por $ 475 USD para la compra de mercancías como colchas y sabanas así como cuadros que últimamente le han solicitado mucho sus clientes, ella piensa pagar el préstamo en un plazo de 6-12 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de Carmen y apóyala con su préstamo.

loans.use: purchase merchandise such as bedding and decorations.

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is divorced with two children. She lives with her family in Nikopol, a city in the central part of the Ukraine. After college, Alla decided to work as a market vendor so she started her own business selling women’s blouses and shirts in the local market. Alla received her first loan for $500 from “Nadiya Ukraine” and paid it back in six months. She has received and promptly repaid 20 loans since then. Her perseverance and enthusiasm along with access to financial resources have helped her small business grow and be successful. Alla is requesting a loan of $1,200 to increase her turnover capital. She is planning to invest in seasonal French cuff shirts, knit tops, tunics, tanks, camisoles and short sleeve silk blouses which she can get at low wholesale prices. Alla believes that a wide assortment of clothing items will help her meet her customer’s needs and provide superior service. Satisfied customers will be more likely to return to buy from her kiosk and will also speak positively about her business to others, leading to further growth in her sales.

Алла - розлучена, в неї двоє дітей. Вона з родиною живе в місті Нікополі, яке знаходиться в центральній частині України. Закінчивши університет, Алла вирішила піти торгувати на ринок, почала власний бізнес з продажу жіночих блузок та сорочок на місцевому ринку. Алла отримала першу позику в 500 доларів від „Надії України” та сплатила її за шість місяців. З того часу вона отримала та сплатила вже 20 позик. Її наполегливість та ентузіазм у поєднанні з фінансовою підтримкою допомогли її бізнесу зрости та досягти успіху. Алла просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб збільшити свій зворотній капітал. Вона планує закупити сезонні сорочки, в’язані жилетки, туніки, жакети та шовкові блузки з короткими рукавами за оптовими цінами. Алла вважає, що широкий асортимент одягу допоможе їй краще задовольняти потреби покупців та обслуговувати їх. Задоволені клієнти не тільки обов’язково повернуться до неї по покупки, але й позитивно озиватимуться про її бізнес, що, в свою чергу, призведе до подальшого розвитку торгівлі.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Rasmey

texts.en:
Rasmey was married in 2004 and has one daughter. She learned to weave from her mother in 2000. She finished her studies in year 8. She is currently producing silk products and selling soft drinks at home, but she also spends time to plant vegetable such as tomatoes and cucumbers.

She has borrowed loans from MAXIMA for 3 cycles. The current loan amount is $500. She will use this loan to buy silk materials for $366. In addition, she also will use some of this loan to purchase sewing thread and buy some soft drinks.

Since she borrowed money from MAXIMA, her family is getting better from day to day. They are sure to have the capacity to repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials & sewing thread and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy glass display cases

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en:
S. Vidadi is a low-income inhabitant of Beylagan district, Azerbaijan.
He is 49, married, and has 5 children. Vidadi used to work as a foreman in this mill. He has got 11 years of experience in this business. Recently he started to rent this mill from the owner and continue the business himself. He has 4 employees. They buy wheat from Beylagan farmers and produce flour as raw material for bread production. S. is applying for the first time to Normicro for a loan of US$ 1200 to buy wheat to increase flour production.

loans.use: to buy wheat to increase production of flour

loans.name: Faaatualoa

texts.en: Faaatualoa is a sixty-three year old lady with three children; her husband died five years ago. Despite her respectable age, she still runs her baking business. She sells baked goods at a local school, as well as in a shop in the village, and is very happy about the success of her business so far. Faaatualoa is asking for a loan of US$475 to buy ingredients needed for her bakery such as flour, sugar, yeast and a new oven burner.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients and supplies for a bakery

loans.name: Saronik

texts.id:
Gathering recyclable materials is Saronik’s zealous occupation. This activity of collecting recyclable materials is from people with returns. The materials are weighed and paid for by Saronik then turned into recyclable and resold to factory. With a leased land of 2.5 acre, Saronik can store plenty recyclable materials obtained. This effort provides acceptable profits to cover living expenses including paying for the lease of the land.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Mengumpulkan barang-barang bekas adalah pekerjaan yang ditekuni oleh Saronik. Usahanya menampung barang-barang bekas yang didapatkan oleh para pemulung. Barang-barang tersebut ditimbang kemudian di bayar oleh Saronik dan nantinya akan diolah untuk dijadikan bahan daur ulang yang kemudian dijual lagi ke pabrik-pabrik. Dengan mengontrak tanah seluas 2,5 are saronik dapat menampung banyak barang bekas yang didapatkan dari para pemulung. Usaha ini menurutnya dapat memberikan keuntungan yang lumayan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidup termasuk biaya untuk mengontrak tanah.

loans.use: Capital to purchase recyclable materials from people with returns (Modal untuk membeli barang bekas dari para pemulung)

loans.name: Kumri

texts.en:
Kumri is 45 years old. She and her husband, an artist, raised four children. All of their children are married.

For 15 years Kumri has run her own business. In the largest local market she has a store that sells children's clothing. The store is located in the center of the market. Kumri is very nice and polite, which allows her to easily grow her client base. Kumri is trying to diversify the range of goods that she sells, and thus satisfy the tastes of clients with various levels of income.

Kumri has been working with IMON for about one year. She managed her previous loans accurately and precisely. Today, Kumri requests $700.00 USD in order to buy children's clothing for the winter season. Kumri thanks everyone who supports her and promises to repay the loan in 6 months

loans.use: To purchase new children's clothing to sell for the winter season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase accessories and products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Thi Duong

texts.vi: Mrs. Dương, who is 35 years old, successfully turned her first loan into a thriving fish farm, in addition to her raising of ducks and pigs. She currently makes her money by selling duck eggs and fish at the local market. Mrs. Dương prefers Kiva's weekly repayment system because it allows her with her extra money to buy more feed for the animals. She now earns $6.35 USD a day. | Chị Dương, 35 tuổi, đã vay vốn của ngân hàng để thầu ao thả cá, đồng thời gia đình chị còn chăn nuôi vịt và lợn. Để có thu nhập hàng ngày, chị đã phải đi lấy trứng và cá bán lấy lãi, chị thấy trả tiền hàng tuần rất thích hợp với số tiền kiếm được 100000đồng/ngày mà lại có một khoản lớn để mua thức ăn cho cá, vịt, lợn nên chị đã đăng ký và tham gia vào chương trình.

loans.use: Farming animals | Chăn nuôi thả cá

loans.name: Ramón Isidro

texts.es:
Ramón T. is a native of the municipality of El Sauce, in the city of León. Ever since he was young, he has raised animals. This is the only business he has ever worked in. He has his own cattle, and little by little over time he has been improving and expanding the business with the goal of improving his family´s standard of living and continuing to pay for his childrens´ education.

Ceprodel has been a fundamental part of Mr. T.´s ranching business for the fact of having provided loans which have been used to purchase calves and pregnant cows. Today, once again, Ramón faces this need, but he trusts that his loan will be granted to that he can help his business and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Ramón T. es un caballero originario del municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León. Se dedica desde su juventud a la crianza de animales siendo el único negocio al que se dedica teniendo su propio ganado que poco a poco a través del tiempo lo ha venido mejorando y ampliando con la visión de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y continuar manteniendo los estudios de sus hijos.

Ceprodel ha sido un elemento fundamental en el negocio ganadero del señor T. por el hecho de que le ha brindado créditos que han sido utilizados para la compra del Ganado como vaquillas y vacas en preñes. Hoy en día una ves mas esta es la necesidad que atraviesa el señor Ramón pero confía en que su crédito le será otorgado para beneficio de su negocio y su familia.

loans.use: Purchase cattle.

loans.name: Yulin Hok Group

texts.en: Mrs. Yulin H. is the group leader of six members in Prey Pouch Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a 62-year-old housewife whose husband, Mr. Nhan S., a bicycle repairer, provides the family’s only income.  Unfortunately, he does not have enough money to purchase an air pump for his business, so Mrs. Yulin H. is requesting a loan to purchase one.
