She and her husband live in an old house and try to support their standard of living together.

loans.use: To buy an air pump for her husband's business.

loans.name: Eyvaz

texts.en:
Eyvaz A., 51, has been a dairy and cattle farmer for more than twenty years. He is married and has three sons. They all live in a small village in the Saatli region.

He is requesting a loan to purchase two calves and one dairy cow. Eyvaz believes this purchase will help him make more money during the summer as it is high season for weddings, and meals from meat is very popular at these events.

loans.use: To purchase two calves and one dairy cow

loans.name: Danira Vaa

texts.en:
Danira Vaa P., 20, is married with 2 children. She has 2 year's experience in the vegetable farming business. She sells to the village people and 4 days per week.

Danira has 1 previous loan from SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Danira’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. This loan will be used to buy fences, gromozones, fertilizers and vegetable seeds of different kinds. Any remaining money will be used to repair her house. Her husband who works in New Zealand has also helped in financing the family.

loans.use: To buy fences, gromozones, fertilizers and vegetable seeds of different kinds.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Prak S., age 48, is a grocery vendor in front of her house, since 2006, and she lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. On average, she makes around $15 in revenue each day. Her husband works making traditional drums to sell to the dealers. He makes $6 per day. This couple has six children, two of whom are students; two others work selling souvenirs in front of the temple; and the other two help their father make drums.

Mrs. S. would like to loan from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, to invest in her family business as following: First, add grocery inventory. Second, purchase more souvenirs for her children to sell, and use the rest to repair her house. In the future, she wants has a bigger store for selling groceries in the village.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and souvenirs for her children to sell, and to repair the house.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.

Antonia es casada, tiene 48 años y 5 hijos, Antonia tiene un puesto en el mercado Playa Grau, un mercado céntrico de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Antonia vende cereales variados, enteros, molidos, sus productos lo compra del mercado de abastos, sus ventas lo realiza de lunes a jueves durante todo el día, y los días viernes y domingos viaja a la feria de Vinchos en donde compra cereales, quesos, animales que beneficia en su casa y luego lo vende a sus vecinas, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijas.

Antonia necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz, trigo, arveja, haba. Los sueños de Antonia son tener una tienda en su casa, mejorar su negocio y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the Rainbow Communal Bank.

Antonia is married. She is 48 years old and has 5 children. Antonia has a spot in the Playa Grau market, a central market in the city of Ayacucho. Antonia sells a variety of whole, ground grains. Her products are purchased in the market and her sales are done Monday to Thursday throughout the whole day. Fridays and Sundays she travels to the market in Vinchos where she buys grains, cheeses, and animals that benefit her house and later she sells them to her neighbors, with which her children help.

Antonia needs a loan of 1800 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of corn, wheat, peas and beans. Antonia's dreams are to have a store in her house, to improve her business and to buy a car.


Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, wheat, peas and beans

loans.name: Mamuroy

texts.en:
Mamuroy N. is a small entrepreneur from Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She is divorced with four children. Her children are the reason for her daily fight for a better life. Being the only bread winner in the family, she sells clothing for teenagers in one of the famous local markets known as the Central Market.

Mamuroy is a very hard-working woman. She always achieves her goals and overcomes different challenges with natural optimism. She is requesting a loan of $900 USD for the term of 18 months to re-stock her inventory. She is hoping to purchase more merchandise at affordable wholesale prices for further retail sale.

Mamuroy's only dream is to ensure her children have a good education and to make them happy. We believe Mamuroy’s integrity and the consistent growth of her venture in the past years can guarantee further stable expansion of her trade and timely loan repayment. The well-being of this family is in your hands.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to re-stock her inventory

loans.name: Mame Yacine

texts.fr: Mame Yacine D., 50 ans est mariée et mère de 05 enfants avec 3 autres à sa charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Pire Gourèye depuis 7 ans. Elle achète du tissu (bazin) pour faire des draps de lit à vendre. Elle vend aussi des jus de fruit qu’elle prépare à base de pain de singe, de bissap et de sucre. Elle veut renforcer son commerce. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b>
texts.en:
Mame Yacine D., 50, is married and the mother of 5 children with 3 others for whom she is responsible. She has been a member of the village bank of Pire Gourèye for 7 years. She buys lengths of cloth ("bazin," a form of damask) to make sheets for sale. She also sells fruit juice that she prepares with monkey bread (the fruit of the baobab tree,) hibiscus flowers, and sugar. She wants to bolster her businesses.

The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of sheets and fruit juice

loans.name: Zakhir

texts.en: Zakhir is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, settled in the Fuzuli region, Bala Bahmanli village. He was born in 1967. Five years ago he started breeding poultry. He is married with 3 children. Now he needs a loan to buy more poultry.

loans.use: To buy more poultry

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia S. sells fish which she buys from the fishermen. She brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale. She also owns a grocery store which she relies on when the fishing season is over at Asem near Abura. Sophia has received vocational education which is equivalent to senior high. She is a single parent and has 1 child.

Sophia has been selling fish since 2005. She is responsible for paying the daily expenses of the family, including utility bills. Her loan will be used as additional capital to buy more cartons of fish for re-sale and also increase the stock of groceries for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further expand her business to improve her income.

loans.use: additional capital to buy more cartons of fish for re-sale

loans.name: Changreth

texts.en: Mrs. Changreth T. is a farmer in Phao Chu Kiet village in Kampong Cham province. In her plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crop. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Changreth T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field; she plans to use the rest of the loan to buy fuel for a pump to water the field. She is a 45-year-old widow with a child who is a farmer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fuel for a pump to water the field

loans.name: Norboi

texts.ru: Норбой мужчина в возрасте 44 лет , отец пятерых детей, жена работает в колхозе на хлопковом поле.Норбой молодости занимается откормом скота, через 5-6 месяцев когда скота готов к продаже  , т.е. к убою,Норбой выводит на продажу на рынок , а в замен покупает худой молодой скот.Сейчас у него дома 30 баранов.Узнав от друзей о выдаче кредитов на животноводство, он тоже решил обратится к нам.
texts.en:
Norboi is a 44-year-old married man and a father of five. His wife works at the cotton field of a collective farm. Since his youth, Norboi has been raising cattle. He sells the animals after raising them for 5-6 months and purchases younger ones. At present, Norboi has 30 sheep. He learned of this loan opportunity from his friends and decided to apply.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Jargalsayhan

texts.en:
Jargalsayhan A. is a married woman who has five children. Her two eldest children are university students. The three younger children attend elementary school. Her family lives in Uvurhangay province. Uvurhangai is a southern province, located 400 km from the capital city, Ulaanbaatar.

Together with her husband, she has been running a clothing business at the local market in a stall owned by her family since 2003. Their stall is located outside of the local market that runs year-round. She is the sole breadwinner of her entire family. Thanks to her cheerful, open and friendly personality, she has many repeat customers.

Jargalsayhan has been a XacBank customer (XacBank is a Kiva's partner microfinance institution in Mongolia) for the past 4 years. This is her fifth loan with the bank, and she has a perfect credit history with no overdue payments. The loans she takes help her to expand her clothing business, thereby increasing her income. With this loan, Jargalsayhan plans to invest in more clothes to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy more clothes to increase business inventory

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en: Mrs. Emeliana P., 62 years old, lives in Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with 7 children. Her greatest desire is to continually support her family through her nipa weaving business. In order to have additional capital, she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in July 2008. Recently, she applied for a PHP 7,000 loan to buy additional nipa. She plans to open a “sari-sari” store someday for added income.

loans.use: To buy nipa leaves for nipa weaving

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita and Alfredo G. have been married for 11 years and they have not had a child because of a major operation that Perlita needed for an ovarian cyst. She and her husband have adopted a child. They are now living together at Barangay Tandul Cabatuan, Isabela. She has promised to treat this boy as her own child and send him to school to earn a college degree through God's grace.

She has been managing a small village store for a year and she is earning an average of 600 PHP a day. She saves some of it to use as rolling capital for her business. She hopes to borrow 5000 PHP to build a more concrete and safe stall for her store. Perlita is doing her best to increase her business capital and to sustain it, for the future of her adopted child and for the welfare of her whole family.

loans.use: Investment in small store

loans.name: Zuera

texts.en:
Zuera A. is thirty years old, single and independent. She loves fashion very much and as a result, she sells costume jewelry like earrings, necklaces and ladies' bags. She has been selling jewelry for the past 8 years.

Zuera buys her goods from Accra and Togo. She hawks her goods from house to house and also treks to nearby markets to sell. Zuera wants to use the loan to buy costume jewelry in bulk so she can trek to other markets. She is in a group called ‘shining star’ Trust Bank in her community. The members in the group guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more costume jewelry to sell

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es socia del Bancomunal los Viñedos
Luz es casada tiene 57 años, cuatro hijos de 36, 32, 22 y 14 años este ultimo esta estudiando en la escuela estatal. 
Luz  tenía una tienda en el mercado central pero por motivos de salud la tuvo que cerrar, y  se dedica a la venta de zapato por catalogo, zapatos de cuero.
Luz necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de calzado de invierno, botas, botines.
Desde que esta en Finca, su visión sobre el negocio se ampliado, tiene nuevas ideas de negocio y quiere verlas realizadas.
El sueño de Luz es que sus hijos sean profesionales, y crecer más en el negocio.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Viñedos community bank. Luz, 57, is married. She has four children ages 36, 32, 22, and 14. The youngest goes to the state school. Luz had a store in the central market. But, for health reasons, she had to close it. She now sells leather shoes by catalog. Luz needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy footwear for the winter, ankle boots, and knee boots. Since she has been with Finca, her vision of her business has grown, she has new business ideas, and she wants to see them become a reality. Her dream is to see her children become professionals and to grow more in the business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy footwear for the winter, ankle boots, and knee boots

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es dueña de un minibús, el cual su esposo lo trabaja para transporte de pasajeros en el sindicato Trans Miraflores.
Vive en la zona de Villa Copacabana Sector Valle hermoso de la ciudad de La Paz, en la casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado para la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehiculo, pues es la fuente de ingresos para la familia.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial la califica como cliente bueno en el pago se sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Lourdes is the owner of a van which her husband uses to transport passengers of the labor union Trans Miraflores. She lives in the Villa Copacabana Sector Valle Hermoso area of the city of La Paz, in the home of her parents. The loan will be used for the repair and maintenance of her vehicle, which is the source of income for her family. This is the second time she is requesting a loan through IMPRO. Her payment record qualifies her as a good customer.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance and repair of her van.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Mme T. est une commercante capitalisant une experience de 2 ans dans le commerce de produit cosmetique.elle a ouvert une boutique a dakar afin de repondre a la demande.elle achete les produits en cote d'ivoire afin de les revendre au senagal. cependant elle dispode de clients potentiels pour vendre ses produits.
texts.en:
Ms. T. is a merchant capitalizing on 2 years of experience in the commerce of cosmetics. She opened a shop in Dakar to respond to the demand. She buys goods in Cote d’Ivoire in order to resell them in Senegal. However, she has potential customers for selling these goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To augment her working capital

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie P. is 25 years old, married and has 3 small children. Their main source of income comes primarily from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. They are from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. Marjorie has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marjorie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marjorie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair her fishing boat. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a fishing boat

loans.name: Khadam Ossian

texts.en:
Khadam Ossian, son of S. A., lives in Kabul, Afghanistan.

He has a family of six, and he owns a shop that sells fuel. Khadam Ossian has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani in order to expand his business.

He is confident that the loan will allow him to increase his business.

loans.use: To expand his retail business, which is a shop that sells fuel.

loans.name: José De La Concepción

texts.es:
El señor José de la Concepción M. es un caballero muy responsable que ha sabido ganarse el pan de cada día por medio del digno trabajo y de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación. Se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos y de juguetes en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua.

La razón por la que ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la mercadería como es juguetes y electrodomésticos y por esto espera muy confiadamente en que será beneficiado con el crédito y logrará satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor José de la Concepción M. is a very responsible gentleman who knows what it means to earn his bread every day by his honest labor and to bring home the bacon to his humble abode. He works selling home appliances and toys in the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua. The reason he has approached CEPRODEL is to seek a loan for the purchase of merchandise such as toys and home appliances. And so he confidently hopes that the loan will be approved and he will be able to satisfy his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Ce monsieur a appris le métier de menuiserie ; mais il n’a pas pu trouver les moyens pour ouvrir son atelier de menuiserie. Pour cette raison, il a pris la décision en 2007 de se lancer dans la vente de produits d’alimentation générale. Il est marié et est père de 03 enfants. Cette activité lui réussit bien dans son quartier d’Awatamé à Lomé. Beaucoup de gens sont contents de venir acheter chez lui à cause du bon accueil qu’il leur réserve souvent. Il a besoin de renouveler son stock ; pour cela, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 10 plateaux d’œufs, 10 boîtes de Spaghetti, 01 sac de farine, des biscuits et des bonbons.
texts.en:
This gentleman learned the trade of carpentry but he was not able to open his own workshop. For this reason, he made the decision in 2007 to begin selling groceries. He is married and the father of 3 children.

This business is going well in his neighborhood of Awatamé in Lomé. Many people are happy to do their shopping with him because he reserves a hearty welcome. He needs to replenish his stock, and for that reason he is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 10 trays of eggs, 10 boxes of spaghetti, 1 sack of flour, some cookies and some candy.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of groceries

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
Hà Nguyễn Thị (20201020048) is a 27 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Hà is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Nghiêm Xá 14 (14).


Hà is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Hà owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  Hà has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Hà joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hà has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.256.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.048.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Hà plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nghiêm Thị H. (20201020049) is a 26 year-old female who is requesting a 5.600.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Nghiêm Thị D. (20201020050) is a 25 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Nghiêm Thị H. (20201020051) is a 30 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Nghiêm Thị L. (20201020052) is a 35 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


5.  Nghiêm Thị Huệ (20201020053) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hà Nguyễn Thị (20201020048) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Hà là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các tH.nh viên.  Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Nghiêm Xá 14 (14).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Hà thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hà kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 2007, Hà đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hà đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.256.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nghiêm Thị H. (20201020049) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.600.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nghiêm Thị D. (20201020050) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Nghiêm Thị H. (20201020051) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Nghiêm Thị L. (20201020052) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  Nghiêm Thị Huệ (20201020053) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Eyima

texts.en: Eyima M. is currently in the business of selling phaste and cold drinks and is requesting a loan to open up a shop.  Eyima is 26 years old and is Married with a husband that is an administrator. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hous for rental purpose BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a shop

loans.name: Sami

texts.en: Sami is a 64-year-old married father of four. He has been working as a taxi driver since 1995 and has been involved in this industry for 20 years. Today, Sami is requesting to borrow $1,000 to perform maintenance on his car after being in bad circumstances.

loans.use: Perform maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Seleman Clementine

texts.en:
Seleman Clementine M. is 30 years old, single, and she lives in Gatsibo district, approximately four hours drive from the capital city of Rwanda.

Seleman is a pharmacist by training and she has had a pharmacy selling a variety of medicines since 2003. She works very hard to make her business a success - a typical day starts at 6 a.m. and ends at 5 p.m. or later.

Seleman is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more variety of medicines needed by the majority of her customers. These medicines are costly but she believes that she will be able to sell them and attract new customers. If successful, this will result in greater profits, which she will likely reinvest in the business as well as take care of her children and continue to build a secure future for them.

loans.use: To buy a variety of medicines

loans.name: Benigna Amelia

texts.es:
La señora  BENIGNA P. U., tiene  51 años, vive en el distrito de la BUENOS AIRES provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria y  tiene 1 hijo de 11 años quien depende económicamente de ella, porque es madre soltera. La socia se dedica  a la fabricación de calzado y al reciclaje y con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles  compró material como: cuero, hebillas, pegamento, etc. y con su próximo crédito de 100 nuevos soles comprará botellas de plástico, fierro, madera, papel, para vender a la fabricas de reciclaje.
Ella sueña con aumentar su negocio del reciclaje para así poder obtener mayores ganancias y poder educar y brindarle una optima calidad de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
BENIGNA P. U., 51, lives in the BUENOS AIRES district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II (Enterprising Women II) communal bank. She finished 11th grade and has an 11-year-old son who is dependent on her because she is a single mother. She is a shoemaker and she also recycles. With her first, 300 new sol loan, she bought supplies like: leather, buckles, adhesive, etc. and, with her next loan of 100 new soles, she will buy plastic bottles, metal, wood and paper to sell to recycling companies. She dreams with enlarging her recycling business to earn higher profits in order to educate and provide optimal quality of life for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic bottles, metal, wood, paper.

loans.name: Marisabel

texts.es:
La señora Marisabel es una joven de 25 años ella se caso muy joven tienen 3 hermosos hijos de (7,4 años y 2 meses) actualmente su esposo se encuentra en otra ciudad por cuestiones de trabajo. Marisabel se dedica a la producción de leche cruda cuyo producto entrega a la una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos, apenas empieza ya que actualmente cuenta con 4 cabezas de ganado lechero.

Marisabel vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de Machajmarca, aun no tiene casa propia ya que vive en la casa de su madre.El crédito será destinado para la construcción de un establo lo cual es importante para la protección de su ganado ya que se aproxima la temporada de lluvia.
 
Entre los sueños y metas de Marisabel, es tener una granja de ganado lechero  de por lo menos 30 cabezas de ganado, tener su propia casa y que sus 3 pequeños hijos estudien y que tengan un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marisabel is a 25 year old woman. She married very young and has 3 beautiful children (7 years, 4 years and 2 months of age). At the moment, her husband is in another city for work. Marisabel is dedicated to the production of raw milk which she delivers to a company which produces dairy products. She just started this business as she currently has only 4 heads of dairy cattle. Marisabel lives in the city of Cochabamba in the Machajmarca community where she does not have own home as she lives in her mother's house. The loan will go to building a stable, which is important for the protection of her livestock because the rainy season is approaching. Among Marisabel's dreams and goals is to have a dairy farm of at least 30 heads of cattle, have her own home and that her 3 small children study and have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a stable to house her daily cattle

loans.name: Seriousness Group

texts.en:
These are members of the 'Seriousness' group from the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty traders who have formed themselves into a group in order to apply for a group loan from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of a loan, their businesses will grow at a much faster rate.

Mabinty O. S. on the left in the photo is this group’s leader. Mabinty was born in Magburaka town thirty-one years ago. She is married to a teacher and they have two children – one in form I and the other in class V.

Mabinty sells oranges, cassava, rice, palm-oil, peppers and so on. She has been doing business since 1991. Mabinty will use this loan to buy oranges and cassava wholesale to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy oranges and cassava wholesale

loans.name: Kelly Silvana

texts.es: La Srta. Kelly es una cliente que trabaja con nosotros en tres secuencias, ella es madre soltera  tiene una hija de 3 años, que atiende su mamá debido a que ella estudia pòr las mañanas. La mamá le colaboró en la adquisición del kiosco para que ella pueda mantenerse y con un pequeño capital ella comenzo a trabajar, al momento ella aumento su capital en más de 6000 mil bolivianos que hace rotar en mercaderia cada quince dias, Kelly tiene una edad de 21 años, y es una persona muy responsable y madura para su edad.
texts.en:
Kelly is a client who has worked with us in three sequences. She is a single mother, and she has a three year old daughter. Kelly’s mother takes care of her daughter because Kelly goes to school in the mornings. Her mother collaborated with her in acquiring a kiosk so that she could support herself. With a small amount of capital she started to work. She increased her capital to over 6,000 bolivianos, which allows her to rotate her merchandise every 15 days. Kelly is 21 years old. She is a very mature and responsible person for her age.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia J. is from the village of Owaon. She is 25 years old. Sylvia is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Sylvia sells cosmetics in the local community. Sylvia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Sylvia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sylvia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. Sylvia is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP to buy a second-hand motorcycle that her husband will use to transport passengers. This will be Sylvia's 8th loan from PMPC and her second from Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions and to support the education of her children.

Shown in the photo is the passenger side-car that will be attached to the motorcyle that she will be purchasing.  The motorized passenger sidecar is the most common public transport vehicle in the village. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorcycle to transport passengers

loans.name: Loeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Loeng C. is 39 years old and lives in Roka village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectares (3.75-acres) of land on which she cultivates rice to support her family living. Her husband, Mr. Saroeun Chhon, is a palm juice collector.

In the rice field, this family has a problem because their rice field has infertile soil. Thus, Mrs. Loeng C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel. With the rest of the loan she would like to buy some supplies for collecting palm juice.

This couple has eight children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, three are attending the local public school, while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel for her rice field plus supplies for her husband's business

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: El señor Felipe M. es una persona separada y por tal motivo vive solo, el es pensionado y además inicio un negocio de nombre “Abarrotes July”, establecido desde hace un año, el es una persona muy trabajadora y con grandes deseos de salir adelante. Por tal motivo es su esfuerzo y dedicación. En estos momentos esta tramitando un crédito para la inversión a su negocio en compra de mercancía por mayoreo y así ofrecer mejores precios y además mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
Felipe M. is estranged and lives alone, and he is also a pensioner. In addition, he started a business named "Abarrotes July" one year ago. He is a very hard-working person with great hopes of getting ahead. For this reason he shows a lot of effort and dedication. Currently, he is applying for a loan to be able to invest in buying wholesale products for his business so as to offer better prices and gain a greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Jenny Alexandra

texts.es:
La señora Jenny D. vive en la parroquia Ricaurte en el barrio La Nube ubicada al noroeste de la ciudad, también es conocida por la gastronomía típica como cuyes asados, Jenny tiene 25 años se encuentra casada, su esposo trabaja en la construcción con quién ha procreado un hijo que se encuentra de 4 años, aun no tienen casa propia por lo que se encuentran arrendando.

Jenny se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y también trabaja vendiendo  productos Avon hace un año y ya cuenta con clientes fijos por lo que va creciendo su negocio, como también le gusta el estilismo está estudiando en unos cursos rápidos de belleza para mejor su situación económica.

Mantiene  una gran amistad con todas sus compañeras del banco comunal, se encuentra en su segundo ciclo y el primer credito lo invirtió en  productos Avon, con el nuevo préstamo solicitado  va a pagar  una letra de un electrodoméstico que adquirió y también para la comprar materiales para su curso de belleza ya que necesita una vaporizadora facial, planchas para el cabello etc., su meta es de llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Jenny D. lives in the Ricaurte parrish in the La Nube neighborhood. It is northeast of the city. It is known for its typical food like roasted guinea pigs. Jenny is 25 years old and married. Her husband works in construction. They have a four year old son. They do not have their own house yet, so they rent. Jenny devotes herself to the household chores. She has also been selling Avon products for one year. She has regular customers, and her business is growing. Because she also likes hair styling, she is taking some quick beauty courses to improve her economic situation. She maintains a great friendship with all of her colleagues in her communal bank. She is in her second cycle. In the first cycle she bought Avon products. With the new loan she has requested she will make a payment on a home appliance that she got. She will also buy materials for her beauty course. She needs a facial steamer and hair irons, etc. Her goal is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a facial steamer and a hair iron

loans.name: Ana Lisseth

texts.es: Ana Lisseth R. G. de 24 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador, junto a su madre la cual trabaja como ama del hogar, y su hermana de 31 años de edad, y un sobrino. Ana posee un Ciber café, el cual esta ubicado en su propia casa, en una de las zonas más concurridas de su colonia, ya que esta frente a la iglesia católica del lugar, lo cual es de mucho beneficio para ella ya que se encuentra en un lugar muy visible. Ana solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero necesario para invertir en el negocio, compran productos como CDs, folders,  etiquetas, lapiceros, papelería y otros más, los cuales las personas buscan mucho, sobre todo por estudiantes. A pesar de su corta edad Ana es una joven muy llena de deseos de poder triunfar en la vida y así poder seguir adelante con sus estudios, y contar con un mejor futuro para su ella.
texts.en:
Ana Lisseth R. G., 24 years of age, lives in the San Salvador department along with her mother, a homemaker, her 31-year old sister, and a nephew. Ana runs an Internet café that is located in her own home, within one of the busiest areas of the zone. It is in front of the local Catholic Church, which is a good location since the business has a high visibility. Ana requests a loan from Integral, which would give her access to the necessary funds to invest in her business. She would like to buy products such as CDs, folders, labels, pens, paper products, and more, all of which are in great demand, particularly by students. Despite her young age, Ana is filled with a desire to succeed, to continue with her education, and to be able to build a better future for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy CDs, pens, and paper products.

loans.name: Robatina

texts.en:
Robatina is a 28-year-old single lady. She has been running a hair salon for three years. She also earns extra income from her food kiosk. She uses part of her income to pay her two employees.  

She is a member of Faulu Kenya with the Machakos Mwangaza group, where she saves her money. Being a member of the group, she has an advantage because she can get a loan from Faulu Kenya since the members are her guarantors.  

She plans to take a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more plastic chairs for her salon and a hair blow dryer. She hopes to cut the cost of renting a business premises by buying a plot of land to build her business. She dreams of expanding the business and employing more people.

loans.use: To buy plastic chairs and a hair blow dryer

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “SACRO”; Nuestra socia es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el poblado de chinchero perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es el Sra. MARTHA,  Nuestra socia tiene 41 años  casada y tiene 3 hijos, de 21, 18, 5 años de edad, nuestra socia trabaja  vendiendo granos secos, la socia a fin de no ausentarse de casa acomodó una pequeña tienda en su casa hacia la calle principal y puso todo tipo de granos para la venta, (trigo, maíz, habas secas, quinua, arvejas) Nuestra socilita el préstamo para comprar granos al por mayor.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Martha belongs to the community bank “Sacro”. She comes from the community of Cruz Pata in Chinchero, which belongs to the province of Urubamba, located in the department of Cusco. Martha is 41 years old, married, and has three children of 21, 18 and 5 years of age. She works selling dried beans and grains. As Martha couldn't leave her house to work, she set up a small store in her own house which faces the main street and offers many types of dried beans and grains to purchase, such as wheat, corn, dried beans, quinoa and peas. She is applying for a loan to buy dried beans and grains in bulk. Martha is grateful for the valuable support provided by this institution and promises to complete her repayments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dried beans and grains in bulk

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 45 year-old entrepreneur from Lebanon. He is a married man and has four children to sustain. Hassan is a dedicated construction worker who works on projects on the request of clients. He specializes in tiles; he cuts them and then places them.

In order to improve his business he has requested a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua to buy a tile cutter and to buy diesel for his generator (the electricity is shut down daily so in order to continue his work he needs a generator).

When he first started his business he didn’t have use of a wide network but he knew on how to prove himself and make himself known. In the future Hassan plans to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To buy a tile cutter and diesel for his generator.

loans.name: Yéwa Djidjom

texts.en: This young woman in Togo sells all kinds of products out of her home including eggs, drinking water, and school supplies. She is 33 years old and married to a man who is a chauffeur. Together they have four children. She has been in this business since 2006. Recently she requested her first microloan from WAGES for 300,000 CFA to purchase more eggs, water, and school supplies.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: One To Two Group

texts.en:
This is Sinmnah K., Memunatu K., Josephine C., Baby B. and Mamusu K.. Sinmnah K. is the leader of the group.

Sinmnah has been a businesswoman for five years now and owns a “cigarette box” where she sells cigarettes, biscuits, mints, chewing gum, matches, blades, etc. She is 28 years of age and her husband is a tailor. She has three children, two of whom are attending primary school. She was born in Magburaka town, the Tonkolili district headquarters town.

Sinmnah will use this loan to further expand her business inventory. She will buy the above mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy more cigarettes, biscuits, mints, chewing gum, matches, blades, etc. for her store

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena A. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Pansil, Brgy. Azagra, Tanjay City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by buying and selling rice. Her husband, Rico, who is 52 years old, works as a laborer to earn a living. They have five children, who are between the ages of 18 and 30 years old.

Lucena joined Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF)-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of 16 previous loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and through her own hard work, Lucena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her last loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP enabled her to earn a monthly profit of 6,000 PHP, which helped to improve her family's standard of living.

This time, for her 17th cycle loan, she is seeking to borrow 10,000 PHP ($225), which she intends to use to purchase additional fertilizer and rice. In turn, she hopes to continue to save up so that she can purchase a tricycle and perform home repairs. Lucena A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, NWTF is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 per day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, which is a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional fertilizer and rice

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin is a 49 year old man who dedicates his time to driving a taxi and a microbus. He currently relies on two vehicles for his public transport business, one of which he drives personally, and the second he lets on lease. He has a wife and three children. Amin has about 15 years of experience in the public transportation field, and the competition is rather high in this business, since there are so many people who need it. His current request is so that he can maintain his vehicle, since this is the tool of his trade. So now, Amin is counting on your help and requesting a loan of $1500 USD. With the loan he’ll purchase the spare parts for his microbus. With your support, Amin will continue to progress. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair the microbus.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yun T. is a middle-aged woman whose husband appears in the photo here. Yun T. owns a small store along the road located near the garment factory where she sells food to sewing laborers to earn a living. She is married with two school-aged kids, while her husband is a construction foreman who has a few employees help him to provide his service. 

Yun T.’s husband is running his service well because he is widely known in construction and has skills in public relations which he uses with his customers. However, his income is not very big as his service has recently come to a low capacity due to insufficient financial capital. So, Yun T. requests a loan for her husband to increase his capital which will allow him to improve his profits. Mrs. Yun T. was not available on that day so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To increase the business capital

loans.name: Janneth Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Janneth Isabel R. es socia del banco comunal Reina de la Nube, vive en la  ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es conocida por sus bellas iglesias, su centro histórico, es una ciudad muy rica en cultura y fue nombrada  patrimonio cultural de la humanidad en diciembre de 1999.

Doña Janneth es comisionista de ventas, actividad que la realiza hace un año y medio, vende diferentes marcas de cosméticos, labora 6 horas al día de lunes a sábado el resto del tiempo se dedica a su familia.

La Señora. Janneth tiene 26 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 2 años y medio, su esposo es de profesión mecánico, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en la fundación, fue invitada por una compañera a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres luchadoras, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para crecer en su negocio.

Su meta es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Janneth Isabel R. is a member of the communal bank Reina de la Nube. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is known for its beautiful churches, historic center and is a city very rich in culture. It was named a cultural heritage site in December of 1999. Janneth is a sales agent and has been for the past year and a half. She sells different brands of cosmetics and works 6 hours a day Monday through Saturday. The rest of her days she dedicates to her family. Janneth is 26 years old and is married with a son who is two and half. Her husband is a mechanic. They don't own their house but rent. This is the second loan she has requested from the foundation. She was invited by a friend to become a member of this group of women fighters. This new loan she is going to invest by buying cosmetics to grow her business. Her goal is to own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lipsticks, creams, eye shadows, perfumes and general cosmetics.

loans.name: Phillip

texts.en:
Philip N. is a 40-year-old gentleman who is married to Dina Wamalwa. They have two children, who are both still in school. Philip operates two businesses of poultry farming and plastic shoe selling within the Bungoma area. He has been doing this for two years now, and he is able to take home 2,500 KES per month. 

Philip has applied for his first loan from KADET, which he plans to use to buy more shoes for resale, as well as to buy poultry feeds. He hopes to make a good profit that he will plough back into the business.

His future plans include becoming a wholesale trader who will sell leather shoes and also stabilize the income for himself and his family. He says that his commitment will help him achieve this feat.

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds and shoes for resale in his secondary business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old married man with a baby.  He lives in Lebanon. He has owned a bird shop since 2000 and he has been working in this occupation for the past 15 years. He is really satisfied with his work because he likes birds with their different types and colors and he says that it brings joy to his heart. And he also says that it brings a good atmosphere to the houses where they will have a good place. Today, he is asking for a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional birds to increase his sales and make a good income. In the future, he is planning to expand his business and enlarge his shop into other areas.

loans.use: To purchase additional birds

loans.name: Georgina Ernesto

texts.pt:
Georgina Ernesto N. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, solteira mãe de 2 filhos de 4 e 7 anos de idade vão a escola. Freqüenta o primeiro ano de faculdade. Vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém para além dos filhos. 

Nunca saiu da terra natal, é comerciante e dona do negócio ha mais de 10 anos, vende mais extensões de cabelo. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 10.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (Millenium Bim).

Ja teve empréstimo no banco Tchuma e decidiu não continuar, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma cliente vizinha que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 17.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (extensões de cabelo e produtos cabeleireiros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

No futuro quer solicitar mais um empréstimo para a conclusão da sua casa. Esta confiante que vai pagar sem nenhum problema.
texts.en:
Georgina Ernesto N. was born in Maputo, in Southern Mozambique. She is the single mom of two sons, ages 4 and 7, who are in school. She is attending her first year of college. She lives with her children in a house they own. She's never left Maputo.

For the past four years she has been running a hair salon business, where she sells hair extensions and products. She makes 10.000.00mt per month and, after taking care of household expenses, is able to save some money at Millenium Bim bank.

Georgina has had a loan with Tchuma Bank before. She learned about Hluvuku from a neighbor friend who is a client of the institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku and she plans to use the 17.000.00mt to buy more products for her salon (hair extensions, creams, etc).

She's confident in her ability to pay back this loan and plans to apply for more loans in the future, to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy more products for her hair salon (hair extensions, hair products, etc)

loans.name: Teng

texts.en:
Mrs. Teng K. is 58 years old and the mother of five children. One is single and the other four are married and have already started new families. 

Since the beginning of 2005, Teng K. has operated a small store inside the local market. In her shop, she sells a few fishes and vegetables to the buyers who come to buy anything for their cooking. She is married, but her husband died of senility years ago.

In the past, Teng K. hired taxis to travel from and to the market in order to sell her items because she doesn’t have a vehicle. She wants to own a vehicle but her personal money is inadequate to buy one. Thus, Teng K. requests a loan to buy a used motorcycle to be used for traveling without hiring taxis.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle for traveling to work

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

En este lugar encontramos  a la señora Alba, ella tiene 21 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre desde hace dos años, nos cuenta con mucha tristeza que su primer bebé que iba a tener falleció antes del parto, su marido es militar.

Trabaja en un almacén de pintura de lunes a viernes y   además se dedica al comercio, vende ropa por catalogo, trabaja los días sabados y domingos desde las 8am hasta las 15h00 y de lunes a viernes en las noches. Recibe los productos en una distribuidora en el centro de la ciudad.
 
Este crédito es para viajar a Baños y traer ropa para dedicarse no solo a la venta por catálogo sino también venta personal. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la seriedad de sus compañeras del Banco. Su sueño es tener una bonita familia y tres hijos a quienes darles lo mejor.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Ilusiones” (Illusions) meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood of El Progresso in the city of Portoviejo. This marginalized urban area is the most populated section of the city and known for being the location of the Portoviejo Women’s Prison.

Sra. Alba is 21 years old and has been in a common law marriage for two years. She says that she is saddened because her first child died during her pregnancy. Her husband is in the military.

Alba works at a paint store Monday through Friday and also sells clothing through a catalog. She works every Saturday and Sunday from 8am until 3pm and at nights during the work week. Alba acquires her products from a distributor in the central part of the city.

This loan will enable her to travel to Baños so that she can acquire clothing to bring back with her. Not only does she sell through a catalog, but she also obtains merchandise from other salespeople. This is her second loan cycle with the Communal Bank and she likes the seriousness of her fellow group members. Her dream is to have a beautiful family, specifically three children, for whom she can provide the best.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Muralla

texts.en:
Muralla O. is a 47-year-old mother from Culasi, Antique, Philippines, a municipality where the mountains meet the sea. She is married to Romeo O., a 50-year-old farmer, and they are blessed with two children- Ramon Christopher, 21 years old, and Apple Jean, 16 years old.

Muralla is a very simple woman who has a simple dream in life and that is to see her children graduate from college so that they will get a better job someday.

Since 2005, she has never requested a loan more than 20,000 PHP because she always puts into consideration that she will only borrow the amount needed for her business in order to avoid mis-utilization of loans and to maintain her good performance as a member.

She has successfully paid her last loan and presently she is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP. This amount will be utilized as additional capital for her pig-raising project. The income from this project really helps her to address the needs of her family, especially the educational expense of her children. 

She also wishes that someday, through her business and with the support of ASHI and its field partner, they will rise up from poverty.

loans.use: Hog fattening

loans.name: Gerardo Jose

texts.es: Gerardo José tiene 30 años, vive en casa propia, está casado y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Gerardo  emprendió su actividad como es ofrecer el servicio de gimnasio hace más de 2 años cuando pudo adquirir ciertas maquinas que le es de mucha utilidad, además que él es el propietario la mayoría de sus clientes son jóvenes, adultos y ciertas personas vecinas publico en general, cuentan con clientela formada. Gerardo es un señor muy sacrificado quien se esfuerza diariamente para brindarle lo mejor a su familia y buena educación a sus hijos para adquirir una profesión universitaria. Necesita el crédito para la compra de pesas, maquinas, entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Gerardo José is a 30-year-old man who lives in his own house with his wife and 2 under age children. Gerardo owns a gym, and he has been in business for over 2 years. He has been able to obtain workout equipment that has been very useful for him. The majority of his customers are young people, adults, and some neighbors. He has a solid clientele. Gerardo is a very hard-working person who strives to give his family the best and provide his children with a good education so that they can one day obtain a college degree. He needs this loan in order to purchase weights, fitness machines, and other things for his gym.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca O. E.
Es una mujer conocida por su don del servicio al cliente, ya tiene 3 años de dedicarse a la crianza de cerdos.
Ella quiere mejorar los ingresos de su familia, haciendo que su negocio crezca. Para eso necesita  un préstamo de ₡600 000(seiscientos mil colones) para la compra de mas cerdos y de alimento mejorados. 
Ellas es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en: Francisca O. E. is a woman who is well known for her gift of providing good customer service.  She has been raising pigs for three years.  She would like to improve her family income, growing her business.  For this reason, she needs a loan for 600,000 colones to buy more pigs and better feed.  She is a member of the 'Empresa de Crédito Comunal Santa Fe' (Santa Fe Community Credit Company), one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy pigs and feed

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina tiene 45 años vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 5 años tiene su negocio en su propia casa, donde vende productos de primera necesidad, asimismo vende jugos de fruta que ella misma prepara así como comida, en la que incluye las parrillas de carne o pollo siendo estos alimentos expendidos por la tarde. Su gran ventaja es la ubicación de su negocio, ya que se encuentra en una zona muy transitada y comercial. Una de sus hijas la ayuda en la atención de su negocio y todos los días sin descansar  trabaja para tener las ganancias necesarias que le permitan sostener la economía de su hogar. Se siente muy satisfecha con su trabajo porque  tiene las ganancias  necesarias y tiene deseos de crecer, una de sus metas es mejorar la infraestructura de su local comercial para continuar con sus negocios. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para su tienda y mejorar su parrilla donde prepara comida.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 45 years old and lives with her 3 children in her own home. For the last 5 years she has been running a business from her home, selling staples, fruit juices she makes herself and also food in the afternoon, including barbecued beef and chicken. Her business has the advantage of being located in a very busy shopping area. One of her daughters helps her run the business and she works tirelessly every day to obtain the necessary income to financially maintain her home. She is very pleased with her job beause she earns enough. She would also like to expand the business; one of her goals is to improve the infrastructure of the premises. 

This is her first loan with MFP. She is very happy to know she will have financial backing. She also enjoys being part of her communal bank because all members are people she knows, responsible and very supportive. She would like to thank everyone contributing to the loan requested, as it will be very useful to advance her business. She will invest the loan in the purchase of more merchandise for the shop and the improvement of the grill where she prepares the food.

loans.use: Buy products to stock up her shop.

loans.name: Audri Del Rocío

texts.es:
Audri Del Rocío M. R. tiene 35 años de edad. Es casada vive con el Esposo y Con los hijos viven en el cantón  Ventanas en la Provincia de los ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. ESFUERZO Y TRABAJO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Campos Grandes perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Audri Del Rocío se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac, y  vende en la feria en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es dar el estudio a los hijos y lleguen hacer profesionales.

Le gusta ver los programas en el televisor.
texts.en:
Audri Del Rocío M. R. is 35. She is married and lives with her husband and children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. She has 3 children.

The members of the V.R.C. Esfuerzo y Trabajo ["Effort and Work"] are located in the Campos Grandes neighbourhood belonging to the Pueblo Viejo Canton. The members of this bank have long worked in short-cycle agricultural labour, sowing corn and rice.

Audri Del Rocio has worked in agriculture, sowing corn and rice, for three years. She buys her products in Agripac and sells them in the market in the same area.

She is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural tools and fertilizers for cultivating corn and rice. In supporting this loan, you will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to provide for her children's studies and for them to become professionals.

She enjoys watching shows on television.

loans.use: the purchase of agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mr. Ly V. (shown in the photo) and his wife, Mrs. Sem Den, have been married since 1988 and have seven children, three sons and four daughters. They are living along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Ly asked for a Kiva loan once to buy a remoque taxi (a remoque is a motorbike with a trailer at the back). He hoped to drive in Phnom Penh City, but driving a remoque is not legal in Phnom Penh.

Therefore, he is asking for his second loan of $1,000 to buy a Tuk Tuk (a three-wheeled motorcycle or moto-rickshaw). The Tuk Tuk is not forbidden.

loans.use: To buy a three-wheeled motorcycle.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea madre soltera mujer emprendedora, trabajadora, agricultora como planes mejora infraestructura de la vivienda para tener seguridad y protección. Inicio con  apoyo de la reforma agraria, se le presenta dificulta con las enfermedades y plagas. 
Tiene de proyecto la conservación de suelo y siembro de abono verdes para obtener mayores productos. El préstamo será utilizado en la compra insecticidas brindando el manejo de fito sanitario al cultivo.
texts.en:
Andrea is a single mother. She is an enterprising hardworking woman who works as a farmer. Andrea plans to improve the infrastructure of her home in order to provide greater security and protection. She started farming as a result of land reform. The main difficulties she faces are diseases and pests.

Andrea is undertaking a soil conservation project and will also apply green composts on her crops so that she can increase her productivity. This loan will be used to buy insecticides so that she can manage the health of her plants.

loans.use: Purchase insecticides

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Vidal G.  de 43 años de edad es casado, labora para la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa  desde 9 años como maestro de obra, tiene 1 hijos el cual se encuentra estudiando actualmente el 3er año de secundaria. 
Necesita este financiamiento con el objetivo de cambiar el techo, embarldosar ya que la casa es de tierra, y pintar el frente y la sala de su casa, esta muy agradecido con el apoyo de Kiva con financiamiento, pues por medio de estos ha podido ir mejorando poco a poco su vivienda.  
Sueña con ponerle ceramica a toda la casa para asi brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia y  mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Vidal G. is 43 years old and married.  For nine years he has worked as a building foreman for the city hall of Juigalpa.  He has one son who is currently in third year of secondary school.

He needs financing in order to change the roof of his house as well as put in flooring and paint the outside and living room.  He is very grateful to Kiva for the loan which will enable him to make these improvements little by little.

His dream is to put ceramic tile on the house for family safety purposes and to improve living conditions.

loans.use: To make home improvements

loans.name: Remelinda

texts.en:
Remelinda T. is from the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 59 years old. Remelinda is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Remelinda owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling green bananas in the local community. Remelinda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Remelinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remelinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Remelinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas & coconuts to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Remelinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas & coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia is 43 years old and married with three children.

Inocencia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock.

Inocencia has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Inocencia aspires to expand her business and repair her house.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Thiaba

texts.fr: Madame Thiaba N. est une femme mariée de 55 ans. Elle vit dans la localité de Yoff depuis plusieurs années. Elle est mère de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 18 et 27 ans. Elle travaille comme femme de charge à l’hôpital  SAMU depuis 1986. Avant de rejoindre le secteur de la santé elle était employée  à l’aéroport comme technicienne de surface. Au terme de son contrat à l’hôpital elle a porté son choix sur la profession de  femme de charge car elle trouve beaucoup de plaisir à aider les malades. Elle est sociétaire au guichet de Yoff depuis aout 2001. Elle a déjà remboursé 8 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs. Ce financement lui permettra de réaménager sa maison (construction d’un appartement). Son but est d’améliorer les conditions  sociales de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Thiaba N. is a 55-year-old married woman.  She has lived in the town of Yoff for several years, and has four children between the ages of 18 and 27.  She has worked as a housekeeper at the SAMU hospital since 1986.  Before entering the health sector, she worked as a cleaner at the airport.  At the end of her contract she chose hospital housekeeping because she takes great pleasure in helping the sick.  She has been a member of the Yoff bank since August 2001 and has already paid back eight previous loans.  She is requesting a loan of 500,000 Francs.  This will allow her to convert her house, constructing an apartment.  Her goal is to improve the social living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to build an apartment

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi E. is married to a farmer and they have 7 children. To supplement her husband’s income, Esi runs a stall selling provisions. As shown in the photograph, she sells eggs, cooking oil, seasonings and other food items. 

Esi aspires to grow her business and plans to use her Kiva loan to purchase larger quantities and more varieties of food items for her stall. She hopes that this will help keep her current customers coming back and also attract new ones.  She is focused on long-term growth and plans to reinvest whatever extra income she earns back into her business.

loans.use: buy more food items to resell

loans.name: Mario César

texts.es:
El Sr. Mario es casado, tiene dos  hijos, y uno de ellos está en edad escolar.
Él se dedica a la venta de ropas y zapatos en forma ambulante, y por la noche trabaja como moto taxista, tiene su parada en el km. 4 de Ciudad del Este, el mismo negocio se halla cada vez más en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso. 
Con la ayuda de su esposa  están  saliendo adelante, con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo.
Hoy día él es un microempresario exitoso con una clientela fiel y numerosa, debido a su amabilidad. Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos por lo que confía en que recibirá el apoyo de Kiva, pues solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas y zapatos que puedan ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes y así afianzar la fidelidad que estos le otorgan.
texts.en:
Mario is married and has two children; one is school aged.

He is clothes and shoes street vendor; at night he works as a taxi driver.  His taxi stand is at Ciudad del Este’s Kilometer 4.  This business is growing more each time generating good income for him.  With help from his wife they are getting ahead with much effort and sacrifice.

Today he is a successful micro entrepreneur with a numerous, loyal clientele thanks to his kindness.  He has shown himself to be a responsible, honest person with respect to his commitments so he trusts that Kiva will support him.  He is asking for the loan to buy clothes and shoes to offer a wider variety to his customers thereby solidifying the loyalty they have in him.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Mishigdorj

texts.en:
Mishigdorj is 52 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a house in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her eldest son is a student while the younger one hasn't reached school age so stays at home.
Mishigdorj manages a beauty salon where she provides massage services for her customers. She started her business after graduating from college as a masseuse. Since then her business has been quite successful, which allowed her to build a strong customer base. She is a hardworking lady who is doing her work to feed her family. She says, "All I want is to educate my children and help them to be better people." She is requesting a 3,200,000 MNT loan to purchase materials to design her workplace.

loans.use: to purchase materials to design her workplace.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila tiene 53 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los 5 hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NARCISA DE JESUS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Temistocles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Luzmila se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz, es tradición en su familia dedicarse a este negocio. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos.

Le gusta cocinar y lavar.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 53 years old and married. She lives with her husband and their five children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank called “Narcisa de Jesus” is located in the neighborhood of Recinto San Temistocles, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Luzmila is a farmer who grows primarily corn. Her family engages in farming since it is a tradition. She buys her supplies in Ventanas each month and then sells her products at the fair located in the same area.

Luzmila is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and compost. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, she will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges she faces include pests, diseases, and changes in weather. Her dream is to buy more land.

Luzmila enjoys cooking and cleaning.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and compost.

loans.name: Emilce

texts.es:
La Sra. Emilce tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera con tres hijos, Richar de 8, Daniel de 6, y Willian de 3 años, vive en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo.
La Sra. Emilce es comerciante hace 10 años, es macatera, es decir vendedora ambulante de artículos en general, como artículos de librería, maquillajes, cosméticos, bijouterí, naipes y demás, las ventas las realiza en las zonas aledañas a su barrio.
Comenzó con unas pequeñas cajas de algunos productos, y de apoco fue creciendo con mucho esfuerzo,comenta que se levanta muy temprano por la mañana para cuidar sus hijos, dejar todo en orden su casa para que ella pueda salir a realizar sus ventas, el cual es el sustento del hogar. Este negocio le ayudo a criar y a educar a  sus hijos.
