Para ella la familia es muy importante ya que es madre soltera, sus hijos son la razón de su lucha día a día.
Solicita el credito para poder abastecerse de nuevas mercancías como cosméticos y artículos similares. Ella manifiesta que el credito le sera de mucha utilidad, ya que le permitirá seguir sustentando a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Emilce is 26 years old. She is a single mother with three children: Richar, 8, Daniel, 6, and Willian, 3. She lives in the city of Coronel Oviedo. Mrs. Emilce has been a merchant for ten years. She is a street vendor, that is, she sells general items in the street, such as stationery items, makeup, cosmetics, costume jewelry, playing cards and other items. She sells her wares in the areas surrounding her neighborhood. 

She began with some small boxes of certain products, and from there grew bit by bit, with much effort. She comments that she gets up very early in the morning in order to care for her children and set everything straight in her home, so that she can go out and do her selling, which is how she supports her household. This business helped her raise and school her children. 

For her the family is very important since she is a single mother. Her children are her reason for working day by day. 

She is seeking the loan in order to be able to stock new merchandise such as cosmetics and similar items. She asserts that the loan will be of great use to her, since it will allow her to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for stocking her product line.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 21 years old, single and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. She lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala central region of Uganda.

Esther has a business of selling fruits and vegetables, which she has done for the past two years. To help grow her business, Esther has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale. Esther is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by investing capital in her business.

With the help of her loan, Esther hopes to generate greater profits and pay the school fees for her child. In the future, Esther hopes to take a tailoring course.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Cu

texts.en: Cu is 51 years old. She lives in Dong Thon village with her husband and two children. Her main job is growing rice and breeding pigs and poultry. She has had this job for 31 years. She has a monthly income of about 4.000.000 Vietnamdong(VND). She always needs loans to invest in livestock. So, she has participated in SEDA since 2009. The last cycle, she borrowed 8.288.000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9.184.000 VND to buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is 35 years old and married with five children, two who are in school and three who are too young for school. Mario finished secondary school but was not able to continue his studies due to the lack of financial means. He works as an electrician and offers his services to community members. Mario repairs damaged electronics such as washing machines, fans, and televisions and he also repairs shoes and umbrellas. Mario has been in business for almost 11 years. He has a lot of customers due his unique set of repair skills. Mario is thankful because the profit that his business generates has provided for the daily needs of his children, providing rice and other necessities.

Mario is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase equipment such as a Nico light and soldering iron for his business and to cover daily business maintenance fees. He will also use his loan to buy a piglet.

loans.use: to buy a light and soldering iron and cover daily business expenses

loans.name: Karago Basubuzi Group

texts.en:
Erika is a 35-year-old married woman with five children. They live in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She takes care of the family with the help of her husband, who is a farmer.

For the past five years Erika has been selling fresh produce. She needs a portion of this group’s loan to buy more fresh produce to sell. The high cost of transporting her produce to different markets is her major challenge.

Erika’s desire is to set up a big stall in town. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more fresh produce to sell.

loans.name: Hor

texts.en: Cambodia operates as a free market, so lots of couples co-operate and try to make an effort to find which job is suitable for them to earn an income for the family. With many choices of jobs, Hor has been running a business purchasing ducks and chickens. From this business, Hor earns about $5 USD each day and apart from this revenue, his wife runs a business as a grocery seller where she earns approximately $3 per day also. Every day, Hor must spend more money for taxi fares to buy ducks and chickens at province because it is far away from his house. Because of the long distance and no motorbike at his house, Hor and his wife have decided to request funds from HKL and Kiva in the aim to purchase a motorbike for coordinating his business. He hopes that this loan will help him achieve happiness and gain more profit.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Georges

texts.en: Georges is a 50-year-old married man living with his wife and four children. Two of his children are still attending school. Despite his older age, he is still working in the construction field. He has been involved in this type of business for the past 25 years. And in 1990, he started to work independently, sticking with multiple construction projects and individual works. He is specialized at completing floor covering work. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to invest in purchasing new tools needed in order to continue expansion of his business and to further increase his productivity.

loans.use: to purchase new tools for his business

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa es soltera, tiene 3 hijos todos mayores y con su propia familia, tiene 20 años de laborar para la Escuela Normal como inspectora. Esta solicitando su 9no credito para terminar la construccion de la casita de su hija para que tenga mejores condiciones, pues en este momento desea construir un cuarto para contar con mejores condiciones, cuenta con el apoyo de su hija para el pago de las cuotas, ademas tiene ingresos adicionales de su trabajo como costurera. Felipa expresa sentirse muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado por AFODENIC y Kiva, pues gracias a estas instituciones ha podido lograr que su hija se independice con su propia casita.  En la foto doña Felipa aparece con su unica nietecita, la cual vive con ella.
texts.en:
Felipa is single and has three children, all of whom are grown and have their own families. For the past 20 years, she has worked at a teacher’s college as a classroom inspector. Felipa is requesting her ninth loan so that she can finish the construction of her daughter’s house so that it will have better conditions.

At the moment, she wants to build a room that will have the best conditions. Felipa has help from her daughter with making the loan payments. In addition, she earns extra money from her work as a seamstress. Felipa expresses her appreciation for the support AFODENIC and Kiva have provided. Thanks to the help of these institutions, her daughter will be able to live independently in her own home.

In the photograph, Doña Felipa appears with her only granddaughter who lives with her.

loans.use: to build a kitchen in her daughter's house.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.

Vilma has been in this business for 18 years. Vilma earns additional income from farming coconut.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Rom (in the photo) and her husband raise pigs and produce rice wine. They married in 1987 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One is learning a technical skill, one is in high school and another one is still young. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Rom is asking for another loan of $1,000 to buy pig feed. She will also use part of the loan to pay school fees for her son who is learning a technical skill.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and pay school fees for her son.

loans.name: Teodosio

texts.es: Teodosio tiene 57 años, casado con Anatolia de 54 años, que fruto de este amor tiene 6 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Desde muy niño le gustó estar en el campo, cuando en aquellas épocas sus padres se dedicaban a la actividad agrícola, pero el siguió lo pasos de sus padres del cual, se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo que le siguen brindando hasta hoy y con todo lo aprendido incursionó en el cultivo de cacao, café y frutas cítricas. Con el pasar del tiempo, poco a poco fue creciendo en su producción y aunque existe algunos inconvenientes siempre él esta preparado para poder afrontarlo. Él siguió en esta labor con la idea de emprender un futuro mejor para su familia y su persona. Casi siempre recibe la ayuda de su querida esposa e hijos, pero en ocasiones tiene a cargo de sus peones. Su producto lo vende en los Centros de acopio del distrito de Pichari. Pero lo que más anhela es adquirir más terrenos, con la finalidad de expandir sus cultivos, de esa manera producir en cantidad y por consiguiente obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2000 soles que solicita, contratará peones para que lo ayuden en limpieza de su parcela agrícola y fertilizarla.
texts.en:
Teodosio, 57, is married to Anatolia, 54; their six children are the fruit of this love.  Together they live in their own house in the district of Pichari.

Since he was very little Teodosio loved to be in the country during the times when his parents were working in agriculture, so he followed in his parents' footsteps.  He feels grateful for the support that they continue offering him today, and with all that he learned he made forays into growing cacao, coffee, and citrus.

With the passing of time, little by little he increased his production and, although there are some inconveniences, he always is prepared to be able to handle them.  He continued in this job with the idea of embarking on a better future for his family and himself.  He almost always gets the help of his beloved wife and children, but occasionally he needs farmworkers.

He sells his product in the warehouses in the district of Pichari.  What he most desires is to acquire more land, with the goal of expanding his crops and producing in quantity and, consequently, having a better income.

This will be his second loan with MFP, and he is committed once again to making his payments punctually.

With the 2000 PEN he is requesting, he will hire farmworkers to help him clear and fertilize his plot of land.

loans.use: to hire farmworkers.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Don Victor, continua con sus ventas de repuesto automotriz, siendo este negocio rentable,  el cual lo hace ambulante y fijo en su casa. pues ha captado su clientela. Su esposa lo ayuda y su hijo estudia.
Para el este medio de financiamiento,le ha mejorado en lo personal, habitacional, y en la inversion de su negocio, siendo el noveno credito,  avanzando mas rapido en la mejora de su casa.
Con el credito anterior logro terminar muro e hizo una mejoras a su cuarto, ya que tambien con las ganancias de su trabajo se le hace posible. 
Hoy con este nuevo financiamiento terminara la construccion de su porche, ponerle techo, verjas, puertas y piso. Y poder tener mas espacio y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Don Victor continues with his sales of automotive parts, as it is a profitable business which he plies as a street vendor as well as from home given that he has secured his customer base. His wife helps him and his son attends school. 

This means of financing has improved things for him personally, in terms of housing, and in the investment in his business, this being the ninth loan, he making more rapid progress in the improvements to his home. 

With the previous loan he was able to finish the walls and made some improvements to his room, since the earnings from his work also make this possible for him. Today with this new loan he will finish building his porch, installing a roof, railings, doors and floor. Thus he will have more room and greater well-being for his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for finishing a porch, achieving space and well-being for his family.

loans.name: Benelin

texts.en:
Benelin is 46 years old and blessed with two children who are students.  To provide for their needs, Benelin and her husband are farmers.  

It is difficult to engage in this kind of business because it requires hard work and patience.

Benelin acquired these characteristics but feels financial constrained.  She is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy inputs needed in their business.  She will buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and pay to hired worker to help on their farm land. 

She will utilize her loan to make her business progress.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and pay to hired worker to help on their farm land.

loans.name: Imaly

texts.en:
Imaly is 51 and she resides in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband sell groceries. 

Imaly is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to purchase more groceries to stock the store. She will also buy a motorbike for the family to use. This will enable her family to generate more income and also decrease their public transportation expenses. In the future, Imaly would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell and a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has eight children.
 
Lydia has a shop that buys and sells coconuts after making them into copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production). She has had this business for seven years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy coconuts to sell.

Lydia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Lydia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a resident and a farmer in Western Kenya where she has been practicing mixed farming and selling milk, maize and kale to the local market. She is married with five children with four already in school.

Teresa has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the income will be used to improve the living standards of her children. She also wants to buy more land for intensive farming for better income. 

She says the common problems such as diseases and unreliable rainfall remains their main challenge.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Prang

texts.en:
Mrs. Prang, 50, is a mother of six children, living together with them in the Baray district. To earn a living, she grows rice and raises some piglets in a wooden pigpen behind her home, while her husband transports and sells firewood from his trailer. This couple has worked very hard for their children, especially their last-born child who is attending school. Prang intends to send him to a university after he finishes high school. 

And now Prang would like to borrow her second loan from HKL to purchase a buffalo that can be used both for working on her farm and hauling the trailer. This loan will improve her business and enable her to generate additional profit. She will save the income generated from her business to buy a plow to develop her farming work towards greater success.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo.

loans.name: Nelda Isabel

texts.es: Neida de 69 años es una mujer con una excelente vitalidad y disposición para los negocios, ella aprendió de su familia el oficio de la panadería y hace 10 años emprendió su propio negocio desde casa, aunque su experiencia es de 30 años en esta labor, ella ofrece exclusivamente productos de repostería: pudines, postres, panes de bono, pastelería francesa y galletería. Se encuentra separada de su cónyuge y asumió el rol de madre soltera de tres hijos a quienes entregó todo su amor y dedicación para que hoy en día sean unos hombres ejemplares. Esta dama labora cuatro días a la semana durante seis horas continuas en la elaboración de sus productos y en la actualidad desea renovar su indumentaria, así que realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo y comprar un horno e insumos de repostería. Esta inversión mejorará sus condiciones laborales y garantizará un mejor producto. A futuro Neida proyecta tener mejores ingresos y mejorar su capital de trabajo gracias a esta inversión.

loans.use: comprar un horno e insumos de repostería.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Esther would like to buy animal feeds for her cows

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is married and has a grown son. He runs a small business providing personal vehicle owners and enthusiasts with vehicle related products. Currently, he has built up around $6,000 in working capital and has a monthly net profit of around $500. Sergey is very knowledgeable and professional in his trade and relates well with his car-loving customers. He tries to conduct his business to provide a minimum hassle experience. Sergey has a talent for making every customer feel valued and appreciated, even after the sales process is complete. Many times he will offer after-sales help such as assisting with an installation. This also helps him stay competitive in a tough auto parts sales market. Sergey would like to receive a loan of $1,200 for a couple purposes. First of all, he is planning to do some electrical improvements to his vending facility. Secondly, he would like to get a better supply of spare parts to sell, such as radiators, crankshafts, generators and starters for different types of vehicles. Sergey believes that good parts availability and reasonable prices will help many of his clients obtain the items they need and accomplish their repair goals, which will help him maintain his leading position in the market and continue to expand his business.

Сергій – одружений, в нього є дорослий син. Він – власник бізнесу з продажу автозапчастин та аксесуарів. Зараз в Сергія приблизно 6000 робочого капіталу, щомісячний чистий прибуток складає приблизно 500 доларів. Сергій знається на своїй справі, дуже професійно підходить до роботи, ввічливо обслуговує кожного автолюбителя. Він намагається не завдавати зайвого клопоту покупцеві. Його клієнти відчувають, що їх цінують та піклуються про них, навіть після укладання угоди. Часто Сергій пропонує своїм покупцям допомогу з встановленням обладнання. Саме ці якості допомагають йому залишатися конкурентноспроможним на ринку торгівлі автозапчастинами. Сергій просить про позику в 1200 доларів, бо в нього декілька цілей. По-перше, він планує покращити електричне оснащення свого торгового приміщення. По-друге, він хотів би закупити більше автозапчастин, а саме, радіаторів, коленвалів, генераторів та стартерів для різних видів транспортних засобів. Сергій вважає, що широкий вибір автозапчастин та помірні ціни допоможуть багатьом клієнтам отримати необхідні матеріали та зробити потрібний ремонт, а йому, в свою чергу допоможуть утримати лідируючу позицію на ринку та розширити власний бізнес.

loans.use: To improve his vending pavilion and purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grace would like to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana C. Pelicó is a member of a group of women who all rent little plots of land to grow crops for a little bit of supplemental cash. Juliana rents her little plot of just a single cuerda for about US$158/year, and grows ornamental flowers like daisies and carnations. She'll invest this loan in seed, fertilizer, and pesticides. Her little business brings in only about 15% of her income, so she also works extensively in the fields of others to support her five children.

Juliana, 45, has two children aged 13 and 17. The oldest did not go to school, but the 13-year-old is now in fifth grade, a major step forward for the family, and a significant economic sacrifice. Juliana herself never had any schooling, cannot read or write, and speaks only a smattering of Spanish, since day-to-day conversations are carried out in her native Quiché language.

Women's group: "De la Cruz" in La Estancia de la Cruz, Quetzaltenango

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticides for flower crop

location.town: La Estancia de la Cruz, Quetzaltenango

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
My name is Balqees S.. I have six children, all of whom are enrolled in school. My husband and I make paper envelopes. We both have been working very hard throughout our lives to realize our dream of educating all our children. Now we are in a position where we do not now how we will manage to send our children to university, as it is very expensive. Before this time comes, we want to make our business generate a better income and are seeking a loan $400 to purchase more materials to sell in  the market. 
Balqees S.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Ema

texts.en: Ema J. is 29 years old and married. She has a small shop that sells snacks and a few household goods. She usually earns $10 per day with a small profit. Her husband is an employee and earns about $33 per week. Ema would like a loan of $150 (IDR 1,200,000)  to buy more goods for her shop. She's a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods and complete her shop

loans.name: Suleyman

texts.en: Suleyman T. owns and operates a small stand in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He sells a mixture of items but mainly sells items relating to the Muslim religion. Suleymon has been operating this business for the past nine years and is married with four kids. He is currently looking for funding in the amount of $1,200 so that he can expand and diversify his inventory.

loans.use: To increase and diversify inventory

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is 46 years old. She is married and is the loving mother of three wonderful kids. Her husband is a pensioner.

To support her family, Sharifa sells children's clothing. She has been in this business for 14 years. Through the years, she has gained experience in choosing goods of fine quality that will meet the requirements of clients with various levels of income. The business is very stable and allows Sharifa to improve her family's lifestyle.

Sharifa has been working with IMON for more than 3 years. She managed her previous loans with accuracy and made all the payments in a timely manner. Today, Sharifa requests $1,000.00 USD in order to buy children's clothing for the winter season to sell. Sharifa would like to thank everyone supporting her and to ensure that she shall repay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to sell for children in the winter season

loans.name: Blacina Amanda

texts.es:
Blacina is a native of the borough of Villanuevo in the Nicaraguan city of Chinandega. For 3 years, she's operated a small general store that she set up in a room of her house. She's a single mother of a son and she drives herself hard every day to make sure that he's healthy, able to go to school and safely housed.

The business was born when Blacina realized that her old business, raising and selling farm animals, wasn't providing enough income. She decided to invest her small savings in opening the store. Thanks to the loans provided by CEPRODEL, she's managed to improve both her business and her young son's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Blacina T. es una dama originaria del municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega de Nicaragua. Se dedica desde hace 3 años al negocio de pulpería el cual está ubicado en su casa de habitaron. Es madre soltera y con la responsabilidad de un hijo el cual es el motivo para que se esfuerce cada día mas para brindarle salud, educación y un techo digno donde habitar.

El negocio nace cuando se da cuenta que su antiguo negocio de ganadería no le cubría para sus necesidades por lo que decide invertir sus pocos ahorros en los productos de la pulpería. Hoy en día gracias a los créditos que le ha brindado CEPRODEL ha logrado mejorar su negocio surtiendo sus productos y a su vez ha mejorado la condición de vida de su pequeño hijo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Abduaziz

texts.ru:
Abduaziz T. is a 35 year old man, who is married and has three children. His wife stays at home. Abduaziz has a workshop, where he produces wooden utencils and other kitchen tools such as rolling-pin and bolten. He has been in this business for the last 10 years. Currently, he employs his brother as a helper. After production, he sells his products in bulk to individual sellers on a market, where there is a large demand for his products. Abduaziz is asking for a loan, so he could purchase raw materials, namely wood, for his business.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Таджибаев Абдуазиз мужчина в возросте 35 лет имеет 3 детей , жена домохозяйка.Абдуазиз на дому имеет цех по производству деревянных приборов по дому, для кухни скалка для теста, толчанка,сито.Уже 10 лет как он занимается этим бизненсом.Сейчас у него в цеху работает брат помощником.После изготовления он оптом здает товар на базаре.Его товар пользуется большим спросом. Абдуазиз хочет закупить материал для производства,древесину,для чего обратился в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Production of wooden tools

loans.name: Marilú

texts.es:
After having spent many years of her life working as a street vendor, Marilu has recently established a small business selling general consumer products in a space in her home. The urgent needs of her developing children and her husband’s departure have injected her with much strength and fortitude to continue with her work. She wishes to increase the quantity of her products and make her store more popular, that is the reason for her request of a loan to grow her small space where she works every day.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Después de haber dedicado muchos años de su vida al comercio ambulatorio, Marilú se acaba de establecer con su pequeño negocio de venta de artículos de primera necesidad en un espacio de su hogar. La necesidad apremiante de sus hijos en pleno desarrollo y el abandono de su esposo le han inyectado mucha fuerza y entereza para continuar con su labor.Desea incrementar la cantidad de sus productos y popularizar los servicios de su tienda, por ese motivo solicita un préstamo para consolidar su pequeño espacio de labor diaria.

loans.use: Injection of capital to improve the offerings and products of her store.

loans.name: Muayat

texts.id:
Everyday from 5:00 am to 2:00 pm, Muayat works as a garbage man, who collects and transports household garbage from his neighborhood. He earns $10 monthly, which is insufficient to meet his daily needs. Thus, he also collects used items, which can be weighed and resold. In addition, Muayat buys used items from his neighbors and stores them in a storage at his house. Fortunately, he doesn't have to support his two children, who are already married. Right now, Muayat only lives with his wife, Anik.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Setiap hari, mulai jam 5 pagi sampai jam 2 siang Muayat bekerja sebagai tukang sampah, dimana dia bertugas mengumpulkan dan mengangkut sampah rumah tangga milik warga sekitarnya. Setiap bulannya dia dibayar Rp.100.000.- Tetapi karena penghasilan dari tukang sampah tidak mencukupi kebutuhan hidupnya, dia juga harus mengumpulkan barang-barang bekas lalu kemudian ditimbang dan dijual lagi. Selain mengumpulkan, Muayat juga membeli dari tetangga sekitarnya kemudian dikumpulkan di gudang dirumahnya. Untungnya dia tidak harus membiayai kedua anaknya karena semuanya sudah menikah. Sekarang ini Muayat hanya tinggal berdua bersama dengan istrinya Anik.

loans.use: To add business capital

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys works as a math teacher and she lives with her daughter and grandson in her own house, located in Villa Mercedario in the city of El Alto. This is a zone on the outskirts of the city where there are a lot of new buildings.

The credit will go towards buying construction materials as she needs to make and finish off many home improvements; in this way she will have a home of a reasonable quailty which will be more comfortable for her whole family.

This is her second credit with Impro and her good track record with regards to payments means that she qualifies to make another loan application.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Gladys, trabaja en el magisterio como profesora de matemáticas, vive con su hija y su nieto en su casa propia, ubicada en la Villa Mercedario de la Ciudad de El Alto, zona alejada de la Ciudad de El Alto donde existen muchas construcciones nuevas. El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materia de construcción, pues le falta mucha mejoras a su vivienda que poco a poco la está concluyendo; de esa forma contará con una vivienda de mediana calidad que les de más confort a toda la familia. Es el segundo crédito con Impro y el buen comportamiento de pago la califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: To buy building materials to make some home improvements and thereby offer her family a better quality of life/Compra de materiales de construccion para efectuar mejoras a su vivienda y poder ofrecer  mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia S., 26, is married with three children. She has many years of experience in the printing design business. She sells her wares in the village five days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~100 USD). SPBD loans are Alicia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan through traditional banks. She will use the loan to purchase supplies for her printing design business.

loans.use: Purchase paints, brushes, broom, cardboard for design, lavalava in different colours and other materials for her printing design business.

loans.name: Hang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hằng năm nay 30 tuổi, gia đình chị hiện có hai con đang tuổi đến trường. Tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương vòng vốn đầu chị vay 1.000.000đ để đầu tư vào buôn bán nhỏ cho thu nhập khoảng 500.000đ/ tháng. Đến nay qua 5 năm làm kinh doanh gia đình chị đã tích luỹ được nhiều kinh nghiệm hơn và sử dụng vốn cũng hiệu quả hơn. Hiện tại 2 vợ chồng chị đều đi buôn gia cầm từ các trang trại về bán cho các nhà hàng , người tiêu dùng tại địa phương. Công việc cho thu nhập ổn định 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Ngoài ra anh chị còn kết hợp chăn nuôi lợn gà tại gia đình vì thế thu nhập của gia đình anh chị ngày càng ổn định và phát triển.Anh chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000 đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, buôn bán phát triển kinh tế gia đình.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Mrs. Hang, 30 year old, has 2 children at school age. Joining TYM, she made the first loan of 1,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to invest in retailing, whose revenue was about 500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. For 5 years of hard-working and constant studying, she and her husband have become experienced and used the loan more effectively. At the moment, they are buying poultries from local farms and selling them to restaurants, or local customers. This business brings in 2,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. Besides, they also raise pigs and chickens at home, so the family’s income is increasing securely. They plan to borrow 10,000,000 Vietnamese Dong for raising and the business.

loans.use: Poultry sales

loans.name: Pan

texts.en: Mrs. Pan S. lives in Khsom Village in Kandal Province, where she owns a small grocery store in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. She decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory in order to meet her consumers' demands. Her husband, Mr. Yoem Bunly, is a fortune teller, which typically generates an income of around $4 a day. Mrs. Pan S. is 38 years old and the mother of one child who is five years old.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods for her customers

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria sells cooked foods like rice, beans, yams and plantain. She has a fridge from which she sells drinks and water. Maria has been in this food business since 1996. Maria also sells kerosene.

Maria is 38 years old and married with four children. She and her family live in Ajegunle, Lagos State. Maria is a LAPO client and needs the loan amount of $850 to buy foodstuffs like rice, beans and yams in bulk - she says "thank you".

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Somaya

texts.en: Somaya is a 49 year old woman. She lives in a small village near Saida in southern Lebanon. She owns a small sewing shop.  She makes “Lebanese abaya” which is a typical Lebanese kind of dress. She also makes bed covers , and hair covers, or “hijab”. She wants a loan of 1000 US dollars in order to buy raw materials like thread, fabric etc. Somaya has been a micro-credit client for 2 years and has always paid on time.

loans.use: To buy new materials

loans.name: Husniya

texts.ru: Рахмонова Хусния жительница района Гиссар. Не замужем ,живет с родителями в селе. Занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Ее торговая точка находится на одном из рынков района. Бизнесом занимается уже 8 лет.Планирует получить кредит , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Кредит сможет погасить в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Husniya R. lives in the Gissar district. She is unmarried and lives with her parents in a small town. She sells groceries for a living. Her sales stall is in one of the markets of the district. She has been in this business for the past 8 years. She decided to take out credit in order to increase sales. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella O. is 40 years old, married and the mother of two children. Currently she has all her kids in school. Stella is an entrepreneur, and with lots of hard work she manages various businesses such as baking, selling costume jewelry, and selling ladies' slippers for the past 8, 2 and 6 years respectively. She sells in the community market of New Edubiase, a suburb of Obuasi where she lives with her household.

Stella enjoys selling and it is through this that she obtains her source of livelihood. She is requesting this loan to purchase more baking materials such as flour, margarine, sugar, etc., slippers and jewelry to bolster her stock. Stella believes that she can make lots of proceeds from the businesses especially this Christmas season where lots of her customers buy in bulk, and it is her desire to save more to give her kids a better future through quality education.

Stella belongs to the community group called Philippians Trust Group. Members in this group agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, baking flour, etc.

loans.name: Anwar M. Riaz Group

texts.en:
Anwar baji is a 53-year-old married lady and has resided in a city called Vehari, Pakistan for the past 15 years. She is an uneducated lady, but she doesn’t hesitate to mention the reason: she belongs to a poor family and due to their having few financial resources, she couldn’t go to school. Her husband's name is M. R. and he is a vegetable seller. He sells vegetables out of a cart, going to different places and communities to sell them.

Anwar baji has an animal-selling business. She has been in this work for the past 10 years. She sells various animals (sheep and goats) but specifically she sells goats to butcher shops and in animal markets as well. She uses her income to grow her husband’s business. She is applying for a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business.

Anwar baji is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy tools for repairing vehicles for her workshop. Parveen Akhtar baji and Samina Tariq baji want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Shakooran baji wants a loan to buy mason's tools. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy goats for re-sale

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en: Fouad, 49, lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Fouad works as a car repairer. He repairs and sells tires. Fouad is requesting a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase oil for his work and new tires. This is the first time that Fouad has requested a loan. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Fouad decided to go into this business because he wanted to be independent and to improve his income. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase oil and new tires

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Mrs. Chenda Y., 41, and her husband, Mr. Ravann Meas, 37, who live on an island on the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia, were married in 1990 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Besides her children, she also has her parents living with her.

Chenda has been weaving silk for nineteen years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been driving motor taxi for ten years. His motorbike does not carry many people and only earns a little income to support the family. Chenda is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike with a trailer (Tuk Tuk) for her husband to run his taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike with a trailer (Tuk Tuk) for her husband.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: B. Sarah is the leader of Gwokale group in Jinja. She is a business lady who runs a retail shop as her business, as well as keeping goats and sheep for a living. This is the 5th loan Sarah is taking from Pearl Microfinance, and she says the previous loans have helped her to expand her shop, increase the number of animals that she keeps, and have also enabled her to buy a plot of land on which she plans to build houses to rent. Sarah needs a loan to help her buy more of her shop products. In her shop she has sugar, muffins, soap, cooking oil and many other things for sale.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more products.

loans.name: Milagros Areli

texts.es: la Joven Milagros S. tiene 22 años de edad, vive en union libre con el Joven Ronery Alvarez con el cual han procreado un hijo de 7 meses de edad, el trabaja como bombero de una gasolinera y ella se dedica a la venta de pescado blanco, ella necesita el credito para comprarse un termo o hielera mucho mas grande en donde ella pueda meter su producto, ya que el que tiene es muy pequeño y las ventas son buenas y no le alcanza para guardar todo su producto, el sueño de ella es poder comprarse su propia casa.
texts.en:
Milagros S. is 22. She lives with Ronery Alvarez, and they have a 7 month old son. He works as an employee at a gas station as a pump attendant, and she sells whitefish. She needs a loan to buy a bigger thermos or ice cooler where she can put her product. The one she now has is very small. Sales are good, but she does not have enough space to keep all of her fish. Her dream is to be able to buy her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy a larger cooler

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: La señora Maria Esperanza M. Hernández, tiene la edad de 36 años,   habita en el barrio San Juan de la Concepción , junto a su esposo  el cual trabaja como lector de medidores de agua , ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos , una adolescente se 14 años y una varón de 12 años , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , ella desde hace 6 años se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas , ella inicio con sus propios esfuerzos , la mayor facultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y las plagas. Con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para mejorar el cultivo y obtener una mejor producción.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Esperanza M. Hernández is 36 years old and lives with her husband in the San Juan de la Concepción neighborhood. He works as a water-meter reader. They have two children: a fourteen-year-old girl and a twelve-year-old boy. The family has made plans to improve their standard of living. Since the age of six, she has worked as a farmer. She began to farm through her own efforts. The two biggest problems she faces are lack of financing and pests. With the loan she is going to buy fertilizers and consumables to improve cultivation and obtain better production.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural consumables to improve cultivation

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr: ANTA SAMB EST PARENT BENEFICIAIREDEPUIS PLUS DE CINQ ANS.ELLE A LONGTEMPS OPERE DANS LE DOMAINE DE LA FRIPPERIE OU ELLE CAPITALISE PLUSIEURS ANNEES D'EXPERIENCE.DESIRANT S'ORIENTER VERS LA VENTE DE TISSUS CE CREDIT LUI PERMETTRA DEDIVERSIFIER SON ACTIVITE.
texts.en:
Anta S. has been a member for more than 5 years. She has been working selling used clothes for a long time. She has the advantage of several years of experience and wants to move in the direction of selling cloth. This loan will permit her to diversify her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her working capital

loans.name: Claricsa Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Claricsa del Socorro López, tiene la edad de 41 años, habita en el barrio , el edén , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , ella es madre soltera , tiene cuatro hijos , dos ya son casado y le apoyan con los gastos del hogar y los otros estudian todavía , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder terminar de construir su casa  desde hace 31 años doña Claricsa trabaja como agricultura , la mayor dificultad son las plagas invaden el cultivo  ya que por falta de financiamiento  no puede cubrir para funigar,  Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para obtener una mejor cosecha y poder tener mejores beneficios, ya que gracias Afodenic esta logrando poder salir adelante con sus proyecto.
texts.en:
Claricsa del Socorro López is 41 years old and lives in the El Edén neighborhood, which is located in the city of of Ticuantepe. She is a single mother to four children. Two of them are married and they help her with the household expenses. The others are still studying. Her plans for the future are to improve her living conditions and to be able to finish building her house. Claricsa has been working as a farmer for 31 years. The biggest difficulty is that pests invade the crop because, for lack of funds, she is unable to use pesticides. With the loan she will buy fertilizers and other inputs to obtain a better harvest and a better income. Thanks to Afodenic, she is able to make progress with her project.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other inputs to improve her crops

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is a fashion designer and she also sells tailoring materials. She is 38 years old and married, with 4 children. Felicia is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more tailoring materials. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials.

loans.name: Ni Luh Juliasih

texts.en: Ni Luh Juliasih (DNR.M-0574) is a 28-year-old female living in the town of Desa Perancak, Negara. She is married and has a school-aged child. Ni Luh Juliasih owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 150,000 IDR a month. In 2008, Ni Luh Juliasih joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 4,125,000 IDR which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her first from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Ni Luh Juliasih - (DNR.M-0574) merupakan 28 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Desa Perancak - Negara. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Luh Juliasih memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Luh Juliasih sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Luh Juliasih menghasilkan sekitar 150,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2008, Ni Luh Juliasih bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Luh Juliasih telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 4,125,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Luh Juliasih berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol A. is from the village of zone 1B, Del Carmen Iligan City. She is 32 and is married. To make a living, Mirasol owns & operates a business selling fruits in the local community. Mirasol has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Mirasol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mirasol is requesting 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Zone 1B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Patrón San Juan Evangelista Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Patrón San Juan Evangelista, se encuentra ubicado en departamento D. Huancavelica, comunidad caracterizada por ser solidaria y organizada. Los pobladores D. esta comunidad se dedican básicamente al comercio.

Clarisa, es casada y tiene 07 hijos. Clarisa se dedica a L. venta D. carne D. animales, lo cual lo hace en las ferias o las reparte a domicilio bajo pedido. Clarisa, solicita un préstamo D. S/500 soles, con los cuales comprará mas animales para continuar su venta D. carnes  y sementales para L. reproducción D. su ganado.

Anny, es Casada y tiene  03 hijos. ElL., se dedica a L. venta D. abarrotes, entre ellas  verdura y frutas. Gracias a sus préstamo, su negocio a podido crecer, cada día tiene mas productos que ofrecer, lo cual le genera mas ganancias. ElL. solicita un préstamo D. S/1,000 para L. compra D. víveres, con los cuales abastecería su pequeña bodega.

Iris, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Iris se dedica a L. venta D. prendas D. vestir, negocio que inicio tras L. muerte D. su madre y con el cual pudo mantener y educar a sus hermanos menores. Iris, solicita un préstamo D. S/1,000 con los cual comprara prendas D. vestir en L. capital.
texts.en:
The Patron San Juan Evangelista (“Patron Saint John the Evangelist”) Communal Bank is located in the department of Huancavelica, a community known for its solidarity and organization. Most of the local residents work in commerce. Clarisa is married and has seven children. Clarisa sells meat at different markets and also makes home deliveries on order. She is requesting a loan of 500 soles, which she will use to buy more animals for her meat selling business and stud bulls to breed with her cows. Anny is married and has three children. She sells basic grocery items, like fruits and vegetables. Thanks to her loan, she has expanded her business, and each day she has more products to offer her clients and earns a bit more. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles to buy groceries to stock her small store with. Iris is single and doesn’t have any children. Iris sells clothing, a business she launched after her mother’s death that has allowed her to care for and educate her younger siblings. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles to buy more clothing in the capital city of Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es: Marlon Antonio Chavarría Gómez tiene 40 años. Su actividad económica es la una pulpería. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, es un hombre muy trabajador y disfruta mucho conversar con sus vecinos, además con la ayuda de su esposa y sus 3 hijos, que asisten a un colegio público ya que ambos no cuentan con los recursos suficientes. Sin embargo son personas muy humildes y les gusta trabajar. El crédito se va invertir en la compra de jabón, detergentes, granos básicos, productos de limpieza entre otras cosas. Su deseo es llegar a poseer una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Marlon Antonio Chavarría Gómez is 40 years old. He runs a general store, which is located in his residence. He is a very hard-working man and really enjoys conversing with his neighbors. His wife helps him run the store as do their 3 children, who attend the public school. They lack sufficient resources; nevertheless, they are very humble people who like to work. The loan will be invested in the purchase of soap, detergent, basic grains, and cleaning products, among other things. His dream is to own a distribution company.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business capital

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet manages a small variety store located in the front of her house. She has been selling grocery items at retail prices. However, due to lack of capital, she has very limited stock of merchandise displayed in her store to sell. Therefore, she is now applying for a loan of 5,000 PHP. She will use the loan to purchase more grocery items for her store. She prays that her lenders will support her business to meet the needs of her children.

Juliet is 32 years old and is currently residing in district Progreso of Barangay Flores Naguilian, Isabela. She is married to Rhodienito, a policeman in their town. They are blessed with three children: two are already in school. "Time goes by so fast," says Juliet. Soon all her children will be entering school and, as much as possible, she wants to be prepared for their education. She really hopes for the approval of her loan, because it will help her a lot in restoring her business, which will also be very beneficial for her children.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Mrs. Sang S. is 55 years old and she lives in Sophy village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Chea Sa Roeun, is a palm juice collector. Now Mrs. Sang S. is asking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income to support the family living. She is a mother of four children, two of whom are construction workers while the others two are employed in a hotel and the remaining is attending the local school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income to support the family living.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a 38-year-old married woman and mother of one child. After having her first child, she decided to help her husband by working as a home-based tailor starting in 2000.

Today, Rima is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy more materials to increase her sales and so her income.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Jiguiya sont des femmes mariées qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de trente ans et quatre  enfants. Elles vivent dans des foyers polygames traditionnelles à Kéléya située à 100  kilomètres de Bamako (la capitale du Mali) et relevant de la préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et font essentiellement le commerce d’articles divers. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
Elles s’approvisionnent deux fois par mois au marché de Kéléya où elles vendent sur des  étales et en ambulant.
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, 25 cartons de savons, 400  litres de miel et 500  kilogrammes de divers condiments alimentaires.
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 32. 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser l’échéance du prêt et contribuer aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The women in the Jiguiya Group are married and have an average age of 30 and four children. They live in traditional polygamous households in Kéléya located 100 kilometres from Bamako (the capital of Mali) in the Bougouni Prefecture (the third administrative region of the republic of Mali).

They know each other through their neighbourly ties and they sell various items. They are on their fifth group loan with Soro Yiriwaso and all of their previous loans have been repaid correctly.

They stock up twice a month at the Kéléya market where they sell from stalls and as street traders.

With this loan they plan to buy 25 boxes of soap, 400 litres of honey and 500 kilogrammes of various condiments.

They hope to make an average monthly income of 32,000 FCFA that will be used to pay back the loan and contribute to family expenses.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items for resale

loans.name: Blanca Enith

texts.es:
El  Banco Comunal Fe y Progreso se formó en la  ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita en la costa de Ecuador, esta ciudad esta rodeada de ceibos y conocida por sus arboles de tamarindo y mangos, muchas mujeres hacen de Portoviejo su centro de negocios.

Blanca Jiménez de profesión modista vive  con su esposo de profesión taxista en la ciudadela california en la urbe de la ciudad, confecciona ropa para damas desde hace 30 años, tiene su taller en la misma casa, corta y arma los vestidos un promedio de 3 a 4 prendas por semana  todo depende del modelo que le pidan sus clientas, su labor empieza a las 8 de la mañana y no tiene hora fija de terminar  el trabajo, lo realiza de lunes a sábado.

El préstamo solicitado a la Fundación Espoir va a comprar telas, hilos, cierres, y todo en accesorios para adornar los vestidos, cuenta con 3 maquinas de coser, una para bordar y las otras para costura recta y zigzag,  da trabajo a  una persona que se encarga de bordar en pedrería los vestidos  de novias y quinceañeras, un vestido de novia esta valorado en 300 dólares todo depende de lo que tenga que invertir en cada uno.

EL sueño de Blanca  es tener  un taller más grande con operarias,  como  comprar una máquina para hacer trajes de baño que es lo que le hace falta  para dar un mejor servicio y captar más clientas.
texts.en:
The Faith and Progress Community Bank is in the city of Portoviejo on the coast of Ecuador. The city is surrounded by forest and is known for its mango and tamarind trees. Many women make Portoviejo their center of business. Blanca Jiménez is a dressmaker and lives with her husband, a taxi driver, in the city's California neighborhood. She has made women's dresses for the past thirty years and runs her shop out of her home. She makes an average of three to four dresses a week, depending on the styles her customers request. She starts her work at 8 in the morning and does not have a set hour for when she finishes, and she works Monday-Saturday. The loan she is requesting from Kiva partner Fundación Espoir will go toward the purchase of fabric, thread, zippers, and all kinds of accessories to decorate dresses. She has three sewing machines, one for embroidering and the other for straight stitch and zigzag. She employs one person who is in charge of gem embroidery for wedding and quinceañera gowns. One wedding gown is worth 300 dollars, depending on what she has to invest in each one. Blanca's dream is to have a much bigger shop of operations, like purchasing a machine that makes bathing suits, which is something she lacks, in order to provide a better service and attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, zippers, and all kinds of accessories to decorate the dresses she makes

loans.name: Roman

texts.es:
Roman, trabaja como procurador realizando tramites legales de todo tipo.
Vive en la zona de miraflores de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa alquilada.
El crédito será destinado para educación (pago de tutor, elaboración de tesis, tramites en el ministerio de educación y universidad, para obtener su titulo de abogado)
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, las ganas de superarse le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Roman works as a lawyer doing legal procedures of all kinds. He lives in the Miraflores region of the city of La Paz, in a rented house. The loan will be used for education (payment for a tutor, production of a thesis, procedures in the ministry of education and university, and to obtain his law degree). This is the first time he is requesting a loan with Impro. The desire to improve himself gives him the opportunity to obtain this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of a tutor, production of a thesis, ministry and university procedures for his law degree.
